Gene.name: Transcription Factor class C
Gene.functionSummary: Subunit of the transcription factor TFIIIC complex; involved in recruiting TFIIIB to chromatin for transcription of RNA genes by RNA polymerase III|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.phenotypeSummary: Essential gene; conditional mutants display abnormal protein distribution of condensin complex subunit proteins, Brn1p and Scc4p resulting in decreased association of these proteins with chromosomes; heterozygous null mutant shows a decreased rate of growth
Gene.briefDescription: Subunit of RNA polymerase III transcription initiation factor complex
Gene.description: Subunit of RNA polymerase III transcription initiation factor complex; part of the TauB domain of TFIIIC that binds DNA at the BoxB promoter sites of tRNA and similar genes; cooperates with Tfc6p in DNA binding; largest of six subunits of the RNA polymerase III transcription initiation factor complex (TFIIIC)
GO.Slim: DNA binding;nucleic acid binding transcription factor activity;transcription factor activity, protein binding

Gene.name: Vacuolar Protein Sorting
Gene.functionSummary: A GTPase binding protein anchor that is subunit of the CORVET endosomal tethering complex; involved in protein targeting during late endosome to vacuole transport|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutant accumulates RNA of proton and protein transporters (PMA1, PTR2), has strong defect in vacuolar fragmentation; reduced protein function results in defective golgi to vacuole transport, via the pre-vacuolar compartment (PVC) and enlarged vacuoles; haploinsufficient
Gene.briefDescription: Membrane-binding component of the CORVET complex
Gene.description: Membrane-binding component of the CORVET complex; involved in endosomal vesicle tethering and fusion in the endosome to vacuole protein targeting pathway; interacts with Vps21p; contains RING finger motif
Dubious open reading frame; unlikely to encode a functional protein, based on available experimental and comparative sequence data; completely overlaps verified gene SSA1/YAL005C

Gene.name: Stress-Seventy subfamily A
Gene.functionSummary: ATPase subunit of the chaperonin-containing T-complex (CCT, TriC); involved in protein folding, nuclear import, stress granule disassembly, and clathrin coat disassembly; localizes to many places in the cell, including the cell wall, vacuolar and plasma membranes, and the nucleus|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; both null and dominant negative mutants have an increased accumulation of prions; overexpression results in larger aggregates in fewer numbers; heterozygous diploid mutant had decreased fitness
Gene.briefDescription: ATPase involved in protein folding and NLS-directed nuclear transport
Gene.description: ATPase involved in protein folding and NLS-directed nuclear transport; member of HSP70 family; required for ubiquitin-dependent degradation of short-lived proteins; forms chaperone complex with Ydj1p; localized to nucleus, cytoplasm, cell wall; 98% identical to paralog Ssa2p with different functional specificity in propagation of yeast [URE3] prions, vacuolar-mediated degradations of gluconeogenesis enzymes; general targeting factor of Hsp104p to prion fibrils
GO.Slim: ATPase activity;RNA binding;hydrolase activity;unfolded protein binding

Gene.name: Emp24p/Erv25p Related Protein
Gene.functionSummary: Component of the COP II vesicle that is involved in ER to Golgi vesicle mediated transport of Gas1p and retention of Kar2 (BIP) in the ER|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutant is defective in Golgi-to-ER transport and protein processing
Gene.briefDescription: Member of the p24 family involved in ER to Golgi transport
Gene.description: Member of the p24 family involved in ER to Golgi transport; similar to Emp24p and Erv25p; role in misfolded protein quality control; forms a heterotrimeric complex with Erp1p, Emp24p, and Erv25p; localized to COPII-coated vesicles; ERP2 has a paralog, ERP4, that arose from the whole genome duplication

Gene.name: Function Unknown Now
Gene.functionSummary: Protein whose biological role is unknown; localized to the mitochondrial outer membrane in large scale studies|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; heterozygous null mutant shows decreased fitness; null mutant displays increased competitive fitness on minimal media; overexpression results in a G1 phase arrest or delay
Gene.description: Integral mitochondrial outer membrane (MOM) protein; dosage suppressor of an MDM10 null that reduces ERMES-related phenotypes, such as alterations in mitochondrial morphology, protein complex assembly, and lipid profile; dosage suppressor of MDM12, MDM34, and MMM1 null mutant growth defects; novel mechanism of MOM import involving Tom70p, the TOM complex, and the TIM23 complex, requiring mitochondrial membrane potential and processing by the IMP complex for correct biogenesis

Gene.name: SPOrulation
Gene.functionSummary: Subunit of the membrane Nem1-Spo7 phosphoprotein phosphatase complex involved in nuclear envelope organization and regulation of phospholipid biosynthesis; positive regulator of phosphatidate phosphatase|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null and conditional mutants have decreased sporulation efficiency; null mutants display abnormal nuclear and endoplasmic reticulum morpholgies; heterozygous null mutant displays decreased fitness
Gene.briefDescription: Putative regulatory subunit of Nem1p-Spo7p phosphatase holoenzyme
Gene.description: Putative regulatory subunit of Nem1p-Spo7p phosphatase holoenzyme; regulates nuclear growth by controlling phospholipid biosynthesis, required for normal nuclear envelope morphology, premeiotic replication, and sporulation

Gene.name: SWr Complex
Gene.description: Protein of unknown function; component of the SWR1 complex, which exchanges histone variant H2AZ (Htz1p) for chromatin-bound histone H2A; required for formation of nuclear-associated array of smooth endoplasmic reticulum known as karmellae

Gene.name: Disability in regulation of Expression of genes involved in Phospholipid biosynthesis
Gene.phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutant has increased acetylation of histone H4 and increased silencing at telomeres, rDNA and HMR loci
Gene.briefDescription: Component of the Rpd3L histone deacetylase complex
Gene.description: Component of the Rpd3L histone deacetylase complex; required for diauxic shift-induced histone H2B deposition onto rDNA genes; transcriptional modulator involved in regulation of structural phospholipid biosynthesis genes and metabolically unrelated genes, as well as maintenance of telomeres, mating efficiency, and sporulation

Gene.name: SYNtaxin
Gene.phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; vacuolar protein import is defective in the null mutant; null mutant has higher resistance to low pH
Gene.briefDescription: Endosomal SNARE related to mammalian syntaxin 8
Gene.description: Endosomal SNARE related to mammalian syntaxin 8

Gene.name: eNdonuclease Three-like Glycosylase
Gene.phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutant shows increased mutation rate and fails to increase mitochondrial genome copy number after oxidative stress;
Gene.description: DNA N-glycosylase and apurinic/apyrimidinic (AP) lyase; involved in base excision repair; acts in both nucleus and mitochondrion; creates a double-strand break at mtDNA origins that stimulates replication in response to oxidative stress; required for maintaining mitochondrial genome integrity; NTG1 has a paralog, NTG2, that arose from the whole genome duplication
GO.Slim: hydrolase activity;hydrolase activity, acting on glycosyl bonds;lyase activity;nuclease activity

Gene.name: Pas domain-containing Serine/threonine protein Kinase
Gene.phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene, but heterozygous diploid shows haploinsufficiency; null mutant shows increased fitness on synthetic media and increased life span
Gene.description: PAS domain-containing serine/threonine protein kinase; coordinately regulates protein synthesis and carbohydrate metabolism and storage in response to a unknown metabolite that reflects nutritional status; PSK1 has a paralog, PSK2, that arose from the whole genome duplication

Gene.name: Lipid Droplets in Sporulation
Gene.phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene, null mutant shows normal sporulation in large scale study and increased fitness on synthetic media
Gene.briefDescription: Protein Involved in spore wall assembly
Gene.description: Protein Involved in spore wall assembly; localizes to lipid droplets found on or outside of the prospore membrane; shares similarity with Lds2p and Rrt8p, and a strain mutant for all 3 genes exhibits reduced dityrosine fluorescence relative to the single mutants

Gene.name: Function Unknown Now
Gene.functionSummary: DNA-dependent ATPase that binds chromatin; involved in DNA double-strand break processing and heterochromatin maintenence by chromatin silencing at telomere, silent mating-type cassette, rDNA; localizes to centromeric regions of chromosomes|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene, null mutant shows decreased silencing at telomeres, rDNA and siilent mating loci and also chromosome segregation defects;
Gene.briefDescription: Snf2p family member with ATP-dependent chromatin remodeling activity
Gene.description: Snf2p family member with ATP-dependent chromatin remodeling activity; has a role in silencing at the mating type locus, telomeres and centromeres; enriched at centromeres and is required for correct chromatin structure around centromeres, as well as at the boundary element of the silent HMR; recruited to DNA double-strand breaks (DSBs) where it promotes 5' strand resection of DSBs; potential Cdc28p substrate

Gene.name: Alpha Tubulin Suppressor
Gene.phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutant displays sensitivity to heat, caffeine, and Calcofluor white but increased resistance to killer toxin; in large-scale studies, null mutant shows reduced competetive fitness in several different media and has abnormal tRNA modifications
Gene.briefDescription: Protein required for modification of wobble nucleosides in tRNA
Gene.description: Protein required for modification of wobble nucleosides in tRNA; acts with Elongator complex, Kti11p, and Kti12p; has a potential role in regulatory interactions between microtubules and the cell cycle; forms a stable heterodimer with Kti11p

Gene.name: Carbon Catabolite Repression
Gene.briefDescription: Component of the CCR4-NOT transcriptional complex
Gene.description: Component of the CCR4-NOT transcriptional complex; CCR4-NOT is involved in regulation of gene expression; component of the major cytoplasmic deadenylase, which is involved in mRNA poly(A) tail shortening

Gene.name: Function Unknown Now
Gene.functionSummary: Nicotinamide riboside transmembrane transporter; localizes to the vacuole membrane|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.briefDescription: High affinity, broad selectivity, nucleoside/nucleobase transporter
Gene.description: High affinity, broad selectivity, nucleoside/nucleobase transporter; vacuolar membrane localized transporter which may regulate the balance of nicotinamide riboside (NmR) levels between the cytosol and vacuole, contributing to salvage of NmR for use in cytosolic NAD+ synthesis; equilibrative nucleoside transporter (ENT) family member

Gene.name: Protein O-MannosylTransferase
Gene.phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutant is defective in ER-associated protein mannosylation and shows sensitivity to alkaline pH and inositol auxotrophy
Gene.briefDescription: Protein O-mannosyltransferase of the ER membrane
Gene.description: Protein O-mannosyltransferase of the ER membrane; transfers mannose residues from dolichyl phosphate-D-mannose to protein serine/threonine residues; involved in ER quality control; acts in a complex with Pmt1p, can instead interact with Pmt5p; antifungal drug target; PMT2 has a paralog, PMT3, that arose from the whole genome duplication
GO.Slim: transferase activity;transferase activity, transferring glycosyl groups

Gene.name: Low Temperature Essential
Gene.functionSummary: Putative guanyl-nucleotide exchange factor based on sequence similarity but without detectable activity; involved in vesicle-mediated transport, spindle orientation and mitotic exit; localizes to the bud|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutant shows cold sensitivity and defects in protein secretion; overexpression leads to slow growth and decreased fermentative metabolism
Gene.briefDescription: Protein similar to GDP/GTP exchange factors
Gene.description: Protein similar to GDP/GTP exchange factors; without detectable GEF activity; required for asymmetric localization of Bfa1p at daughter-directed spindle pole bodies and for mitotic exit at low temperatures

Gene.name: Deficiency of Ribosomal Subunits
Gene.functionSummary: Subunit of the Cdc50p-Drs2p phospolipid flippase complex; maintains membrane lipid asymmetry in post-Golgi secretory vesicles; contributes to clathrin-coated vesicle formation, endocytosis, protein trafficking between the Golgi and endosomal system and the cellular response to mating pheromone; localizes to the trans-Golgi network|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutant is sensitive to cell wall-damaging agents and metals, shows defects in protein transport through the Golgi
Gene.description: Trans-golgi network aminophospholipid translocase (flippase); maintains membrane lipid asymmetry in post-Golgi secretory vesicles; contributes to clathrin-coated vesicle formation, endocytosis, protein trafficking between the Golgi and endosomal system and the cellular response to mating pheromone; autoinhibited by its C-terminal tail; localizes to the trans-Golgi network; mutations in human homolog ATP8B1 result in liver disease

Gene.name: Single-strand Annealing Weakened
Gene.phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutant shows increased mitotic rDNA recombination and decreased competitive fitness
Gene.description: 5'- and 3'-flap DNA binding protein; recruits Rad1p-Rad10p to single-strand annealing intermediates with 3' non-homologous tails for removal during double-strand break repair; complexes with Rad1p-Rad10p and stimulates its endonuclease activity; green fluorescent protein (GFP)-fusion protein localizes to the nucleus

Gene.name: Functionally Related to TCP1
Gene.phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutant shows decreased competitive fitness and UV resistance, abnormal proton transport and vacuolar morphology
Gene.briefDescription: Tail-anchored ER membrane protein of unknown function
Gene.description: Tail-anchored ER membrane protein of unknown function; interacts with homolog Frt1p; promotes growth in conditions of high Na+, alkaline pH, or cell wall stress, possibly via a role in posttranslational translocation; potential Cdc28p substrate; FRT2 has a paralog, FRT1, that arose from the whole genome duplication

Gene.name: MYOsin
Gene.phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutant shows decreased mating efficiency and decreased competitive fitness; mutation in globular tails causes defects in localization of ASH1 mRNA
Gene.briefDescription: Type V myosin motor involved in actin-based transport of cargos
Gene.description: Type V myosin motor involved in actin-based transport of cargos; required for mRNA transport, including ASH1 mRNA, and facilitating the growth and movement of ER tubules into the growing bud along with She3p; MYO4 has a paralog, MYO2, that arose from the whole genome duplication

Gene.name: Suppressor of the Null allele of CAP
Gene.phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutant is defective in endocytosis; overexpression causes defects in actin cytoskeleton and abnormalities in cell cycle progression through G2
Gene.description: Vesicle membrane receptor protein (v-SNARE); involved in the fusion between Golgi-derived secretory vesicles with the plasma membrane; proposed to be involved in endocytosis; member of the synaptobrevin/VAMP family of R-type v-SNARE proteins; SNC1 has a paralog, SNC2, that arose from the whole genome duplication

Gene.name: Glc7 Interacting Protein
Gene.phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutant displays increased competitive fitness; overexpression causes abnormal budding and actin cytoskeleton and nuclear morphology
Gene.briefDescription: Cytoplasmic protein that regulates protein phosphatase 1 Glc7p
Gene.description: Cytoplasmic protein that regulates protein phosphatase 1 Glc7p; protein overexpression relocalizes Glc7p from the nucleus and prevents chromosome segregation; potential Cdc28p substrate

Gene.name: Function Unknown Now
Gene.functionSummary: Protein whose biological role and cellular location are unknown|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; in systematic studies, null mutant displays increased competitive fitness and decreased resistance to various chemicals but increased resistance to hydrogen chloride
Gene.description: Non-essential protein of unknown function; expression induced in response to heat stress; FUN19 has a paralog, YOR338W, that arose from the whole genome duplication

Gene.name: Function Unknown Now
Gene.functionSummary: Protein and ribosome binding GTPase involved in the formation of the cytoplasmic translation initiation complex and maturation of SSU-rRNA; involved in regulation of translational initiation; localizes to the cytosolic small ribosomal subunit and eukaryotic 48S pre initiation complex|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.phenotypeSummary: Gene variously reported to be essential or to cause a severe slow growth phenotype when deleted; null mutant accumulates 20S pre-rRNA; heterozygous null mutant displays decreased fitness
Gene.description: Translation initiation factor eIF5B; GTPase that promotes Met-tRNAiMet binding to ribosomes and ribosomal subunit joining; promotes GTP-dependent maturation of 18S rRNA by Nob1p; protein abundance increases in response to DNA replication stress; homolog of bacterial IF2
GO.Slim: GTPase activity;RNA binding;hydrolase activity;translation factor activity, RNA binding

Gene.name: RiBosome interacting Gtpase
Gene.phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutant displays increased competitive fitness and an extended hibernating lifespan
Gene.briefDescription: Member of the DRG family of GTP-binding proteins
Gene.description: Member of the DRG family of GTP-binding proteins; associates with translating ribosomes; interacts with Tma46p, Ygr250cp, Gir2p and Yap1p via two-hybrid

Gene.functionSummary: Protein whose biological role and cellular location are unknown|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.description: Putative protein of unknown function; YAL037W has a paralog, YOR342C, that arose from the whole genome duplication

Gene.name: CYtochrome C
Gene.phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutant shows greatly decreased rate of respiratory growth and decreased apoptosis; in large-scale studies null mutant shows sensitivity to ethanol, flucytosine, MMS, inability to utilize proline or glutamine as a nitrogen source, and displays decreased competitive fitness
Gene.briefDescription: Cytochrome c heme lyase (holocytochrome c synthase)
Gene.description: Cytochrome c heme lyase (holocytochrome c synthase); attaches heme to apo-cytochrome c (Cyc1p or Cyc7p) in mitochondrial intermembrane space; human homolog HCCS implicated in microphthalmia with linear skin defects (MLS), and can complement yeast null mutant

Gene.name: CycLiN
Gene.functionSummary: Cyclin-dependent protein kinase (CDK) regulatory subunit; regulates cell cycle passage by regulating G1/S phase transcription; regulates cell size and non-autophagic vacuole fusion; localizes to the nucleus|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; dominant hyperactive alleles result in decreased critical cell size at START, decreased duration of the G1 phase, increased alpha-factor resistance, transient pheromone-induced cell cycle arrest, reduced mating efficiency; null mutants have an increased critical cell size at START, increased duration of the G1 phase, elevated chromosome instability, and increased chronological lifespan; homozygous diploid nulls have an increased sporulation efficiency and enhanced pseudohyphal growth
Gene.briefDescription: G1 cyclin involved in cell cycle progression
Gene.description: G1 cyclin involved in cell cycle progression; activates Cdc28p kinase to promote G1 to S phase transition; plays a role in regulating transcription of other G1 cyclins, CLN1 and CLN2; regulated by phosphorylation and proteolysis; acetyl-CoA induces CLN3 transcription in response to nutrient repletion to promote cell-cycle entry; cell cycle arrest phenotype of the cln1 cln2 cln3 triple null mutant is complemented by any of human cyclins CCNA2, CCNB1, CCNC, CCND1, or CCNE1

Gene.name: ER Vesicle
Gene.description: Protein localized to COPII-coated vesicles; forms a complex with Erv41p; involved in the membrane fusion stage of transport

Gene.name: GlyCine cleaVage
Gene.briefDescription: H subunit of the mitochondrial glycine decarboxylase complex
Gene.description: H subunit of the mitochondrial glycine decarboxylase complex; glycine decarboxylase is required for the catabolism of glycine to 5,10-methylene-THF; also required for all protein lipoylation; expression is regulated by levels of 5,10-methylene-THF
Dubious open reading frame; unlikely to encode a functional protein, based on available experimental and comparative sequence data; almost completely overlaps YAL044W-A

Gene.name: Altered Inheritance of Mitochondria
Gene.functionSummary: Protein whose biological role and cellular location are unknown|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutant displays decreased competitive fitness in media containing either fermentable or non-fermentable carbon sources; null mutant displays an increased frequency of spontaneous mitochondrial genome loss and elevated levels of Rnr3p, indicative of genome instability; null mutant is defective in biofilm formation; null mutant displays increased survival following a ramped heat stimulus; null mutant displays a reduction in the delivery of a plasma membrane reporter to the cell surface; heterozygous null mutant is haploinsufficient
Gene.briefDescription: Protein involved in mitochondrial function or organization
Gene.description: Protein involved in mitochondrial function or organization; null mutant displays elevated frequency of mitochondrial genome loss

Gene.name: Spindle Pole Component
Gene.description: Gamma-tubulin small complex (gamma-TuSC) receptor; recruits the gamma-TuSC complex to the cytoplasmic side of the SPB, connecting nuclear microtubules to the SPB; involved in astral microtubule formation, stabilization, and with Stu2p, anchoring astral MTs at the cytoplasmic face of the SPB, and regulating plus-end MT dynamics; regulated by Cdc5 kinase

Gene.name: GTPase EF-hand protein of Mitochondria
Gene.briefDescription: Outer mitochondrial membrane GTPase, subunit of the ERMES complex
Gene.description: Outer mitochondrial membrane GTPase, subunit of the ERMES complex; potential regulatory subunit of the ERMES complex that links the ER to mitochondria and may promote inter-organellar calcium and phospholipid exchange as well as coordinating mitochondrial DNA replication and growth; cells lacking Gem1p contain collapsed, globular, or grape-like mitochondria; ortholog of metazoan Miro GTPases

Gene.name: Altered Inheritance rate of Mitochondria
Gene.functionSummary: Protein whose biological role is unknown; localized to the cytoplasm|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutant displays a decreased frequency of spontaneous mitochondrial genome loss; null mutant is ethanol sensitive; null mutant displays increased survival following a ramped heat stimulus; overexpression results in decreased filamentous group and an inability to undergo invasive growth
Gene.briefDescription: Cytoplasmic protein involved in mitochondrial function or organization
Gene.description: Cytoplasmic protein involved in mitochondrial function or organization; null mutant displays reduced frequency of mitochondrial genome loss; potential Hsp82p interactor

Gene.name: Oleate-Activated transcription Factor
Gene.functionSummary: Subunit of the heterodimeric Pip2-Oaf1 complex, which binds to promoter proximal elements upstream of genes involved in peroxisomal proliferation, functioning as a transcriptional activator in the presence of oleate; regulates chromatin silencing at telomeres|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.description: Oleate-activated transcription factor; subunit of a heterodimeric complex with Pip2p, which binds to oleate-response elements (ORE) in the promoter of genes involved in beta-oxidation of fatty acids, peroxisome organization and biogenesis, activating transcription in the presence of oleate; regulates chromatin silencing at telomeres; involved in diauxic shift; OAF1 has a paralog, PIP2, that arose from the whole genome duplication
GO.Slim: DNA binding;nucleic acid binding transcription factor activity

Gene.name: FLavin Carrier
Gene.briefDescription: Putative calcium channel involved in calcium release under hypotonic
Gene.description: Putative calcium channel involved in calcium release under hypotonic stress; required for uptake of FAD into endoplasmic reticulum; involved in cell wall maintenance; FLC2 has a paralog, YOR365C, that arose from the whole genome duplication

Gene.name: Acetyl CoA Synthetase
Gene.functionSummary: Acetyl-CoA ligase with role in acetyl-CoA synthesis; localizes in the cytosol|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutant shows decreased fermentative growth and is incapable of respiratory growth on non-fermentable carbon sources
Gene.description: Acetyl-coA synthetase isoform; along with Acs2p, acetyl-coA synthetase isoform is the nuclear source of acetyl-coA for histone acetylation; expressed during growth on nonfermentable carbon sources and under aerobic conditions

Gene.name: PEroXisome related
Gene.functionSummary: Protein that binds to Pex4p and activates its E2 ubiquitin-conjugating activity, promoting recycling of the peroxisomal import receptor Pex5p; also stimulates Pex4p and autoubiquitination activity; localized to the peroxisomal membrane|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.description: Putative peroxisomal membrane protein; required for import of peroxisomal proteins; functionally complements a Pichia pastoris pex22 mutation

Gene.phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutant is auxotrophic for myo-inositol, has a pseudohyphal growth defect, small cell size in saturated culture, decreased basal and acquired ethanol tolerance, and decreased acquired therotolerance; diploid null mutant is haploinsufficient, and has a sporulation defect
Gene.description: Multistep regulator of cAMP-PKA signaling; inhibits PKA downstream of Gpa2p and Cyr1p, thereby increasing cAMP dependency; inhibits Ras activity through direct interactions with Ira1p/2p; regulated by G-alpha protein Gpa2p; GPB2 has a paralog, GPB1, that arose from the whole genome duplication

Gene.name: CalNExin and calreticulin homolog
Gene.phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutant has decreased competitive fitness, is auxotrophic for myo-inositol, displays increased chitin deposition and increased activation of the cell wall integrity (CWI) pathway
Gene.description: Calnexin; integral membrane ER chaperone involved in folding and quality control of glycoproteins; chaperone activity is inhibited by Mpd1p, with which Cne1p interacts; 24% identical to mammalian calnexin; Ca+ binding not yet shown in yeast

Gene.name: ExtraCellular Mutant
Gene.phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutant has decreased competitive fitness, displays defective accumulation of 60S ribosomal subunits; null mutant also has increased heat shock resistance, and decreased resistance to various stressors including acid pH, calcofluor white and tunicamycin
Gene.briefDescription: Pre-ribosomal factor involved in 60S ribosomal protein subunit export
Gene.description: Pre-ribosomal factor involved in 60S ribosomal protein subunit export; associates with the pre-60S particle; shuttles between the nucleus and cytoplasm

Gene.name: Butanediol DeHydrogenase
Gene.phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutant displays decreased accumulation of (R,R)-butane-2,3-diol and acetoin; null mutant shows filamentous growth defect; heterozygous null mutant displays decreased fitness
Gene.description: NAD-dependent (R,R)-butanediol dehydrogenase; catalyzes oxidation of (R,R)-2,3-butanediol to (3R)-acetoin, oxidation of meso-butanediol to (3S)-acetoin, and reduction of acetoin; enhances use of 2,3-butanediol as an aerobic carbon source

Gene.phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutant displays decreased competitive fitness and sensitivity to hyperosmotic stress; heterozygous null mutant displays decreased fitness and decreased resistance to starvation
Gene.briefDescription: Putative medium-chain alcohol dehydrogenase with similarity to BDH1
Gene.description: Putative medium-chain alcohol dehydrogenase with similarity to BDH1; transcription induced by constitutively active PDR1 and PDR3

Gene.name: Glutamate DeHydrogenase
Gene.phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutant displays decreased competitive fitness, decreased growth in ethanol containing media and increased sensitivity to calcofluor white
Gene.description: NADP(+)-dependent glutamate dehydrogenase; synthesizes glutamate from ammonia and alpha-ketoglutarate; rate of alpha-ketoglutarate utilization differs from Gdh1p; expression regulated by nitrogen and carbon sources; GDH3 has a paralog, GDH1, that arose from the whole genome duplication

Gene.name: Topoisomerase I Damage Affected
Gene.functionSummary: Protein whose biological role and cellular location are unknown|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutant displays increased competitive fitness; haploinsufficient
Gene.description: Putative protein of unknown function; null mutant is sensitive to expression of the top1-T722A allele; not an essential gene

Gene.functionSummary: Protein whose biological role and cellular location are unknown|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.description: Putative protein of unknown function; shows sequence similarity to FLO1 and other flocculins
Dubious open reading frame; unlikely to encode a functional protein, based on available experimental and comparative sequence data

Gene.name: Suppressor of sulfoxyde EthiOnine resistance
Gene.functionSummary: Putative transporter based on sequence similarity to membrane transporter gene families|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.description: Putative permease; member of the allantoate transporter subfamily of the major facilitator superfamily; mutation confers resistance to ethionine sulfoxide

Gene.name: seriPAUperin
Gene.description: Protein of unknown function; member of the seripauperin multigene family encoded mainly in subtelomeric regions

Gene.name: Emp24p/Erv25p Related Protein
Gene.phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutant shows slow growth, defects in protein processing, increased resistance to azole antifungals; increased fitness on nonfermentable carbon sources
Gene.briefDescription: Member of the p24 family involved in ER to Golgi transport
Gene.description: Member of the p24 family involved in ER to Golgi transport; role in misfolded protein quality control; forms heterotrimeric complex with Erp2p, Emp24p, and Erv25p; localized to COPII-coated vesicles; ERP1 has a paralog, ERP6, that arose from the whole genome duplication

Gene.name: NUclear Pore
Gene.phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutant displays defects in nuclear export and localization of mRNAs
Gene.briefDescription: FG-nucleoporin component of central core of the nuclear pore complex
Gene.description: FG-nucleoporin component of central core of the nuclear pore complex; contributes directly to nucleocytoplasmic transport and maintenance of the nuclear pore complex (NPC) permeability barrier and is involved in gene tethering at the nuclear periphery; relocalizes to the cytosol in response to hypoxia; both NUP1 and NUP60 are homologous to human NUP153

Gene.name: Set1c, WD40 repeat protein
Gene.phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutant displays defects in chromosome maintenance and dynamics, increased accumulation of glycogen and increased flocculation
Gene.description: Subunit of the COMPASS (Set1C) complex; COMPASS methylates histone H3 on lysine 4 and is required in transcriptional silencing near telomeres; WD40 beta propeller superfamily member with similarity to mammalian Rbbp7

Gene.name: BUD site selection
Gene.description: Protein involved in bud-site selection; Bud14p-Glc7p complex is a cortical regulator of dynein; forms a complex with Kel1p and Kel2p that regulates Bnr1p (formin) to affect actin cable assembly, cytokinesis, and polarized growth; diploid mutants display a random budding pattern instead of the wild-type bipolar pattern; relative distribution to the nucleus increases upon DNA replication stress

Gene.name: ADEnine requiring
Gene.functionSummary: Phosphoribosylaminoimidazolesuccinocarboxamide synthase involved in the biosynthesis of purine nucleotides|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutant displays adenine auxotrophy and forms red colonies
Gene.description: N-succinyl-5-aminoimidazole-4-carboxamide ribotide synthetase; required for 'de novo' purine nucleotide biosynthesis; red pigment accumulates in mutant cells deprived of adenine; protein abundance increases in response to DNA replication stress

Gene.name: protein KINase
Gene.description: Nonessential serine/threonine protein kinase; possible role in DNA damage response; influences tolerance to high levels of ethanol

Gene.name: seriPAUperin family
Gene.functionSummary: Protein whose biological role and cellular location are unknown|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.briefDescription: Member of the seripauperin multigene family
Gene.description: Member of the seripauperin multigene family; active during alcoholic fermentation, regulated by anaerobiosis, inhibited by oxygen, repressed by heme

Gene.functionSummary: Protein whose biological role and cellular location are unknown|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.description: Putative integral membrane protein; member of DUP240 gene family

Gene.name: Ulp1 Interacting Protein
Gene.functionSummary: Protein whose biological role is unknown; localized to the nuclear envelope in large scale studies|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.briefDescription: Putative integral membrane protein of unknown function
Gene.description: Putative integral membrane protein of unknown function; interacts with Ulp1p at the nuclear periphery; member of DUP240 gene family

Gene.functionSummary: Protein whose biological role is unknown; localized to the vacuole membrane in large scale studies|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.description: Putative integral membrane protein; member of DUP240 gene family; GFP-fusion protein is induced in response to the DNA-damaging agent MMS

Gene.functionSummary: Protein whose biological role is unknown; localizes to the cytoplasm|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.briefDescription: Member of DUP240 gene family but contains no transmembrane domains
Gene.description: Member of DUP240 gene family but contains no transmembrane domains; green fluorescent protein (GFP)-fusion protein localizes to the cytoplasm in a punctate pattern

Gene.name: FLOcculation
Gene.phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutation blocks flocculation while overexpression increases it; null mutant is sensitive to ethanol and oxidative stress, and shows reduced competitive fitness in minimal medium
Gene.description: Lectin-like protein involved in flocculation; cell wall protein that binds mannose chains on the surface of other cells, confers floc-forming ability that is chymotrypsin sensitive and heat resistant; important for co-flocculation with other yeasts, mediating interaction with specific species; FLO1 has a paralog, FLO5, that arose from a segmental duplication

Gene.name: ExtraCellular Mutant
Gene.functionSummary: Protein whose biological role is unknown; localized to cytoplasm and nucleus in large scale studies|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.description: Non-essential protein of unknown function; likely exists as tetramer, may be regulated by the binding of small-molecule ligands (possibly sulfate ions), may have a role in yeast cell-wall biogenesis

Gene.name: Histone h Two B
Gene.description: Histone H2B; core histone protein required for chromatin assembly and chromosome function; nearly identical to HTB1; Rad6p-Bre1p-Lge1p mediated ubiquitination regulates reassembly after DNA replication, transcriptional activation, meiotic DSB formation and H3 methylation

Gene.name: Histone h Two A
Gene.description: Histone H2A; core histone protein required for chromatin assembly and chromosome function; one of two nearly identical (see also HTA1) subtypes; DNA damage-dependent phosphorylation by Mec1p facilitates DNA repair; acetylated by Nat4p

Gene.name: Pleiotropic Drug Resistance
Gene.functionSummary: Sequence specific DNA-binding polymerase II transcription factor that activates expression of genes involved in drug response|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutation confers resistance or sensitivity to various drugs; in large-scale studies, null mutation confers decreased competitive fitness in rich glucose medium, increased fitness in minimal medium, and altered resistance to a wide variety of drugs; overexpression causes slow growth
Gene.briefDescription: Transcriptional activator of the pleiotropic drug resistance network
Gene.description: Transcriptional activator of the pleiotropic drug resistance network; regulates expression of ATP-binding cassette (ABC) transporters through binding to cis-acting PDRE sites (PDR responsive elements); has a role in response to drugs and organic solvents; post-translationally up-regulated in cells lacking functional mitochondrial genome; involved in diauxic shift; relative distribution to nucleus increases upon DNA replication stress; APCC(Cdh1) substrate
GO.Slim: nucleic acid binding transcription factor activity

Gene.name: Low Dye Binding
Gene.functionSummary: Subunit of RSC chromatin remodeling complex, slides along DNA affecting nucleosome positioning and transcription regulation|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.briefDescription: Component of the RSC chromatin remodeling complex
Gene.description: Component of the RSC chromatin remodeling complex; interacts with Rsc3p, Rsc30p, Npl6p, and Htl1p to form a module important for a broad range of RSC functions

Gene.name: Synthetic Lethal with ABP1
Gene.phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutant is temperature sensitive, has a decreased growth rate, decreased competitive fitness in various growth media and a respiratory growth defect; homozygous diploid null mutant has abnormally round cells, a random budding pattern, cell size heterogeneity, actin cytoskeleton defects that are more pronounced at elevated temperature and defects in HU-induced filamentous growth; null mutant has an endocytotic defect, resulting in a reduction in the localization of Bud8p, and Rax2p to growing bud tips; null mutant displays decreased resistance to hyperosmotic and oxidative stress, metals, acid pH, and has decreased thermotolerance; chitin deposition is increased at least two fold in the null mutant
Gene.description: Cytoskeletal protein binding protein; required for assembly of the cortical actin cytoskeleton; interacts with proteins regulating actin dynamics and proteins required for endocytosis; found in the nucleus and cell cortex; has 3 SH3 domains

Gene.name: HIstone Regulation
Gene.functionSummary: Transcriptional corepressor that is part of the HIR complex; negatively regulates transcription of HTA1 and HTB1; involved in DNA-replication independent nucleosome assembly; localizes to the centromeric region of chromosomes|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.description: Subunit of the HIR complex; HIR is a nucleosome assembly complex involved in regulation of histone gene transcription; contributes to nucleosome formation, heterochromatic gene silencing, and formation of functional kinetochores
GO.Slim: DNA binding;chromatin binding;transcription factor activity, protein binding

Gene.phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutant homozygous diploid is sensitive to oxidative stress and unable to grow under respiratory growth conditions; overexpression causes cell cycle arrest at M phase and abnormal progression through G2 phase
Gene.description: Protein kinase; along with its paralog, ALK1, required for proper spindle positioning and nuclear segregation following mitotic arrest, proper organization of cell polarity factors in mitosis, proper localization of formins and polarity factors, and survival in cells that activate spindle assembly checkpoint; phosphorylated in response to DNA damage; ALK2 has a paralog, ALK1, that arose from the whole genome duplication; similar to mammalian haspins

Gene.functionSummary: Protein whose biological role is unknown; colocalizes with clathrin-coated vesicles in a large-scale study|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.description: Putative protein of unknown function; green fluorescent protein (GFP)-fusion protein colocalizes with clathrin-coated vesicles

Gene.name: Suppressor of Choline-Transport mutants
Gene.description: Glycerol 3-phosphate/dihydroxyacetone phosphate sn-1 acyltransferase; dual substrate-specific acyltransferase of the glycerolipid biosynthesis pathway; prefers 16-carbon fatty acids; similar to Gpt2p; gene is constitutively transcribed
Dubious open reading frame; unlikely to encode a functional protein, based on available experimental and comparative sequence data

Gene.name: Formyl-Methionyl-tRNA Transformylase
Gene.description: Methionyl-tRNA formyltransferase; catalyzes the formylation of initiator Met-tRNA in mitochondria; potential Cdc28p substrate

Gene.name: Acetyl CoA Hydrolase
Gene.phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutant grows slowly after a prolonged lag phase on acetate as a carbon source; in competitive growth studies, null mutant shows sensitivity to oxidative stress and benomyl, reduced competitive fitness and shortened chronological lifespan
Gene.description: Protein with CoA transferase activity; particularly for CoASH transfer from succinyl-CoA to acetate; has minor acetyl-CoA-hydrolase activity; phosphorylated; required for acetate utilization and for diploid pseudohyphal growth

Gene.name: carboxyPEPtidase Y-deficient
Gene.briefDescription: Type I transmembrane sorting receptor for multiple vacuolar hydrolases
Gene.description: Type I transmembrane sorting receptor for multiple vacuolar hydrolases; cycles between the late-Golgi and prevacuolar endosome-like compartments

Gene.name: APurinic/apyrimidinic eNdonuclease
Gene.phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutant shows increased mutation frequency and sensitivity to topoisomerase inhibitor beta-lapachone; in large-scale studies null mutants show no respiratory growth and reduced mitophagy
Gene.briefDescription: Class II abasic (AP) endonuclease involved in repair of DNA damage
Gene.description: Class II abasic (AP) endonuclease involved in repair of DNA damage; homolog of human HAP1 and E. coli exoIII

Gene.name: Proteolysis In Mitochondria
Gene.description: ATP-dependent Lon protease; involved in degradation of misfolded proteins in mitochondria; required for biogenesis and maintenance of mitochondria

Gene.name: NuCLear protein
Gene.phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutant is sensitive to elevated temperatures, oxidative stress, and multiple chemicals, including caffeine, benomyl, azole drugs, MMS, DMSO, and shows increased cell size and reduced transposition of Ty elements; null mutation also increases resistance to spermine and tunicamycin; overexpression causes resistance to rapamycin
Gene.description: S-adenosyl-L-methionine-dependent tRNA: m5C-methyltransferase; methylates cytosine to m5C at several positions in tRNAs and intron-containing pre-tRNAs; increases proportion of tRNALeu(CAA) with m5C at wobble position in response to hydrogen peroxide, causing selective translation of mRNA from genes enriched in TTG codon; loss of NCL1 confers hypersensitivity to oxidative stress; similar to Nop2p and human proliferation associated nucleolar protein p120

Gene.name: Ribosomal Protein of the Large subunit

GO.Slim: structural constituent of ribosome;structural molecule activity

Gene.functionSummary: Protein whose biological role is unknown; localizes to the preribosome, large subunit precursor, nucleus and ribosome in large scale studies|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.briefDescription: Protein of unknown function that may interact with ribosomes
Gene.description: Protein of unknown function that may interact with ribosomes; green fluorescent protein (GFP)-fusion protein localizes to the nucleolus; predicted to be involved in ribosome biogenesis

Gene.functionSummary: Protein whose biological role is unknown; localizes to the nucleus and cytoplasm in a large-scale study|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.description: Non-essential protein of unknown function

Gene.description: Mitotic spindle protein; interacts with components of the Dam1 (DASH) complex, its effector Sli15p, and microtubule-associated protein Bim1p; also localizes to nuclear microtubules and to the bud neck in a ring-shaped structure; inhibits dynein function

Gene.name: HEterogeneous nuclear rnp K-like gene
Gene.functionSummary: mRNA binding protein; involved in the localization of the ASH1 mRNA and telomere maintenance; localizes to cytoplasmic mRNA processing body and the telomeric region of nuclear chromosome|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311

Gene.description: RNA binding protein involved in asymmetric localization of ASH1 mRNA; represses translation of ASH1 mRNA, an effect reversed by Yck1p-dependent phosphoryation; regulates telomere position effect and length; similarity to hnRNP-K
Putative non-specific single-domain racemase; based on structural similarity; binds pyridoxal 5'-phosphate; expression of GFP-fusion protein induced in response to the DNA-damaging agent MMS

Gene.name: URAcil requiring

Gene.name: 5-FlUorourIdine resistance

Gene.functionSummary: Protein whose biological role and cellular location are unknown|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311

Gene.description: 3'-->5' exonuclease and endonuclease with a possible role in apoptosis; has similarity to mammalian and C. elegans apoptotic nucleases

Gene.name: AuTophaGy related
Gene.functionSummary: Protein tag or marker; involved in macroautophagy, cytoplasm-to-vacuole targeting (CVT) pathway, late nucleophagy, piecemeal microautophagy of nucleus, autophagic vacuole assembly, ER to Golgi vesicle-mediated transport and mitochondrion degradation; localizes to pre-autophagosomal structure (PAS), vacuolar membrane|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311

Gene.briefDescription: Component of autophagosomes and Cvt vesicles
Gene.description: Component of autophagosomes and Cvt vesicles; regulator of Atg1p, targets it to autophagosomes; binds the Atg1p-Atg13p complex, triggering its vacuolar degradation; unique ubiquitin-like protein whose conjugation target is lipid phosphatidylethanolamine (PE); Atg8p-PE is anchored to membranes, is involved in phagophore expansion, and may mediate membrane fusion during autophagosome formation; deconjugation of Atg8p-PE is required for efficient autophagosome biogenesis

Gene.description: Subunit of inner ring of nuclear pore complex (NPC); contributes to NPC assembly and nucleocytoplasmic transport; interacts with genomic regions that contain ribosomal protein and subtelomeric genes, where it functions in nucleosome positioning and as a repressor of transcription; both Nup170p and NUP157p are similar to human Nup155p; NUP170 has a paralog, NUP157, that arose from the whole genome duplication

Gene.name: PETite colonies

Gene.description: Subunit of the trimeric GatFAB AmidoTransferase(AdT) complex; involved in the formation of Q-tRNAQ; mutation is functionally complemented by the bacterial GatB ortholog

Gene.functionSummary: Protein whose biological role and cellular location are unknown|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.description: Non-essential protein of unknown function; null mutation results in a decrease in plasma membrane electron transport

Gene.description: Dolichol-P-Man dependent alpha(1-3) mannosyltransferase; involved in synthesis of dolichol-linked oligosaccharide donor for N-linked glycosylation of proteins; G353A missense mutation in human ortholog ALG3 implicated in carbohydrate deficient glycoprotein syndrome type IV, which is characterized by microcephaly, severe epilepsy, minimal psychomotor development, partial deficiency of sialic acids in serum glycoproteins; wild-type human ALG3 can complement yeast alg3 mutant

Gene.description: Protein kinase primarily involved in telomere length regulation; contributes to cell cycle checkpoint control in response to DNA damage; acts with Red1p and Mec1p to promote interhomolog recombination by phosphorylation of Hop1; functionally redundant with Mec1p; regulates P-body formation induced by replication stress; homolog of human ataxia-telangiectasia mutated (ATM) gene

Gene.description: Putative transporter; member of a family of seven S. cerevisiae genes (AVT1-7) related to vesicular GABA-glycine transporters; AVT5 has a paralog, AVT6, that arose from the whole genome duplication

Gene.name: Regulation by OXygen

Gene.name: Mitochondrial oRganization of gene eXpression (MIOREX)

Gene.name: Biosynthesis of Nicotinic Acid

Gene.description: Alpha subunit of the F1 sector of mitochondrial F1F0 ATP synthase; which is a large, evolutionarily conserved enzyme complex required for ATP synthesis; F1 translationally regulates ATP6 and ATP8 expression to achieve a balanced output of ATP synthase genes encoded in nucleus and mitochondria; phosphorylated; N-terminally propionylated in vivo
Dubious open reading frame; unlikely to encode a functional protein, based on available experimental and comparative sequence data; almost completely overlaps the 5' end of ATP1

Gene.name: Suppressor of sed Five Ts
Gene.briefDescription: Tetra-spanning membrane protein found mostly in the late Golgi
Gene.description: Tetra-spanning membrane protein found mostly in the late Golgi; non-essential; can suppress some sed5 alleles; may be part of the transport machinery, but precise function is unknown; similar to mammalian syntaxin 5

Gene.name: SEh1-Associated
Gene.functionSummary: Protein whose biological role is unknown; component of the Seh1-associated complex; also localizes to the vacuolar membrane|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.briefDescription: Subunit of SEACAT, a subcomplex of the SEA complex
Gene.description: Subunit of SEACAT, a subcomplex of the SEA complex; Sea4p, along with Rtc1p and Mtc5p, redundantly inhibit the TORC1 inhibitory role of the Iml1p/SEACIT (Iml1p-Npr2p-Npr3p) subcomplex, a GAP for GTPase Gtr1p (EGOC subunit) in response to amino acid limitation, thereby resulting in activation of TORC1 signaling; SEA is a coatomer-related complex that associates dynamically with the vacuole; contains an N-terminal beta-propeller fold and a C-terminal RING motif

Gene.name: Suppressor of rho3
Gene.phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutant is sensitive to lithium ions; in large-scale studies, null mutant shows decreased or increased competitive fitness in different media; null mutant accumulates higher levels of cadmium cations, has a shorter chronological lifespan, and displays slow glutamine utilization; null mutant displays altered resistance to a variety of chemicals
Gene.briefDescription: Protein with roles in exocytosis and cation homeostasis
Gene.description: Protein with roles in exocytosis and cation homeostasis; functions in docking and fusion of post-Golgi vesicles with plasma membrane; regulates cell proliferation and colony development via the Rho1-Tor1 pathway; interacts with SNARE protein Sec9p; homolog of Drosophila lethal giant larvae tumor suppressor; SRO77 has a paralog, SRO7, that arose from the whole genome duplication

Gene.name: Mitochondrial Intermembrane space CX(n)C motif protein

Gene.description: Mitochondrial intermembrane space protein of unknown function; imported via the MIA import machinery; contains an unusual twin cysteine motif (CX13C CX14C)

Gene.briefDescription: Putative neutral trehalase, required for thermotolerance

Gene.name: Resistance to Congo Red

Gene.description: Protein of the ER membrane involved in cell wall chitin deposition; may function in the endosomal-vacuolar trafficking pathway, helping determine whether plasma membrane proteins are degraded or routed to the plasma membrane; RCR1 has a paralog, RCR2, that arose from the whole genome duplication

Gene.name: Utilization of GAba
Gene.description: Succinate semialdehyde dehydrogenase; involved in the utilization of gamma-aminobutyrate (GABA) as a nitrogen source; part of the 4-aminobutyrate and glutamate degradation pathways; localized to the cytoplasm

Gene.description: Deletion suppressor of mpt5 mutation; relocalizes from bud neck to cytoplasm upon DNA replication stress

Gene.description: Plasma membrane transporter of the major facilitator superfamily; member of the 12-spanner drug:H(+) antiporter DHA1 family; involved in efflux of fluconazole, diazaborine, benomyl, methotrexate, and other drugs; expression induced in cells treated with the mycotoxin patulin; relocalizes from nucleus to plasma membrane upon DNA replication stress

Gene.name: Histone H Four
Gene.description: Histone H4; core histone protein required for chromatin assembly and chromosome function; one of two identical histone proteins (see also HHF2); contributes to telomeric silencing; N-terminal domain involved in maintaining genomic integrity

Gene.name: Histone H Three
Gene.description: Histone H3; core histone protein required for chromatin assembly, part of heterochromatin-mediated telomeric and HM silencing; one of two identical histone H3 proteins (see HHT2); regulated by acetylation, methylation, and phosphorylation; H3K14 acetylation plays an important role in the unfolding of strongly positioned nucleosomes during repair of UV damage

Gene.functionSummary: Protein whose biological role is unknown; localizes to the endoplasmic reticulum|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.description: Putative protein of unknown function; haploid deletion mutant exhibits synthetic phenotype with alpha-synuclein; SWAT-GFP fusion protein localizes to the endoplasmic reticulum while mCherry fusion protein localizes to both the endoplasmic reticulum and vacuole

Gene.name: GlutaRedoXin
Gene.description: Cis-golgi localized monothiol glutaredoxin; more similar in activity to dithiol than other monothiol glutaredoxins; involved in the oxidative stress response; does not bind metal ions; GRX7 has a paralog, GRX6, that arose from the whole genome duplication

Gene.name: MaNNosyltransferase

GO.Slim: transferase activity;transferase activity, transferring glycosyl groups

Gene.description: Tail-anchored plasma membrane protein with a conserved CYSTM module; predicted to be palmitoylated; has similarity to hydrophilins, which are involved in the adaptive response to hyperosmotic conditions; YBR016W has a paralog, YDL012C, that arose from the whole genome duplication

Gene.name: GALactose metabolism
Gene.phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutant cannot utilize galactose and grows more slowly in the presence of galactose; in large-scale studies, null mutant shows reduced competitive fitness in minimal or galactose-containing medium but increased fitness in rich medium containing ethanol; null mutant displays increased biofilm formation
Gene.description: Galactose-1-phosphate uridyl transferase; synthesizes glucose-1-phosphate and UDP-galactose from UDP-D-glucose and alpha-D-galactose-1-phosphate in the second step of galactose catabolism; human homolog UGP2 can complement yeast null mutant

Gene.name: GALactose metabolism
Gene.description: UDP-glucose-4-epimerase; catalyzes interconversion of UDP-galactose and UDP-D-glucose in galactose metabolism; also catalyzes conversion of alpha-D-glucose or alpha-D-galactose to their beta-anomers; human homolog GALE implicated in galactosemia, can complement yeast null mutant

Gene.name: GALactose metabolism
Gene.functionSummary: Galactokinase involved galactose catabolism and regulation of transcription in response to galactose; localized to the cytoplasm|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.description: Galactokinase; phosphorylates alpha-D-galactose to alpha-D-galactose-1-phosphate in the first step of galactose catabolism; expression regulated by Gal4p; human homolog GALK2 complements yeast null mutant; GAL1 has a paralog, GAL3, that arose from the whole genome duplication

Gene.name: Phosphatase Of ADP-ribose 1"-phosphate
Gene.briefDescription: Phosphatase that is highly specific for ADP-ribose 1''-phosphate
Gene.description: Phosphatase that is highly specific for ADP-ribose 1''-phosphate; a tRNA splicing metabolite; may have a role in regulation of tRNA splicing

Gene.name: CHitin Synthase-related
Gene.functionSummary: Chitin synthase involved in cell wall chitin biosynthesis; also required for spore wall assembly; localizes to bud necks, incipient bud sites, and prospore membranes|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutant displays phenotypes associated with cell wall defects, including resistance to Calcofluor White and killer toxin, sensitivity to caffeine, and abnormal wall morphology; in large-scale studies, null mutant shows sensitivity to various chemicals and an enhanced ability to form biofilms
Gene.description: Chitin synthase III; catalyzes the transfer of N-acetylglucosamine (GlcNAc) to chitin; required for synthesis of the majority of cell wall chitin, the chitin ring during bud emergence, and spore wall chitosan; contains overlapping di-leucine and di-acidic signals that mediate, respectively, intracellular trafficking by AP-1 and trafficking to plasma membrane by exomer complex; requires AP-3 complex for its intracellular retention
GO.Slim: transferase activity;transferase activity, transferring glycosyl groups

Gene.briefDescription: Protein anchored to mitochondrial inner membrane

Gene.name: Obg-Like ATPase

Gene.description: Ribosomal lysine methyltransferase; specific for monomethylation of Rpl42ap and Rpl42bp (lysine 40); nuclear SET domain containing protein; relocalizes to the cytosol in response to hypoxia

Gene.description: Dubious open reading frame; unlikely to encode a functional protein, based on available experimental and comparative sequence data

Gene.description: Nuclear SAM-dependent mono- and asymmetric methyltransferase; modifies hnRNPs, including Npl3p and Hrp1p, affecting their activity and nuclear export; methylates U1 snRNP protein Snp1p, ribosomal protein Rps2p, and histones H3 and H4; interacts genetically with genes encoding components of Rpd3(L) and this interaction is important for Rpd3 recruitment to the subtelomeric region

Gene.description: Copper-binding protein of mitochondrial inner membrane; required for cytochrome c oxidase activity and respiration; may function to deliver copper to cytochrome c oxidase; similar to thioredoxins; SCO1 has a paralog, SCO2, that arose from the whole genome duplication

Gene.name: TriCarboxylic acid cycle Mutant

Gene.description: Protein involved in assembly of the succinate dehydrogenase complex; mitochondrial; putative chaperone

Gene.name: Heat Shock Protein

Gene.name: Synthetic Lethal with Mss4
