Gene.name: Spore Wall Maturation
Gene.description: Subunit of the anaphase-promoting complex (APC); APC is an E3 ubiquitin ligase that regulates the metaphase-anaphase transition and exit from mitosis; required for activation of the daughter-specific gene expression and spore wall maturation

Gene.name: EXo-1,3-beta-Glucanase
Gene.description: Exo-1,3-beta-glucanase; involved in cell wall beta-glucan assembly; may be anchored to the plasma membrane via a glycosylphosphatidylinositol (GPI) anchor
GO.Slim: hydrolase activity;hydrolase activity, acting on glycosyl bonds

Gene.functionSummary: Protein whose biological role is unknown; localizes to the vacuole in a large-scale study|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.description: Putative protein of unknown function; green fluorescent protein (GFP)-fusion protein localizes to the vacuole and is induced in response to the DNA-damaging agent MMS; gene expression increases in response to Zymoliase treatment

Gene.name: DNA Damage INducible
Gene.briefDescription: Mitochondrial nuclease functioning in DNA repair and replication
Gene.description: Mitochondrial nuclease functioning in DNA repair and replication; modulates the stability of the mitochondrial genome, induced by exposure to mutagens, also induced during meiosis at a time nearly coincident with commitment to recombination; DIN7 has a paralog, EXO1, that arose from the whole genome duplication

Gene.name: AnKyrin Repeat containing
Gene.functionSummary: Palmitoyltransferase involved in the regulation of mating and endocytosis; localizes to the Golgi; anchors sphinganine kinase LCB4 to membrane via palmitoylation|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutation causes reduced protein palmitoylation, abnormal cell morphology (enlarged cells and elongated buds), decreased sporulation and respiratory growth; in large-scale studies null mutant is haploinsufficient and shows decreased competitive fitness; overexpression results in slow growth
Gene.briefDescription: Palmitoyl transferase involved in protein palmitoylation
Gene.description: Palmitoyl transferase involved in protein palmitoylation; acts as a negative regulator of pheromone response pathway; required for endocytosis of pheromone receptors; involved in cell shape control; contains ankyrin repeats; AKR1 has a paralog, AKR2, that arose from the whole genome duplication; any of several human homologs encoding DHHC-type zinc fingers (ZDHHC) can complement temperature sensitivity of yeast akr1 null mutant

Gene.name: PEroXin
Gene.functionSummary: Ubiquitin-protein ligase subunit of the peroxisomal importomer complex involved in the import of proteins into the peroxisomal matrix|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.description: Peroxisomal membrane E3 ubiquitin ligase; required for for Ubc4p-dependent Pex5p ubiquitination and peroxisomal matrix protein import; contains zinc-binding RING domain; mutations in human homolog cause various peroxisomal disorders

Gene.name: Histone E3 Ligase
Gene.functionSummary: RING finger E3 ubiquitin ligase involved in ubiquitination and degradation of excess histones; localizes to the cytoplasm and colocalizes with ribosomes|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.description: RING finger ubiquitin ligase (E3); involved in ubiquitylation and degradation of excess histones; interacts with Ubc4p and Rad53p; null mutant sensitive to hydroxyurea (HU); green fluorescent protein (GFP)-fusion protein localizes to the cytoplasm; computational analysis suggests a role as a transcription factor

Gene.name: Mitochondrial aminoacyl-tRNA Synthetase, tryptophan (W)
Gene.functionSummary: Mitochondrial tryptophanyl-tRNA synthetase that performs tryptophanyl-tRNA aminoacylation by coupling tryptophan to tryptophanyl-tRNA|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.description: Mitochondrial tryptophanyl-tRNA synthetase
Dubious open reading frame; unlikely to encode a functional protein, based on available experimental and comparative sequence data
Dubious open reading frame; unlikely to encode a functional protein, based on available experimental and comparative sequence data; partially overlaps the verified ORF CCC2/YDR270W

Gene.name: GLyOxalase
Gene.description: Cytoplasmic glyoxalase II; catalyzes the hydrolysis of S-D-lactoylglutathione into glutathione and D-lactate; GLO2 has a paralog, GLO4, that arose from the whole genome duplication

Gene.name: DONut
Gene.briefDescription: Meiosis-specific component of the spindle pole body
Gene.description: Meiosis-specific component of the spindle pole body; subunit of the leading edge protein (LEP) complex (Ssp1-Ady3-Don1-Irc10) that forms a ring-like structure at the leading edge of the prospore membrane (PSM) during meiosis II; required for PSM growth and closure; DON1 has a paralog, CUE5, that arose from the whole genome
Dubious open reading frame; unlikely to encode a functional protein, based on available experimental and comparative sequence data

Gene.name: Bypass of Stop Codon
Gene.functionSummary: Protein whose biological role is unknown; localizes to lipid particle in high-throughput studies|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutant displays decreased accumulation of (R,R)-butane-2,3-diol and acetoin; null mutant shows filamentous growth defect; heterozygous null mutant displays decreased fitness
Gene.description: Protein of unknown function; ORF exhibits genomic organization compatible with a translational readthrough-dependent mode of expression; null mutant displays increased translation rate and increased readthrough of premature stop codons; BSC2 has a paralog, IRC23, that arose from the whole genome duplication

Gene.name: Plasma Membrane Proteolipid
Gene.description: Small plasma membrane protein; confers resistance to amphotericin B and is a potential target of this common antifungal drug; related to a family of plant polypeptides that are overexpressed under high salt concentration or low temperature; not essential for viability; deletion causes hyperpolarization of the plasma membrane potential

Gene.name: MSN Three Homolog
Gene.briefDescription: Negative regulator of the glucose-sensing signal transduction pathway
Gene.description: Negative regulator of the glucose-sensing signal transduction pathway; required for repression of transcription by Rgt1p; interacts with Rgt1p and the Snf3p and Rgt2p glucose sensors; phosphorylated by Yck1p, triggering Mth1p degradation; MTH1 has a paralog, STD1, that arose from the whole genome duplication
Dubious open reading frame; unlikely to encode a functional protein, based on available experimental and comparative sequence data

Gene.name: RNase H
Gene.description: Ribonuclease H2 subunit; required for RNase H2 activity; role in ribonucleotide excision repair; related to human AGS2 that causes Aicardi-Goutieres syndrome

Gene.name: Mitochondrial oRganization of gene eXpression (MIOREX)
Gene.functionSummary: Protein whose biological role is unknonwn; localizes to the mitochondrial inner membrane|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.briefDescription: Mitochondrial inner membrane protein of unknown function
Gene.description: Mitochondrial inner membrane protein of unknown function; associates with mitochondrial ribosome; localizes to the inner membrane with the C terminus facing the intermembrane space; ortholog of human RMND1, mutation in which is implicated in infantile encephaloneuromyopathy and defective mitochondrial translation

Gene.name: General Control Nonderepressible
Gene.functionSummary: Translation initiation factor 2 alpha kinase; regulates translation initiation; involved in DNA damage checkpoint and cellular amino acid biosynthesis; localizes to cytosolic ribosome|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.description: Protein kinase; phosphorylates the alpha-subunit of translation initiation factor eIF2 (Sui2p) in response to starvation; activated by uncharged tRNAs and the Gcn1p-Gcn20p complex; contributes to DNA damage checkpoint control

Gene.name: Diacylglycerol Pyrophosphate Phosphatase
Gene.description: Diacylglycerol pyrophosphate (DGPP) phosphatase; zinc-regulated vacuolar membrane-associated lipid phosphatase, dephosphorylates DGPP to phosphatidate (PA) and Pi, then PA to diacylglycerol; involved in lipid signaling and cell metabolism

Gene.name: molecular ZIPper
Gene.functionSummary: Component of synaptonemal complex transverse filament; binds SUMO polymers and regulates protein sumoylation; required for localization of SUMO E3 ligase Cst9p to sites of double-strand breaks during double-strand break repair via homologous recombination|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutants have abnormal vacuolar morphology, increased competitive fitness, increased chromosome instability, decreased transposon mobility, and are sensitive to neomycin; homozygous diploid null mutants are impaired in meiosis, meiotic recombination and sporulation
Gene.briefDescription: Transverse filament protein of the synaptonemal complex
Gene.description: Transverse filament protein of the synaptonemal complex; required for normal levels of meiotic recombination and pairing between homologous chromosome during meiosis; required for meiotic recombination between non-allelc sites; potential Cdc28p substrate

Gene.functionSummary: Protein whose biological role and cellular location are unknown|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.description: Putative protein of unknown function; predicted to have thiol-disulfide oxidoreductase active site

Gene.name: INositol Monophosphatase
Gene.description: Inositol monophosphatase; involved in biosynthesis of inositol; enzymatic activity requires magnesium ions and is inhibited by lithium and sodium ions; inm1 inm2 double mutant lacks inositol auxotrophy

Gene.name: Regulator of Ty1 Transposition
Gene.briefDescription: Protein involved in transcription termination by RNA polymerase II
Gene.description: Protein involved in transcription termination by RNA polymerase II; interacts with exonuclease Rat1p and Rai1p; has an RPR domain (carboxy-terminal domain interacting domain); also involved in regulation of Ty1 transposition
Dubious open reading frame; unlikely to encode a functional protein, based on available experimental and comparative sequence data; partially overlaps the verified ORF RTT103

Gene.name: Homologous to RecQ protein
Gene.briefDescription: 3'-5' DNA helicase that has DNA strand annealing activity
Gene.description: 3'-5' DNA helicase that has DNA strand annealing activity; helicase activity is stimulated by fork structure and 3'-tail length of substrates; acts with Rad4p in nucleotide-excision repair; belongs to the widely conserved RecQ family of proteins which are involved in maintaining genomic integrity; similar to the human RecQ4p implicated in Rothmund-Thomson syndrome (RTS)

Gene.name: Suppressor of SIT4 Deletion
Gene.phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutant is sensitive to heat and shows reduced acquired thermotolerance; null mutation causes sensitivity to Calcofluor White and SDS, indicative of cell wall defects; in systematic studies null mutation decreases anaerobic growth and competitive fitness and elevates sensitivity to multiple drugs, including azoles, camptothecin, fenpropimorph, rapamycin
Gene.briefDescription: Translational repressor with a role in polar growth and wall integrity
Gene.description: Translational repressor with a role in polar growth and wall integrity; regulated by Cbk1p phosphorylation to effect bud-specific translational control and localization of specific mRNAs; interacts with TOR pathway components; contains a functional N-terminal nuclear localization sequence and nucleocytoplasmic shuttling appears to be critical to Ssd1p function

Gene.name: Dihydrosphingosine Phosphate Lyase
Gene.description: Dihydrosphingosine phosphate lyase; regulates intracellular levels of sphingolipid long-chain base phosphates (LCBPs), degrades phosphorylated long chain bases, prefers C16 dihydrosphingosine-l-phosphate as a substrate

Gene.name: Histone DeAcetylase
Gene.briefDescription: Subunit of the HDA1 histone deacetylase complex
Gene.description: Subunit of the HDA1 histone deacetylase complex; possibly tetrameric trichostatin A-sensitive class II histone deacetylase complex contains Hda1p homodimer and an Hda2p-Hda3p heterodimer; involved in telomere maintenance; relocalizes to the cytosol in response to hypoxia

Gene.name: Mitochondrial Homologous Recombination
Gene.functionSummary: Component of the large subunit of the mitochondrial ribosome, which mediates translation in the mitochondrion; may have independent roles in nuclear transcription regulation and in mitochondrial DNA replication|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.briefDescription: Mitochondrial ribosomal protein of the large subunit
Gene.description: Mitochondrial ribosomal protein of the large subunit; also involved in homologous recombination in mitochondria; required for recombination-dependent mtDNA partitioning; involved in stimulation of mitochondrial DNA replication in response to oxidative stress
GO.Slim: DNA binding;structural constituent of ribosome;structural molecule activity

Gene.name: SUppressor of Rvs161 and rvs167 mutations
Gene.description: Sphinganine C4-hydroxylase; catalyses the conversion of sphinganine to phytosphingosine in sphingolipid biosyntheis

Gene.name: ATP synthase
Gene.functionSummary: Subunit of the stator stalk of the F0 coupling factor of mitochondrial F1F0 ATP synthase; ATP synthase complex is localized to the mitochondrial inner membrane|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.briefDescription: Subunit 5 of the stator stalk of mitochondrial F1F0 ATP synthase
Gene.description: Subunit 5 of the stator stalk of mitochondrial F1F0 ATP synthase; F1F0 ATP synthase is a large, evolutionarily conserved enzyme complex required for ATP synthesis; homologous to bovine subunit OSCP (oligomycin sensitivity-conferring protein); phosphorylated

Gene.name: PROline requiring
Gene.description: Gamma-glutamyl kinase; catalyzes the first step in proline biosynthesis; PRO1 has a paralog, YHR033W, that arose from the whole genome duplication

Gene.name: Cyclosporin-sensitive Proline Rotamase
Gene.briefDescription: Peptidyl-prolyl cis-trans isomerase (cyclophilin) of the ER
Gene.description: Peptidyl-prolyl cis-trans isomerase (cyclophilin) of the ER; catalyzes the cis-trans isomerization of peptide bonds N-terminal to proline residues; transcriptionally induced in response to unfolded proteins in the ER; CPR5 has a paralog, CPR2, that arose from the whole genome duplication

Gene.name: Histidine triad NucleoTide-binding
Gene.description: Dinucleoside triphosphate hydrolase; has similarity to the tumor suppressor FHIT and belongs to the histidine triad (HIT) superfamily of nucleotide-binding proteins
F-box protein of unknown function; interacts with Sgt1p via a Leucine-Rich Repeat (LRR) domain

Gene.functionSummary: Predicted integral membrane protein whose biological role is unknown; localizes to the endoplasmic reticulum in a large-scale study|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.briefDescription: Putative protein mannosyltransferase similar to Pmt1p
Gene.description: Putative protein mannosyltransferase similar to Pmt1p; has a potential role in protein O-glycosylation

Gene.name: GTPase Interactive Component
Gene.description: Redundant rho-like GTPase Cdc42p effector; involved in initiation of budding and cellular polarization; interacts with Cdc42p via the Cdc42/Rac-interactive binding (CRIB) domain and with PI(4,5)P2 via a polybasic region; GIC2 has a paralog, GIC1, that arose from the whole genome duplication

Gene.name: SUppresor of Mar1-1
Gene.briefDescription: Transcriptional repressor that regulates middle-sporulation genes
Gene.description: Transcriptional repressor that regulates middle-sporulation genes; required for mitotic repression of middle sporulation-specific genes; also acts as general replication initiation factor; involved in telomere maintenance, chromatin silencing; regulated by pachytene checkpoint
GO.Slim: DNA binding;nucleic acid binding transcription factor activity

Gene.name: Suppressor of ste4 (Four)
Gene.briefDescription: Protein required for ribosomal large subunit maturation
Gene.description: Protein required for ribosomal large subunit maturation; functionally redundant with Ssf1p; member of the Brix family; SSF2 has a paralog, SSF1, that arose from the whole genome duplication

Gene.name: PhosphatidylInositol(3)-phosphate Binding
Gene.briefDescription: RING-type ubiquitin ligase of the endosomal and vacuolar membranes
Gene.description: RING-type ubiquitin ligase of the endosomal and vacuolar membranes; binds phosphatidylinositol(3)-phosphate; contains a FYVE finger domain

Gene.name: Homologous to RAD4
Gene.briefDescription: Protein involved in nucleotide excision repair (NER)
Gene.description: Protein involved in nucleotide excision repair (NER); homologous to RAD4

Gene.name: Inositol Polyphosphate Kinase
Gene.functionSummary: Nuclear inositol pentakisphosphate 2-kinase involved in biosynthesis of inositol phosphate and in non-stop mRNA decay|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutant grows slowly and shows defects in glycogen accumulation and increased heat sensitivity; also shows sensitivity to multiple chemicals, including caffeine, cicloheximide, DMSO, hydroxyurea, MMS, tunicamycin
Gene.description: Inositol 1,3,4,5,6-pentakisphosphate 2-kinase; nuclear protein required for synthesis of 1,2,3,4,5,6-hexakisphosphate (phytate), which is integral to cell function; has 2 motifs conserved in other fungi; ipk1 gle1 double mutant is inviable; human IPPK can complement ipk1 null mutant

Gene.name: OXA1 Multicopy Suppressor
Gene.briefDescription: Protein integral to the mitochondrial membrane
Gene.description: Protein integral to the mitochondrial membrane; has a conserved methyltransferase motif and is predicted to be an RNA methyltransferase; multicopy suppressor of respiratory defects caused by OXA1 mutations

Gene.name: High Induced Mutagenesis
Gene.briefDescription: Protein of unknown function involved in DNA repair
Gene.description: Protein of unknown function involved in DNA repair

Gene.briefDescription: Protein required for normal ER membrane biosynthesis
Gene.description: Protein required for normal ER membrane biosynthesis; member of the highly conserved FIT family of proteins involved in triglyceride droplet biosynthesis and homologous to human FIT2; interacts with Sst2p and Hsp82p in high-throughput two-hybrid screens

Gene.name: Synthetic lethal With Arf1
Gene.briefDescription: Auxilin-like protein involved in vesicular transport
Gene.description: Auxilin-like protein involved in vesicular transport; clathrin-binding protein required for uncoating of clathrin-coated vesicles

Gene.name: ASParaginase
Gene.phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; in competitive-growth studies null mutant shows reduced fitness; in systematic studies null mutant has lower rate of utilization of ammonium as nitrogen source
Gene.briefDescription: Cytosolic L-asparaginase, involved in asparagine catabolism
Gene.description: Cytosolic L-asparaginase, involved in asparagine catabolism; catalyzes hydrolysis of L-asparagine to aspartic acid and ammonia, has an important role in therapy of acute lymphoblastic leukemia; synthesized constitutively

Gene.name: Mitochondrial Ribosomal Protein, Large subunit
Gene.functionSummary: Component of the large subunit of the mitochondrial ribosome, which mediates translation in the mitochondrion|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.briefDescription: Mitochondrial ribosomal protein of the large subunit
Gene.description: Mitochondrial ribosomal protein of the large subunit

Gene.description: Adaptor protein involved in vesicle-mediated vacuolar protein sorting; multivalent adaptor protein; facilitates vesicle-mediated vacuolar protein sorting by ensuring high-fidelity vesicle docking and fusion, which are essential for targeting of vesicles to the endosome; required for vacuole inheritance

Gene.name: Yeast Suicide Protein
Gene.functionSummary: Sterol binding protein with a role in intracellular sterol transport; localizes to mitochondria and the cortical ER|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.description: Sterol-binding protein; has a probable role in retrograde transport of sterols from the plasma membrane to the ER; contains two StART-like domains that bind sterols and a GRAM domain; co-localizes to puncta in the cortical ER with Sip3p; one of six StART-like domain-containing proteins in yeast that may be involved in sterol transfer between intracellular membranes; conserved across eukaryotes

Gene.name: PEroXin
Gene.functionSummary: Peroxisomal membrane protein involved in the targeting of other proteins into the peroxisomal membrane; also involved in peroxisome organization that takes place in the endoplasmic reticulum, and peroxisome inheritance from the mother cell to the bud|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311

Gene.name: UBiquitin regulatory X
Gene.briefDescription: UBX domain-containing protein that interacts with Cdc48p
Gene.description: UBX domain-containing protein that interacts with Cdc48p; ubiquitin regulatory X is also known as UBX

Gene.name: Increased Recombination Centers
Gene.functionSummary: Double-stranded DNA-dependent ATPase with a role in mitochondrial genome maintenance; localized to the mitochondrial matrix|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.briefDescription: Double-stranded DNA-dependent helicase of the DExH/D-box family
Gene.description: Double-stranded DNA-dependent helicase of the DExH/D-box family; required for maintenance of the mitochondrial (mt) genome; null mutant accumulates double-stranded breaks in mt DNA; localizes to the mt matrix

Gene.name: Ribosome Quality Control
Gene.functionSummary: Subunit of the ribosome quality control (RQC) complex, which is a ribosome bound complex involved in the ubiquitin-dependent degradation of aberrant translation products|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutants show decreased competitive fitness, are defective in vacuolar fragmentation and ribosome production, and sensitive to antimicrobial paromomycin; homozygous diploid null mutants show enhanced respiratory growth, increased resistance to cell wall perturbing agent Calcofluor White and antifungal mitochondrial respiratory-chain inhibitor antimycin A, increased sensitivity to heat and protein synthesis inhibitor anisomycin; homozygous diploid overexpression enhances pseudohyphal growth; heterozygous diploid nulls are haploproficient
Gene.briefDescription: Component of the ribosome quality control complex (RQC)
Gene.description: Component of the ribosome quality control complex (RQC); RQC (Rqc1p-Rkr1p-Tae2p-Cdc48p-Npl4p-Ufd1p) is a ribosome-bound complex required for the degradation of polypeptides arising from stalled translation; required along with Rkr1p for recruitment of the Cdc48p-Npl4p-Ufd1p AAA ATPase complex to the RQC

Gene.name: SWi2/snf2-Related
Gene.functionSummary: Structural component of the Swr1 complex which is involved in chromatin remodeling.|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutant is temperature sensitive, has reduced competitive fitness in various growth media and decreased resistance to zinc-limited growth; null mutant has an increase in chronological lifespan and increased innate thermotolerance while in stationary phase; null has decreased UV resistance; null mutant displays increased sensitivity to transcriptional elongation and microtubule inhibitors
Gene.description: Swi2/Snf2-related ATPase; structural component of the SWR1 complex, which exchanges histone variant H2AZ (Htz1p) for chromatin-bound histone H2A; relocalizes to the cytosol in response to hypoxia; chronological aging factor that mediates lifespan extension by dietary restriction

Gene.name: Multicopy suppressor of SNf1 mutation
Gene.description: Karyopherin; involved in nuclear import and export of proteins, including import of replication protein A and export of Far1p and transcription factors Swi5p, Swi6p, Msn2p, and Pho4p; required for re-export of mature tRNAs after their retrograde import from the cytoplasm; exportin-5 homolog

Gene.name: Mitochondrial oRganization of gene eXpression (MIOREX)

Gene.briefDescription: Protein that associates with mitochondrial ribosome
Gene.description: Protein that associates with mitochondrial ribosome; sumoylated under stress conditions in a genome wide study; YDR336W is not an essential gene

Gene.description: Mitochondrial ribosomal protein of the small subunit

Gene.description: Putative protein of unknown function; member of the multi-drug and toxin extrusion (MATE) family of the multidrug/oligosaccharidyl-lipid/polysaccharide (MOP) exporter superfamily
Putative protein of unknown function

Gene.briefDescription: Low affinity glucose transporter of the major facilitator superfamily
Gene.description: Low affinity glucose transporter of the major facilitator superfamily; expression is induced in low or high glucose conditions; HXT3 has a paralog, HXT5, that arose from the whole genome duplication

Gene.name: SurVival Factor
Gene.briefDescription: Protein with a potential role in cell survival pathways
Gene.description: Protein with a potential role in cell survival pathways; required for the diauxic growth shift; expression in mammalian cells increases survival under conditions inducing apoptosis; mutant has increased aneuploidy tolerance

Gene.name: Mitochondrial Ribosomal Protein
Gene.functionSummary: Component of the small subunit of the mitochondrial ribosome, which mediates translation in the mitochondrion|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.briefDescription: Mitochondrial ribosomal protein of the small subunit
Gene.description: Mitochondrial ribosomal protein of the small subunit; MRP1 exhibits genetic interactions with PET122, encoding a COX3-specific translational activator, and with PET123, encoding a small subunit mitochondrial ribosomal protein
GO.Slim: structural constituent of ribosome;structural molecule activity

Gene.name: YaPSin
Gene.description: Putative GPI-anchored aspartic protease; member of the yapsin family of proteases involved in cell wall growth and maintenance; located in the cytoplasm and endoplasmic reticulum

Gene.name: ATPase synthase
Gene.functionSummary: Specific translational activator required for translation of the ATP6 mRNA encoding a subunit of F1F0 ATP synthase; localized to the mitochondrial inner membrane|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.briefDescription: Specific translational activator for the mitochondrial ATP6 mRNA
Gene.description: Specific translational activator for the mitochondrial ATP6 mRNA; Atp6p encodes a subunit of F1F0 ATP synthase; localized to the mitochondrial inner membrane

Gene.name: Suppressor of BEm4
Gene.description: Protein required for bud growth; involved in transport of cell wall components from the Golgi to the cell surface; SBE2 has a paralog, SBE22, that arose from the whole genome duplication

Gene.name: Yeast PQ-loop protein
Gene.briefDescription: Putative vacuolar membrane transporter for cationic amino acids
Gene.description: Putative vacuolar membrane transporter for cationic amino acids; likely contributes to amino acid homeostasis by exporting cationic amino acids from the vacuole; member of the PQ-loop family, with seven transmembrane domains; mutant phenotype is functionally complemented by rat PQLC2 vacuolar transporter

Gene.name: TRyPtophan
Gene.description: Anthranilate phosphoribosyl transferase; transferase of the tryptophan biosynthetic pathway; catalyzes the phosphoribosylation of anthranilate; subject to the general control system of amino acid biosynthesis
GO.Slim: transferase activity;transferase activity, transferring glycosyl groups

Gene.name: CNo-Like
Gene.briefDescription: Subunit of the BLOC-1 complex involved in endosomal maturation
Gene.description: Subunit of the BLOC-1 complex involved in endosomal maturation; interacts with Msb3p; null mutant is sensitive to drug inducing secretion of vacuolar cargo; green fluorescent protein (GFP)-fusion protein localizes to the cytoplasm

Gene.name: Golgi-localized, Gamma-adaptin ear homology, Arf-binding protein
Gene.briefDescription: Golgi-localized protein with homology to gamma-adaptin
Gene.description: Golgi-localized protein with homology to gamma-adaptin; interacts with and regulates Arf1p and Arf2p in a GTP-dependent manner in order to facilitate traffic through the late Golgi; GGA1 has a paralog, GGA2, that arose from the whole genome duplication

Gene.name: Esa1p-Associated Factor
Gene.briefDescription: Component of the NuA4 histone acetyltransferase complex
Gene.description: Component of the NuA4 histone acetyltransferase complex; acts as a platform for assembly of NuA4 subunits into the native complex; required for initiation of pre-meiotic DNA replication, likely due to its requirement for expression of IME1

Gene.name: OverProducer of Inositol
Gene.description: Dubious open reading frame; unlikely to encode a functional protein, based on available experimental and comparative sequence data; partially overlaps verified gene VID21/YDR359C

Gene.name: Establishment of Silent Chromatin
Gene.description: Sumo-like domain protein; prevents accumulation of toxic intermediates during replication-associated recombinational repair; roles in silencing, lifespan, chromatid cohesion and the intra-S-phase DNA damage checkpoint; RENi family member

Gene.name: Suppressor of Exocyst Mutations
Gene.phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutant exhibits sensitivity to heat and UV, resistance to 4-NQO, and decreased nuclear export of poly(A)+ RNA; in large-scale studies, null mutant shows reduced competitive fitness in several different media, displays sensitivity to acid pH and desiccation, and has shortened telomeres; null mutant exhibits a respiratory growth defect at 37 deg C; null mutant has altered resistance to a variety of chemicals
Gene.briefDescription: Component of lid subcomplex of 26S proteasome regulatory subunit
Gene.description: Component of lid subcomplex of 26S proteasome regulatory subunit; involved in mRNA export mediated by TREX-2 complex (Sac3p-Thp1p); assumes different conformations in different contexts, functions as molecular glue stabilizing the Rpn3p/Rpn7p regulatory heterodimer, and tethers it to lid helical bundle; ortholog of human DSS1; protein abundance increases in response to DNA replication stress

Gene.name: Yeast Putative Reductase
Gene.functionSummary: NADPH-dependent carbonyl reductase involved in arabinose catabolism|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; in large-scale studies, the null mutant displays increased competitive fitness, decreased endocytosis, and sensitivity to DMSO; null mutant requires myo-inositol; heterozygous null mutant diploid is haploproficient
Gene.description: NADPH-dependent aldo-keto reductase; reduces multiple substrates including 2-methylbutyraldehyde and D,L-glyceraldehyde, expression is induced by osmotic and oxidative stress; functionally redundant with other aldo-keto reductases; protein abundance increases in response to DNA replication stress; YPR1 has a paralog, GCY1, that arose from the whole genome duplication; human homolog AKR1B1 can complement yeast null mutant

Gene.name: X-Ray Sensitive
Gene.description: Protein required for DNA repair; component of the Mre11 complex, which is involved in double strand breaks, meiotic recombination, telomere maintenance, and checkpoint signaling

Gene.name: Decapping eXOnuclease
Gene.description: mRNA 5'-end-capping quality-control protein; has distributive, 5'-3' exoRNase activity; similar to Rai1p;

Gene.name: ChiTinaSe
Gene.description: Putative chitinase; functionally complements A. gossypii cts2 mutant sporulation defect

Gene.name: Vacuolar Protein Sorting
Gene.briefDescription: Golgi phosphatidylinositol-4-kinase effector and PtdIns4P sensor
Gene.description: Golgi phosphatidylinositol-4-kinase effector and PtdIns4P sensor; interacts with the cytosolic domains of cis and medial glycosyltransferases, and in the PtdIns4P-bound state mediates the targeting of these enzymes to the Golgi; interacts with the catalytic domain of Sac1p, the major cellular PtdIns4P phosphatase, to direct dephosphosphorylation of the Golgi pool of PtdIns4P; tetramerization required for function; ortholog of human GOLPH3/GPP34/GMx33

Gene.name: PHOsphate metabolism
Gene.phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutant shows increased concentration of intracellular phosphate and increased stability of PHO4 mRNA; homozygous null mutant diploid has defective respiratory growth and decreased sporulation; overexpression causes slow growth
Gene.description: Posttranscriptional regulator of phosphate metabolism; facilitates PHO4 mRNA degradation by interacting with Pop2p; regulates PHO4 mRNA stability by binding to PHO4's 3'UTR in a phosphate-dependent manner; contains highly conserved YTH (YT521-B Homology) domain that exhibits RNA-binding activity; human homolog YTHDF2 can complement yeast null mutant

Gene.name: ubiquinol-cytochrome c reductase (bc1) Synthesis
Gene.phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null and point mutants fail to respire and exhibit mitochondrial genome instability and decreased chronological lifespan; in large-scale studies, the null mutant shows reduced competitive fitness, sensitivity to desiccation, heat, and oxidative stress, and sensitivity to various chemicals
Gene.briefDescription: Protein translocase and chaperone required for Complex III assembly
Gene.description: Protein translocase and chaperone required for Complex III assembly; member of the AAA ATPase family; forms a homo-oligomeric complex in the mitochondrial inner membrane that translocates the C-terminal domain of Rip1p from the matrix across the inner membrane and delivers it to an assembly intermediate of respiratory Complex III; also required for assembly of the Qcr10p subunit; mutation is functionally complemented by human homolog BCS1L, linked to neonatal diseases
GO.Slim: ATPase activity;hydrolase activity;protein transporter activity;transmembrane transporter activity

Gene.name: ATP synthase
Gene.functionSummary: Subunit of the F0 coupling factor of mitochondrial F1F0 ATP synthase; ATP synthase complex is localized to the mitochondrial inner membrane|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.briefDescription: Subunit f of the F0 sector of mitochondrial F1F0 ATP synthase
Gene.description: Subunit f of the F0 sector of mitochondrial F1F0 ATP synthase; F1F0 ATP synthase is a large, evolutionarily conserved enzyme complex required for ATP synthesis

Gene.name: Like SM
Gene.description: Lsm (Like Sm) protein; part of heteroheptameric complexes (Lsm2p-7p and either Lsm1p or 8p): cytoplasmic Lsm1p complex involved in mRNA decay; nuclear Lsm8p complex part of U6 snRNP and possibly involved in processing tRNA, snoRNA, and rRNA

Gene.name: AROmatic amino acid requiring
Gene.phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; in systematic studies null mutant shows decreased accumulation of copper, calcium and sulfur, and increased sensitivity to amitrole and neomycin
Gene.description: Phenylpyruvate decarboxylase; catalyzes decarboxylation of phenylpyruvate to phenylacetaldehyde, which is the first specific step in the Ehrlich pathway; involved in protein N-terminal Met and Ala catabolism

Gene.name: Ribosomal Protein P2 Beta
Gene.functionSummary: Protein kinase activating constituent of the cytosolic large ribosomal subunit; involved in translation|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.description: Ribosomal protein P2 beta; a component of the ribosomal stalk, which is involved in the interaction between translational elongation factors and the ribosome; free (non-ribosomal) P2 stimulates the phosphorylation of the eIF2 alpha subunit (Sui2p) by Gcn2p; regulates the accumulation of P1 (Rpp1Ap and Rpp1Bp) in the cytoplasm
GO.Slim: enzyme regulator activity;structural constituent of ribosome;structural molecule activity

Gene.name: Non-essential Kinetochore Protein
Gene.functionSummary: Protein whose biological role is unknown; localizees to the kinetochore|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.briefDescription: Central kinetochore protein and subunit of the Ctf19 complex
Gene.description: Central kinetochore protein and subunit of the Ctf19 complex; mutants have elevated rates of chromosome loss; orthologous to fission yeast kinetochore protein fta4

Gene.name: Ammonia (Ammonium) Transport Outward
Gene.briefDescription: Plasma membrane protein, putative ammonium transporter
Gene.description: Plasma membrane protein, putative ammonium transporter; regulation pattern suggests a possible role in export of ammonia from the cell; phosphorylated in mitochondria; member of the TC 9.B.33 YaaH family of putative transporters

Gene.name: Elongation Factor Two
Gene.briefDescription: Elongation factor 2 (EF-2), also encoded by EFT1
Gene.description: Elongation factor 2 (EF-2), also encoded by EFT1; catalyzes ribosomal translocation during protein synthesis; contains diphthamide, the unique posttranslationally modified histidine residue specifically ADP-ribosylated by diphtheria toxin; EFT2 has a paralog, EFT1, that arose from the whole genome duplication
GO.Slim: RNA binding;translation factor activity, RNA binding

Gene.name: MMS and UV Sensitive
Gene.description: Subunit of structure-specific Mms4p-Mus81p endonuclease; cleaves branched DNA; involved in DNA repair, replication fork stability, and joint molecule formation/resolution during meiotic recombination; promotes template switching during break-induced replication (BIR), causing non-reciprocal translocations (NRTs); helix-hairpin-helix protein; phosphorylation of non-catalytic subunit Mms4p by Cdc28p and Cdcp during mitotic cell cycle activates function of Mms4p-Mus81p
Putative transporter; member of the sugar porter family; YDR387C is not an essential gene

Gene.name: Reduced Viability on Starvation
Gene.functionSummary: Cytoskeletal protein; forms a complex with Rvs161p and is involved in actin cytoskeleton reorganization and endocytosis; localizes to the actin cortical patch|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.description: Calmodulin-binding actin-associated protein; roles in endocytic membrane tabulation and constriction, and exocytosis; N-BAR domain protein that interacts with Rvs161p to regulate actin cytoskeleton, endocytosis, and viability following starvation or osmotic stress; recruited to bud tips by Gyl1p and Gyp5p during polarized growth; homolog of mammalian amphiphysin

Gene.name: Suppressor of ACtin
Gene.description: GTPase activating protein (GAP) for Rho1p; regulator of a Tor2p-mediated, Rho1p GTPase switch that controls organization of the actin cytoskeleton; negative regulator of the RHO1-PKC1-MAPK cell integrity (CWI) and membrane fluidity homeostasis signaling pathways; potential Cdc28p substrate; SAC7 has a paralog, BAG7, that arose from the whole genome duplication

Gene.functionSummary: Protein whose biological role is unknown; localizes to the nucleus and cytoplasm in a large-scale study|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.description: Putative protein of unknown function; possibly involved in zinc homeostasis; Bdf1p-dependent transcription induced by salt stress; green fluorescent protein (GFP)-fusion protein localizes to both the cytoplasm and the nucleus

Gene.name: Sensitivity to High Expression
Gene.briefDescription: Protein required for normal mitochondrial morphology
Gene.description: Protein required for normal mitochondrial morphology; mitochondrial inner membrane protein; may be involved in fission of the inner membrane; forms a homo-oligomeric complex

Gene.name: Suppressor of mRNA eXport Mutant
Gene.description: Nuclear transport factor (karyopherin); involved in protein transport between the cytoplasm and nucleoplasm; similar to Nmd5p, Cse1p, Lph2p, and the human cellular apoptosis susceptibility protein, CAS1

Gene.name: Hypoxanthine guanine PhosphoribosylTransferase
Gene.description: Dimeric hypoxanthine-guanine phosphoribosyltransferase; catalyzes the transfer of the phosphoribosyl portion of 5-phosphoribosyl-alpha-1-pyrophosphate to a purine base (either guanine or hypoxanthine) to form pyrophosphate and a purine nucleotide (either guanosine monophosphate or inosine monophosphate); mutations in the human homolog HPRT1 can cause Lesch-Nyhan syndrome and Kelley-Seegmiller syndrome
GO.Slim: transferase activity;transferase activity, transferring glycosyl groups

Gene.name: URidine Hydrolase
Gene.description: Uridine nucleosidase (uridine-cytidine N-ribohydrolase); cleaves N-glycosidic bonds in nucleosides; involved in the pyrimidine salvage and nicotinamide riboside salvage pathways
GO.Slim: hydrolase activity;hydrolase activity, acting on glycosyl bonds

Gene.name: DITyrosine
Gene.description: N-formyltyrosine oxidase; sporulation-specific microsomal enzyme involved in the production of N,N-bisformyl dityrosine required for spore wall maturation, homologous to cytochrome P-450s; SWAT-GFP and mCherry fusion proteins localize to the endoplasmic reticulum and vacuole respectively

Gene.name: DITyrosine
Gene.briefDescription: Sporulation-specific enzyme required for spore wall maturation
Gene.description: Sporulation-specific enzyme required for spore wall maturation; involved in the production of a soluble LL-dityrosine-containing precursor of the spore wall; transcripts accumulate at the time of prospore enclosure

Gene.name: Mitochondrial Ribosomal Protein
Gene.functionSummary: Component of the large subunit of the mitochondrial ribosome, which mediates translation in the mitochondrion|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.briefDescription: Mitochondrial ribosomal protein of the large subunit
Gene.description: Mitochondrial ribosomal protein of the large subunit
GO.Slim: structural constituent of ribosome;structural molecule activity

Gene.name: Pleiotropic Drug Resistance
Gene.briefDescription: Plasma membrane ATP binding cassette (ABC) transporter
Gene.description: Plasma membrane ATP binding cassette (ABC) transporter; multidrug transporter and general stress response factor implicated in cellular detoxification; regulated by Pdr1p, Pdr3p and Pdr8p; promoter contains a PDR responsive element; PDR15 has a paralog, PDR5, that arose from the whole genome duplication

Gene.name: SAP and mIZ-finger domain
Gene.description: SUMO E3 ligase; promotes attachment of small ubiquitin-related modifier sumo (Smt3p) to primarily cytoplasmic proteins; regulates Rsp5p ubiquitin ligase activity and is in turn itself regulated by Rsp5p; required for sumoylation of septins and histone H3 variant Cse4p, a prerequisite for STUbL-mediated Ub-dependent degradation; localizes to the septin ring; acts as an adapter between E2, Ubc9p and substrates; tends to compensate for survival of DNA damage in absence of Nfi1p

Gene.name: Der1-like Family Member
Gene.description: Endoplasmic reticulum (ER) localized protein; involved in ER-associated protein degradation (ERAD), ER stress, and homeostasis; interacts with components of ERAD-L and ERAD-C and Cdc48p; derlin-like family member similar to Der1p

Gene.name: Endoplasmic reticulum Retention Defective
Gene.briefDescription: Predicted membrane protein required for lumenal ER protein retention
Gene.description: Predicted membrane protein required for lumenal ER protein retention; mutants secrete the endogenous ER protein, BiP (Kar2p)

Gene.functionSummary: Protein whose biological role is unknown; localizes to the vacuole|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.description: Putative aminopeptidase; SWAT-GFP fusion protein localizes to the endoplasmic reticulum and vacuole, while mCherry fusion localizes to the vacuole
Dubious open reading frame; unlikely to encode a functional protein, based on available experimental and comparative sequence data; partially overlaps the verified ORF RPL12B/YDR418W

Gene.name: Ribosomal Protein of the Large subunit
Gene.functionSummary: Subunit of the cytosolic large ribosomal subunit; involved in ribosomal large subunit assembly and translation|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.description: Ribosomal 60S subunit protein L12B; rpl12a rpl12b double mutant exhibits slow growth and slow translation; homologous to mammalian ribosomal protein L12 and bacterial L11; RPL12B has a paralog, RPL12A, that arose from the whole genome duplication
GO.Slim: structural constituent of ribosome;structural molecule activity

Gene.name: RADiation sensitive
Gene.phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutant is highly sensitive to UV and gamma radiation and shows elevated mutation frequency
Gene.description: DNA polymerase eta; involved in translesion synthesis during post-replication repair; catalyzes the synthesis of DNA opposite cyclobutane pyrimidine dimers and other lesions; involved in formation of post-replicative damage-induced genome-wide cohesion; may also have a role in protection against mitochondrial mutagenesis; mutations in human pol eta are responsible for XPV

Gene.name: Hansenula mrakii Killer toxin Resistant
Gene.briefDescription: Mucin family member that functions as an osmosensor in the HOG pathway
Gene.description: Mucin family member that functions as an osmosensor in the HOG pathway; large, highly glycosylated protein that functions redundantly with Msb2p in Sho1p-mediated osmostresss induction of the HOG signaling pathway; cytoplasmic domain interacts with Ahk1p a scaffold protein that prevents cross talk with the Kss1p MAPK of the filamentous growth pathway; mutant displays defects in beta-1,3 glucan synthesis and bud site selection

Gene.name: AROmatic amino acid requiring
Gene.functionSummary: Sequence specific DNA-binding transcriptional activator of genes involved in aromatic amino acid catabolism; localized to nucleus|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.briefDescription: Zinc finger transcriptional activator of the Zn2Cys6 family
Gene.description: Zinc finger transcriptional activator of the Zn2Cys6 family; activates transcription of aromatic amino acid catabolic genes in the presence of aromatic amino acids
GO.Slim: DNA binding;nucleic acid binding transcription factor activity

Gene.name: SNF1-Interacting Protein
Gene.briefDescription: Alternate beta-subunit of the Snf1p kinase complex
Gene.description: Alternate beta-subunit of the Snf1p kinase complex; may confer substrate specificity; vacuolar protein containing KIS (Kinase-Interacting Sequence) and ASC (Association with Snf1 kinase Complex) domains involved in protein interactions

Gene.name: CADmium resistance
Gene.functionSummary: Sequence-specific DNA-binding transcription factor involved in the cellular responses to stress and to cadmium; localizes to both the cytoplasm and nucleus|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.briefDescription: AP-1-like basic leucine zipper (bZIP) transcriptional activator
Gene.description: AP-1-like basic leucine zipper (bZIP) transcriptional activator; involved in stress responses, iron metabolism, and pleiotropic drug resistance; controls a set of genes involved in stabilizing proteins; binds consensus sequence TTACTAA; CAD1 has a paralog, YAP1, that arose from the whole genome duplication
GO.Slim: DNA binding;nucleic acid binding transcription factor activity

Gene.name: DYNein
Gene.briefDescription: Cytoplasmic light chain dynein, microtubule motor protein
Gene.description: Cytoplasmic light chain dynein, microtubule motor protein; required for intracellular transport and cell division; involved in mitotic spindle positioning; forms complex with dynein intermediate chain Pac11p that promotes Dyn1p homodimerization, potentiates motor processivity; Dyn2p-Pac11p complex important for interaction of dynein motor complex with dynactin complex; acts as molecular glue to dimerize, stabilize Nup82-Nsp1-Nup159 complex module of cytoplasmic pore filaments

Gene.name: Sorting NeXin
Gene.description: Sorting nexin; involved in the retrieval of late-Golgi SNAREs from the post-Golgi endosome to the trans-Golgi network; interacts with Snx4p
Dubious open reading frame; unlikely to encode a functional protein, based on available experimental and comparative sequence data; partially overlaps the verified ORF SNX41

Gene.name: Biosynthesis of NAD
Gene.functionSummary: Arylformamidase involved in de novo NAD biosynthesis from tryptophan|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.description: Formylkynurenine formamidase; involved in the de novo biosynthesis of NAD from tryptophan via kynurenine

Gene.name: CYtosolic Metalloprotease
Gene.briefDescription: Lysine-specific metalloprotease of the pitrilysin family
Gene.description: Lysine-specific metalloprotease of the pitrilysin family; metalloprotease of the intermembrane space; degrades proteins and presequence peptides cleaved from imported proteins; required for normal mitochondrial morphology
Dubious open reading frame; unlikely to encode a functional protein, based on available experimental and comparative sequence data

Gene.name: Nuclear Protein Localization
Gene.phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene in S288C, reported essential in Sigma1278b; null mutant is sensitive to elevated temperatures, metals and multiple drugs, including rapamycin, paromomycin, tacrolimus; in systematic studies homozygous null mutant diploid shows slow growth, decreased fermentative growth, inositol auxotrophy, decreased innate thermotolerance, abnormal budding pattern and elevated sensitivity to multiple drugs, including doxorubicin, echinocandin, fenpropimorph, hygromycin B
Gene.description: RNA-binding protein; promotes elongation, regulates termination, and carries poly(A) mRNA from nucleus to cytoplasm; represses translation initiation by binding eIF4G; required for pre-mRNA splicing; interacts with E3 ubiquitin ligase Bre1p, linking histone ubiquitination to mRNA processing; may have role in telomere maintenance; dissociation from mRNAs promoted by Mtr10p; phosphorylated by Sky1p in cytoplasm; protein abundance increases in response to DNA replication stress
Dubious open reading frame; unlikely to encode a functional protein, based on available experimental and comparative sequence data

Gene.name: Protein Phosphatase Methyltransferase
Gene.description: Carboxyl methyltransferase; methylates the C terminus of the protein phosphatase 2A catalytic subunit (Pph21p or Pph22p), which is important for complex formation with regulatory subunits; required for methionine to inhibit autophagy and promote growth

Gene.name: Protein Phosphatase Z
Gene.briefDescription: Serine/threonine protein phosphatase Z, isoform of Ppz1p
Gene.description: Serine/threonine protein phosphatase Z, isoform of Ppz1p; involved in regulation of potassium transport, which affects osmotic stability, cell cycle progression, and halotolerance

Gene.name: THI regulon
Gene.functionSummary: Predicted integral membrane protein whose biological role is unknown; localizes to the mitochondrion|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.description: Mitochondrial transporter repressible by thiamine; THI74 has a paralog, YML018C, that arose from the whole genome duplication; shows sequence homology to human gene SLC35F3, a thiamine transporter implicated in hypertension

Gene.name: Loss of RDNA Silencing
Gene.briefDescription: Nucleolar protein that forms a complex with Csm1p
Gene.description: Nucleolar protein that forms a complex with Csm1p; and then Mam1p at kinetochores during meiosis I to mediate accurate homolog segregation; required for condensin recruitment to the replication fork barrier site and rDNA repeat segregation

Gene.name: Disruptor Of Telomeric silencing
Gene.functionSummary: Histone methyltransferase, specific to H3-K79; involved in DNA damage checkpoint, recombinational and nucleotide-excision repair and chromatin silencing at telomeres; localized to the nucleus|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutant exhibits sensitivity to gamma rays but resistance to X rays and MMS; null mutant shows decreased silencing and has telomeres of heterogeneous length; overexpression also causes decreased silencing; in large-scale studies, null mutant has shortened chronological lifespan, increased resistance to heat, and altered resistance to various chemicals
Gene.description: Nucleosomal histone H3-Lys79 methylase; methylation is required for telomeric silencing, meiotic checkpoint control, and DNA damage response

Gene.name: Adenine PhosphoribosylTransferase
Gene.functionSummary: Protein whose biological role is unknown; localizes to the cytoplasm in a large-scale study|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutant shows reduced competitive fitness, accumulates hydrogen sulfide under cysteine supplementation, and is sensitive to calcium chelator BAPTA
Gene.description: Potential adenine phosphoribosyltransferase; encodes a protein with similarity to adenine phosphoribosyltransferase, but artificially expressed protein exhibits no enzymatic activity; APT2 has a paralog, APT1, that arose from the whole genome duplication
Dubious open reading frame; unlikely to encode a functional protein, based on available experimental and comparative sequence data

Gene.name: Suppressor of SNf1
Gene.briefDescription: Subunit of the RNA polymerase II mediator complex
Gene.description: Subunit of the RNA polymerase II mediator complex; associates with core polymerase subunits to form the RNA polymerase II holoenzyme; required for stable association of Srb10p-Srb11p kinase; essential for transcriptional regulation

Gene.functionSummary: Protein whose biological role is unknown; localizes to the cytoplasm in a large-scale study|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.briefDescription: Putative hydrolase acting on ester bonds
Gene.description: Putative hydrolase acting on ester bonds
Dubious open reading frame; unlikely to encode a functional protein, based on available experimental and comparative sequence data

Gene.name: Ribosomal Protein of the Small subunit
Gene.functionSummary: Subunit of the cytosolic small ribosomal subunit; involved in assembly of the small ribosomal subunit and translation|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.briefDescription: Ribosomal protein 51 (rp51) of the small (40s) subunit
Gene.description: Ribosomal protein 51 (rp51) of the small (40s) subunit; homologous to mammalian ribosomal protein S17, no bacterial homolog; RPS17B has a paralog, RPS17A, that arose from the whole genome duplication; protein abundance increases in response to DNA replication stress
GO.Slim: structural constituent of ribosome;structural molecule activity

Gene.name: transcriptional ADAptor
Gene.functionSummary: Chromatin-binding subunit of the SAGA and SLIK histone acetyltransferase complexes and the Ada2/Gcn5/Ada3 transcription activator complex; also binds phosphatidylserine; involved in chromatin modification and RNA polymerase II transcription activation|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutant shows altered transcription of multiple genes, weakened cell wall and decreased growth rate; in systematic studies null mutant shows inositol auxotrophy, increased sensitivity to multiple chemicals, alkaline pH and heat
Gene.description: Transcription coactivator; component of the ADA and SAGA transcriptional adaptor/HAT (histone acetyltransferase) complexes
GO.Slim: chromatin binding;lipid binding;transcription factor activity, protein binding;transferase activity

Gene.name: Ribosomal Protein of the Small subunit
Gene.functionSummary: Subunit of the cytosolic small ribosomal subunit; involved in rRNA processing and nuclear export|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.briefDescription: Protein component of the small (40S) ribosomal subunit
Gene.description: Protein component of the small (40S) ribosomal subunit; homologous to mammalian ribosomal protein S18 and bacterial S13; RPS18A has a paralog, RPS18B, that arose from the whole genome duplication; protein increases in abundance and relocalizes from cytoplasm to nuclear foci upon DNA replication stress
GO.Slim: structural constituent of ribosome;structural molecule activity

Gene.name: Yeast Homeo-Protein
Gene.functionSummary: Sequence-specific DNA binding transcription factor involved in the negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II during the G1/S transition of the mitotic cell cycle|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; overexpression impairs growth, budding, and cytoskeletal morphology; haploid null mutants exhibit abnormal vacuolar morphology, impaired fitness and anaerobic growth, increased resistance to DNA-damaging agent methyl methanesulfonate (MMS), and decreased resistance to caffeine; homozygous diploid nulls are sensitive to dessication, zinc limitation, sterol biosynthesis inhibitor fenpropimorph, and antibiotic nigericin; heterozygous diploid null shows increased fitness
Gene.description: Homeobox transcriptional repressor; binds Mcm1p and early cell cycle box (ECB) elements of cell cycle regulated genes, thereby restricting ECB-mediated transcription to the M/G1 interval; YHP1 has a paralog, YOX1, that arose from the whole genome duplication
GO.Slim: DNA binding;transcription factor activity, protein binding

Gene.briefDescription: Dual endo- and exopolyphosphatase with a role in phosphate metabolism
Gene.description: Dual endo- and exopolyphosphatase with a role in phosphate metabolism; acts as both an endopolyphosphatase cleaving long chains of polyphosphate distributively to generate shorter polymer chains and as an exopolyphosphatase catalyzing the hydrolysis of terminal phosphate from polyphosphate; localizes to the vacuole, nucleus and cytosol; functions as a homodimer; relocalizes from vacuole to cytoplasm upon DNA replication stress
Dubious open reading frame; unlikely to encode a functional protein, based on available experimental and comparative sequence data; partially overlaps the verified gene YDR456W

Gene.name: Na+/H+ eXchanger
Gene.phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutant is sensitive to hyperosmotic stress and has abnormal vacuoles, also shows decreased growth rate and sensitivity to multiple drugs, including hygromycin B, actinomycin D, bleomycin, doxorubicin, and other chemicals (MMS, hydroxyurea, flucytosine, spermine)
Gene.description: Na+/H+ and K+/H+ exchanger; required for intracellular sequestration of Na+ and K+; located in the vacuole and late endosome compartments; required for osmotolerance to acute hypertonic shock and for vacuolar fusion; ortholog of human NHE9, which is linked to autism

Gene.name: Temperature dependent Organization in Mitotic nucleus or Trigger Of Mitosis
Gene.briefDescription: E3 ubiquitin ligase of the hect-domain class
Gene.description: E3 ubiquitin ligase of the hect-domain class; has a role in mRNA export from the nucleus and may regulate transcriptional coactivators; involved in degradation of excess histones; interacts with Dia2p and is required for Dia2p degradation; required to target Cdc6p for ubiquitin-mediated destruction during G1 phase

Gene.name: Helix-Extension-Helix domain
Gene.functionSummary: Protein whose biological role is unknown; localizes to the nuclear envelope in a large-scale study|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.description: Inner nuclear membrane (INM) protein; contains helix-extension-helix (HEH) motif, nuclear localization signal sequence; targeting to the INM requires the Srp1p-Kap95p karyopherins and the Ran cycle; HEH2 has a paralog, SRC1, that arose from the whole genome duplication

Gene.name: Protein Fatty Acyltransferase
Gene.description: Palmitoyltransferase with autoacylation activity; likely functions in pathway(s) outside Ras; member of a family of putative palmitoyltransferases containing an Asp-His-His-Cys-cysteine rich (DHHC-CRD) domain

Gene.name: Mating Factor A
Gene.description: Mating pheromone a-factor; made by a cells; interacts with alpha cells to induce cell cycle arrest and other responses leading to mating; biogenesis involves C-terminal modification, N-terminal proteolysis, and export; also encoded by MFA2

Gene.name: Species-specific tRNA Processing
Gene.functionSummary: Sequence-specific DNA binding RNA polymerase II transcription activator; localizes to nucleus, cytoplasm, and plasma membrane|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.description: Transcription factor; contains a N-terminal regulatory motif (RI) that acts as a cytoplasmic retention determinant and as an Asi dependent degron in the nucleus; undergoes proteolytic processing by SPS (Ssy1p-Ptr3p-Ssy5p)-sensor component Ssy5p in response to extracellular amino acids; activates transcription of amino acid permease genes and may have a role in tRNA processing; STP1 has a paralog, STP2, that arose from the whole genome duplication
GO.Slim: DNA binding;nucleic acid binding transcription factor activity

Gene.name: aRginine MeThyltransferase
Gene.description: Arginine N5 methyltransferase; methylates ribosomal protein Rpl12 (L12) on Arg67; relative distribution to the nucleus increases upon DNA replication stress

Gene.name: Pkb-activating Kinase Homolog
Gene.briefDescription: Protein kinase with similarity to mammalian PDK1 and yeast Pkh1p/Phk2p
Gene.description: Protein kinase with similarity to mammalian PDK1 and yeast Pkh1p/Phk2p; yeast Pkh1p and Pkh2p are two redundant upstream activators of Pkc1p; identified as a multicopy suppressor of a pkh1 pkh2 double mutant

Gene.name: Set1c, homologue of Dpy30 from C.elegans
Gene.description: Subunit of the COMPASS (Set1C) complex; COMPASS methylates lysine 4 of histone H3 and is required in chromatin silencing at telomeres; contains a Dpy-30 domain that mediates interaction with Bre2p; similar to C. elegans and human DPY-30

Gene.functionSummary: Protein whose biological role is unknown; localizes to the endoplasmic reticulum in a large-scale study|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.description: Putative protein of unknown function; green fluorescent protein (GFP)-fusion protein localizes to the endoplasmic reticulum; YDR476C is not an essential gene

Gene.name: Sucrose NonFermenting
Gene.functionSummary: AMP-activated serine/threonine kinase subunit of the AMP-activated protein kinase complex; also serves as guanine nucleotide exchange factor (GEF) specific for Arf3p in response to glucose depletion; involved in regulating filamentous growth in response to starvation and carbohydrate metabolic process.|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; mutants are defective in glucose-dependent regulation of transcription, with pleiotropic effects on carbon source utilization, respiratory growth, cell wall structure, thermotolerance, hyperosmotic stress and starvation sensitivity, autophagy, peroxisome biogenesis, filamentous growth, sporulation in diploids
Gene.description: AMP-activated S/T protein kinase; forms a complex with Snf4p and members of the Sip1p/Sip2p/Gal83p family; required for transcription of glucose-repressed genes, thermotolerance, sporulation, and peroxisome biogenesis; regulates nucleocytoplasmic shuttling of Hxk2p; regulates filamentous growth and acts as a non-canonical GEF, activating Arf3p during invasive growth; SUMOylation by Mms21p inhibits its function and targets Snf1p for destruction by the Slx5-Slx8 Ub ligase
GO.Slim: guanyl-nucleotide exchange factor activity;kinase activity;transferase activity

Gene.name: PEroXisome related
Gene.functionSummary: Peroxisomal membrane protein involved in the organization and biogenesis of peroxisomes|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.briefDescription: ER-resident protein involved in peroxisomal biogenesis
Gene.description: ER-resident protein involved in peroxisomal biogenesis; ER-localized protein that associates with peroxisomes; interacts with Pex30p and reticulons Rtn1p and Yop1p to regulate peroxisome biogenesis from the ER; role in peroxisomal-destined vesicular flow from the ER; regulates peroxisomal size, number and distribution; Pex28p and Pex29p may act at steps upstream of those mediated by Pex30p, Pex31p, and Pex32p; forms ER foci upon DNA replication stress

Gene.name: Down-regulator of Invasive Growth
Gene.briefDescription: MAP kinase-responsive inhibitor of the Ste12p transcription factor
Gene.description: MAP kinase-responsive inhibitor of the Ste12p transcription factor; involved in the regulation of mating-specific genes and the invasive growth pathway; related regulators Dig1p and Dig2p bind to Ste12p; DIG2 has a paralog, DIG1, that arose from the whole genome duplication

Gene.name: PHOsphate metabolism
Gene.phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutant accumulates reduced levels of N-ribosylnicotinamide; in large-scale studies, null mutant displays reductions in competitive fitness and starvation resistance, and is sensitive to sodium selenide
Gene.description: Repressible vacuolar alkaline phosphatase; regulated by levels of Pi and by Pho4p, Pho9p, Pho80p, Pho81p and Pho85p; dephosphorylates phosphotyrosyl peptides; contributes to NAD+ metabolism by producing nicotinamide riboside from NMN

Gene.name: Complexed With Cef1p
Gene.functionSummary: A component of U2-type spliceosomal complex involved in mRNA splicing|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.briefDescription: Protein involved in RNA splicing by the spliceosome
Gene.description: Protein involved in RNA splicing by the spliceosome; component of a complex containing Cef1p; interacts genetically with ISY1 and BUD13; may bind RNA; has similarity to S. pombe Cwf21p

Gene.name: Killer toxin REsistant
Gene.description: Alpha1,2-mannosyltransferase of the Golgi; involved in protein mannosylation; KRE2 has a paralog, KTR6, that arose from the whole genome duplication
GO.Slim: transferase activity;transferase activity, transferring glycosyl groups

Gene.name: Vacuolar Protein Sorting
Gene.briefDescription: Component of the GARP (Golgi-associated retrograde protein) complex
Gene.description: Component of the GARP (Golgi-associated retrograde protein) complex; GARP is required for the recycling of proteins from endosomes to the late Golgi, and for mitosis after DNA damage induced checkpoint arrest; involved in localization of actin and chitin; members of the GARP complex are Vps51p-Vps52p-Vps53p-Vps54p

Gene.name: Vacuolar Protein Sorting
Gene.briefDescription: Htz1p-binding component of the SWR1 complex
Gene.description: Htz1p-binding component of the SWR1 complex; exchanges histone variant H2AZ (Htz1p) for chromatin-bound histone H2A; may function as a lock that prevents removal of H2AZ from nucleosomes; required for vacuolar protein sorting

Gene.name: Vacuolar Protein Sorting
Gene.briefDescription: Protein involved in late endosome to vacuole transport
Gene.description: Protein involved in late endosome to vacuole transport; cytoplasmic and vacuolar membrane protein; required for normal filament maturation during pseudohyphal growth; may function in targeting cargo proteins for degradation; interacts with Vta1p

Gene.name: Perish in the Absence of CIN8
Gene.briefDescription: Dynein intermediate chain, microtubule motor protein
Gene.description: Dynein intermediate chain, microtubule motor protein; required for intracellular transport and cell division; acts in cytoplasmic dynein pathway; forms complex with dynein light chain Dyn2p that promotes Dyn1p homodimerization and potentiates motor processivity; Dyn2p-Pac11p complex is also important for interaction of dynein motor complex with dynactin complex; forms cortical cytoplasmic microtubule capture site with Num1p; essential in the absence of CIN8

Gene.name: Pkb-activating Kinase Homolog
Gene.phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutant displays sensitivity to multiple drug,including caffeine, fluconazole, tunicamycin, hydroxyurea, bleomycin, MMS, cicloheximide
Gene.description: Serine/threonine protein kinase; involved in sphingolipid-mediated signaling pathway that controls endocytosis; activates Ypk1p and Ykr2p, components of signaling cascade required for maintenance of cell wall integrity; redundant with Pkh2p; PKH1 has a paralog, PKH2, that arose from the whole genome duplication
Dubious open reading frame; unlikely to encode a functional protein, based on available experimental and comparative sequence data

Gene.name: Implicated in Zinc Homeostasis
Gene.briefDescription: Membrane protein involved in zinc ion homeostasis
Gene.description: Membrane protein involved in zinc ion homeostasis; member of the four-protein IZH family; transcription is regulated directly by Zap1p, expression induced by zinc deficiency and fatty acids; deletion increases sensitivity to elevated zinc; IZH1 has a paralog, IZH4, that arose from the whole genome duplication

Gene.name: Mitochondrial Zinc Maintenance
Gene.briefDescription: Protein required for assembly of the cytochrome bc(1) complex
Gene.description: Protein required for assembly of the cytochrome bc(1) complex; acts as a chaperone for Rip1p and facilitates its insertion into the complex at a late stage of assembly; localized to the mitochondrial matrix; null mutant exhibits a respiratory growth defect and reduced mitochondrial zinc levels, which is characteristic of mutations affecting bc(1) complex assembly; member of the LYR protein family; human LYRM7 is a functional ortholog

Gene.name: Ribosomal Small subunit of Mitochondria
Gene.functionSummary: Component of the small subunit of the mitochondrial ribosome, which mediates translation in the mitochondrion; genetic interactions suggest a role in translational initiation|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.briefDescription: Mitochondrial ribosomal protein of the small subunit
Gene.description: Mitochondrial ribosomal protein of the small subunit; genetic interactions suggest a possible role in promoting translation initiation
GO.Slim: structural constituent of ribosome;structural molecule activity

Gene.name: Vacuolar Protein Sorting
Gene.briefDescription: Component of CORVET membrane tethering complex
Gene.description: Component of CORVET membrane tethering complex; cytoplasmic protein required for the sorting and processing of soluble vacuolar proteins, acidification of the vacuolar lumen, and assembly of the vacuolar H+-ATPase

Gene.name: PUmilio-homology domain Family
Gene.description: Pumilio-homology domain protein; binds the 3' UTR of ASH1 mRNA and represses its translation, resulting in proper asymmetric localization of ASH1 mRNA; required at post-transcriptional step for efficient retrotransposition; absence results in decreased Ty1 Gag:GFP protein levels; co-sediments with the 60S ribosomal subunit and is required for its biogenesis

Gene.name: myo-Inositol TRansporter
Gene.description: Myo-inositol transporter; member of the sugar transporter superfamily; expression is repressed by inositol and choline via Opi1p and derepressed via Ino2p and Ino4p; relative distribution to the vacuole increases upon DNA replication stress; ITR1 has a paralog, ITR2, that arose from the whole genome duplication

Gene.name: Ribosomal Protein of the Large subunit
Gene.functionSummary: Subunit of the cytosolic large ribosomal subunit; involved in translation|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.description: Ribosomal 60S subunit protein L37B; required for processing of 27SB pre-rRNA and formation of stable 66S assembly intermediates; protein abundance increases in response to DNA replication stress; homologous to mammalian ribosomal protein L37, no bacterial homolog; RPL37B has a paralog, RPL37A, that arose from the whole genome duplication
GO.Slim: structural constituent of ribosome;structural molecule activity

Gene.name: PLasmid Maintenance
Gene.briefDescription: Putative transcription factor, contains Forkhead Associated domain
Gene.description: Putative transcription factor, contains Forkhead Associated domain; found associated with chromatin; target of SBF transcription factor; induced in response to DNA damaging agents and deletion of telomerase; PLM2 has a paralog, TOS4, that arose from the whole genome duplication

Gene.name: S-AdenosylMethionine requiring
Gene.description: S-adenosylmethionine synthetase; catalyzes transfer of the adenosyl group of ATP to the sulfur atom of methionine; comparative analysis suggests that a mitochondrially targeted form may result from translation starting at a non-canonical codon upstream of the annotated start codon

Gene.name: Lipid Phosphate Phosphatase
Gene.description: Lipid phosphate phosphatase; catalyzes Mg(2+)-independent dephosphorylation of phosphatidic acid (PA), lysophosphatidic acid, and diacylglycerol pyrophosphate; involved in control of the cellular levels of phosphatidylinositol and PA

Gene.name: Stationary Phase Gene
Gene.functionSummary: Protein whose biological role is unknown; localizes to the endoplasmic reticulum|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.briefDescription: Protein required for high temperature survival during stationary phase
Gene.description: Protein required for high temperature survival during stationary phase; not required for growth on nonfermentable carbon sources; SWAT-GFP and mCherry fusion proteins localize to the endoplasmic reticulum

Gene.name: Polymerase SuPpressor
Gene.briefDescription: Asn and gln rich protein of unknown function
Gene.description: Asn and gln rich protein of unknown function; high-copy suppressor of POL1 (DNA polymerase alpha) and partial suppressor of CDC2 (polymerase delta) and CDC6 (pre-RC loading factor) mutations; overexpression results in growth inhibition; PSP1 has a paralog, YLR177W, that arose from the whole genome duplication

Gene.name: Grand Meiotic recombination Cluster
Gene.description: Protein involved in meiotic progression; mutants are delayed in meiotic nuclear division and are defective in synaptonemal complex assembly; possible membrane-localized protein; SWAT-GFP and mCherry fusion proteins localize to the endoplasmic reticulum and vacuole respectively

Gene.name: Growth Inhibitory
Gene.functionSummary: Protein kinase involved in septin ring assembly and budding cell bud growth; localizes to the bud neck|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.briefDescription: Protein kinase involved in bud growth and assembly of the septin ring
Gene.description: Protein kinase involved in bud growth and assembly of the septin ring; proposed to have kinase-dependent and kinase-independent activities; undergoes autophosphorylation; similar to Hsl1p; GIN4 has a paralog, KCC4, that arose from the whole genome duplication

Gene.name: GlutamiNe Permease
Gene.description: High-affinity glutamine permease; also transports Leu, Ser, Thr, Cys, Met and Asn; expression is fully dependent on Grr1p and modulated by the Ssy1p-Ptr3p-Ssy5p (SPS) sensor of extracellular amino acids; GNP1 has a paralog, AGP1, that arose from the whole genome duplication
Dubious open reading frame; unlikely to encode a functional protein, based on available experimental and comparative sequence data

Gene.name: Succinate DeHydrogenase
Gene.functionSummary: Protein involved in gluconeogenisis regulation and carbon utilization; localized to mitochondrial intermembrane space|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.briefDescription: Mitochondrial protein involved in assembly of succinate dehydrogenase
Gene.description: Mitochondrial protein involved in assembly of succinate dehydrogenase; has a role in maturation of the Sdh2p subunit; localized to the mitochondrial intermembrane space; required for acetate utilization and gluconeogenesis; mutation in Drosophila ortholog SDHAF3 causes reduced succinate dehydrogenase activity and neuronal and muscular dysfunction; member of the LYR protein family

Gene.name: Early Meiotic Induction
Gene.description: Non-essential protein of unknown function; required for transcriptional induction of the early meiotic-specific transcription factor IME1, also required for sporulation; contains twin cysteine-x9-cysteine motifs; deletion affects mitochondrial morphology

Gene.name: GlutaRedoXin
Gene.description: Cytoplasmic glutaredoxin; thioltransferase, glutathione-dependent disulfide oxidoreductase involved in maintaining redox state of target proteins, also exhibits glutathione peroxidase activity, expression induced in response to stress; GRX2 has two in-frame start codons resulting in a shorter isoform that is retained in the cytosol and a longer form translocated to the mitochondrial matrix; GRX2 has a paralog, GRX1, that arose from the whole genome duplication

Gene.functionSummary: Protein whose biological role is unknown; localizes to the mitochondrion and to the nucleus in a large-scale study|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.briefDescription: Protein of unknown function that localizes to mitochondria
Gene.description: Protein of unknown function that localizes to mitochondria; overexpression affects endocytic protein trafficking; YDR514C has a paralog, GFD2, that arose from the whole genome duplication

Gene.name: SuLFide production
Gene.briefDescription: RNA binding protein that associates with polysomes
Gene.description: RNA binding protein that associates with polysomes; may be involved in regulating mRNA translation; involved in the copper-dependent mineralization of copper sulfide complexes on cell surface in cells cultured in copper salts; SLF1 has a paralog, SRO9, that arose from the whole genome duplication; protein abundance increases in response to DNA replication stress

Gene.name: Early Meiotic Induction
Gene.functionSummary: Cytoplasmic protein implicated in sporulation and transcription regulation|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.description: Non-essential protein of unknown function; required for transcriptional induction of the early meiotic-specific transcription factor IME1; required for sporulation; expression regulated by glucose-repression transcription factors Mig1/2p; EMI2 has a paralog, GLK1, that arose from the whole genome duplication; protein abundance increases in response to DNA replication stress

Gene.name: GRasp65 (Golgi reassembly stacking protein of 65kD) Homolog
Gene.briefDescription: Acetylated cis-Golgi protein, involved in ER to Golgi transport
Gene.description: Acetylated cis-Golgi protein, involved in ER to Golgi transport; homolog of human GRASP65; forms a complex with the coiled-coil protein Bug1p; mutants are compromised for the fusion of ER-derived vesicles with Golgi membranes; protein abundance increases in response to DNA replication stress

Gene.name: ER protein Unnecessary for Growth
Gene.briefDescription: Protein disulfide isomerase of the endoplasmic reticulum lumen
Gene.description: Protein disulfide isomerase of the endoplasmic reticulum lumen; EUG1 has a paralog, PDI1, that arose from the whole genome duplication; function overlaps with that of Pdi1p; may interact with nascent polypeptides in the ER

Gene.name: FKBP Proline Rotamase
Gene.phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutant is sensitive to freeze-thaw treatment, also shows sensitivity to heat and 5-fluorouracil; null mutant is sensitive to human huntingtin protein
Gene.description: Membrane-bound peptidyl-prolyl cis-trans isomerase (PPIase); binds to the drugs FK506 and rapamycin; expression pattern suggests possible involvement in ER protein trafficking; relocalizes from nucleus to vacuole upon DNA replication stress; mutation is functionally complemented by human FKBP2

Gene.name: URacil Catabolism
Gene.briefDescription: Putative Zn(II)2Cys6 motif containing transcription factor
