Gene.description: Peptidyl-prolyl cis-trans isomerase (cyclophilin); catalyzes the cis-trans isomerization of peptide bonds N-terminal to proline residues; binds to Hsp82p and contributes to chaperone activity; plays a role in determining prion variants

Gene.name: Regulator of (H+)-ATPase in Vacuolar membrane
Gene.briefDescription: Subunit of RAVE complex (Rav1p, Rav2p, Skp1p)
Gene.description: Subunit of RAVE complex (Rav1p, Rav2p, Skp1p); the RAVE complex promotes assembly of the V-ATPase holoenzyme; required for transport between the early and late endosome/PVC and for localization of TGN membrane proteins; potential Cdc28p substrate

Gene.name: PETite colonies
Gene.briefDescription: Protein required for assembly of cytochrome c oxidase
Gene.description: Protein required for assembly of cytochrome c oxidase; exists as an oligomer; described as both an integral mitochondrial inner membrane protein facing the intermembrane space (IMS) and as a soluble IMS protein; contains a twin Cx9C motif; imported into the IMS via the MIA import machinery

Gene.name: RADiation sensitive
Gene.briefDescription: Protein involved in transcription-coupled nucleotide excision repair
Gene.description: Protein involved in transcription-coupled nucleotide excision repair; repairs UV-induced DNA lesions; recruitment to DNA lesions is dependent on an elongating RNA polymerase II; homolog of human CSB protein

Gene.name: Hect Ubiquitin Ligase
Gene.briefDescription: Protein with similarity to hect domain E3 ubiquitin-protein ligases
Gene.description: Protein with similarity to hect domain E3 ubiquitin-protein ligases; not essential for viability; found in association with Trf4 in TRAMP complex

Dubious open reading frame; unlikely to encode a functional protein, based on available experimental and comparative sequence data; partially overlaps verified gene HUL4/YJR036C; deletion mutant has decreased spore survival in Drosophila feces
Dubious open reading frame; unlikely to encode a functional protein, based on available experimental and comparative sequence data

Gene.functionSummary: Protein whose biological role is unknown; localizes to the mitochondrion in large-scale studies|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.description: Putative protein of unknown function; the authentic, non-tagged protein is detected in highly purified mitochondria in high-throughput studies

Gene.name: Glycerol Ethanol, Ferric requiring
Gene.description: Voltage-gated chloride channel; localized to the golgi, the endosomal system, and plasma membrane; involved in cation homeostasis; highly homologous to vertebrate voltage-gated chloride channels; modulates TBSV model (+) RNA virus replication by regulating copper metabolism

Gene.name: POLymerase
Gene.phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutant displays chromosome instability and sensitivity to cold, HU, and selenite; in large-scale studies, null mutant displays reduced competitive fitness in a variety of media, is sensitive to heat and desiccation, has elongated telomeres, and shows altered resistance to a variety of chemicals
Gene.briefDescription: Third subunit of DNA polymerase delta
Gene.description: Third subunit of DNA polymerase delta; involved in chromosomal DNA replication; required for error-prone DNA synthesis in the presence of DNA damage and processivity; forms a complex with Rev3p, Rev7p and Pol31p; interacts with Hys2p, PCNA (Pol30p), and Pol1p

Gene.name: CYtochrome C
Gene.functionSummary: Electron carrier of the mitochondrial inter membrane space, involved in ubiquinol-to-cytochrome c and cytochrome c-to-oxygen electron transport|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutant fails to grow on nonfermentable carbon sources and displays resistance to 3-chlorolactic acid; in large-scale studies, null mutant shows reduced competitive fitness, shorter chronological lifespan, decreased desiccation resistance, and poor utilization of proline, ammonium, glutamine, and glutamate as nitrogen sources
Gene.description: Cytochrome c, isoform 1; also known as iso-1-cytochrome c; electron carrier of mitochondrial intermembrane space that transfers electrons from ubiquinone-cytochrome c oxidoreductase to cytochrome c oxidase during cellular respiration; CYC1 has a paralog, CYC7, that arose from the whole genome duplication; human homolog CYC1 can complement yeast null mutant; mutations in human CYC1 cause insulin-responsive hyperglycemia

Gene.name: Unidentified TRanscript
Gene.description: ATP-NADH kinase; phosphorylates both NAD and NADH; active as a hexamer; enhances the activity of ferric reductase (Fre1p); UTR1 has a paralog, YEF1, that arose from the whole genome duplication

Gene.name: Interactor of SYf1p
Gene.description: Member of the NineTeen Complex (NTC); NTC contains Prp19p and stabilizes U6 snRNA in catalytic forms of spliceosome containing U2, U5, and U6 snRNAs; interacts with Prp16p to modulate splicing fidelity; isy1 syf2 cells have defective spindles

Gene.name: OSMotic sensitivity
Gene.functionSummary: Fumarate reductase with a role in oxidation of FAD, which is required for oxidative protein folding in the endoplasmic reticulum; localized to both the ER and mitochondria|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.briefDescription: Fumarate reductase, catalyzes the reduction of fumarate to succinate
Gene.description: Fumarate reductase, catalyzes the reduction of fumarate to succinate; required for the reoxidation of intracellular NADH under anaerobic conditions; mutations cause osmotic sensitivity; has two translation start sites, one at the annotated start codon which produces an ER-targeted form required for anaerobic growth, and one at codon 32 which produces a mitochondrially-targeted form; OSM1 has a paralog, FRD1, that arose from the whole genome duplication

Gene.name: RADiation sensitive
Gene.description: Nucleotide excision repair (NER) protein; binds damaged DNA during NER; binds DNA in an ATP-dependent manner (with Rad16p) during NER; required for repair of non-transcribed chromatin; subunit of Nucleotide Excision Repair Factor 4 (NEF4) and the Elongin-Cullin-Socs (ECS) ligase complex

Gene.name: Byr-Four-Alike
Gene.briefDescription: Subunit of a two-component GTPase-activating protein, Bfa1p-Bub2p
Gene.description: Subunit of a two-component GTPase-activating protein, Bfa1p-Bub2p; contributes to GAP activity, inactivating Tem1 by stimulating GTP hydrolysis following damage or misalignment of the mitotic spindle; functions as a guanine-nucleotide exchange inhibitor (GDI) for Tem1p; involved in multiple cell cycle checkpoint pathways that control mitotic exit; required when telomeres are damaged, but not for all types of chromosomal DNA damage; phosphorylated by the Polo-like kinase Cdc5p

Gene.name: Potassium (K) regulator of CcH1
Gene.briefDescription: Potassium transporter that mediates K+ influx
Gene.description: Potassium transporter that mediates K+ influx; activates high-affinity Ca2+ influx system (HACS) during mating pheromone response; expression up-regulated in response to alpha factor; localized to sites of polarized growth; member of a fungal-specific gene family; potential Cdc28p substrate; KCH1 has a paralog, PRM6, that arose from the whole genome duplication

Gene.name: HIgh Temperature growth
Gene.functionSummary: Protein involved in C/D snoRNP assembly; localized to nucleus and cytoplasm in high-throughput studies|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.briefDescription: Protein involved in C/D snoRNP assembly
Gene.description: Protein involved in C/D snoRNP assembly; regulates abundance of Rsa1p; required for growth at high temperature; similar to human ZNHIT3

Gene.functionSummary: Protein whose biological role is unknown; localizes to the nucleus and cytoplasm in large-scale studies|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.description: Protein of unknown function; green fluorescent protein (GFP)-fusion protein localizes to both the cytoplasm and the nucleus; relative distribution to the nucleus increases upon DNA replication stress

Gene.name: clathrin Associated Protein complex Small subunit
Gene.phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; in systematic studies null mutant is sensitive to ferrous ion chelator ferrozine, shows elevated accumulation of cadmium and manganese, and reduced competitive fitness
Gene.briefDescription: Small subunit of the clathrin-associated adaptor complex AP-2
Gene.description: Small subunit of the clathrin-associated adaptor complex AP-2; AP-2 is involved in protein sorting at the plasma membrane; related to the sigma subunit of the mammalian plasma membrane clathrin-associated protein (AP-2) complex

Gene.name: Putative serine/Threonine protein Kinase
Gene.description: Serine/threonine protein kinase; involved in regulation of ion transport across plasma membrane; carboxyl terminus is essential for glucose-dependent Pma1p activation via phosphorylation of Pma1p-Ser899; enhances spermine uptake; PTK2 has a paralog, PTK1, that arose from the whole genome duplication

Gene.name: Centromere Binding Factor
Gene.functionSummary: Sequence specific DNA-binding RNA polymerase II transcription activator and repressor; subunit of the Cbf1-Met4-Met28 complex; activates transcription of genes involved in inositol biosynthetic process and sulfate assimilation and represses transcription of genes involved in ceramide biosynthetic process; localized to the mitochondrion in high-throughput studies|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.description: Basic helix-loop-helix (bHLH) protein; forms homodimer to bind E-box consensus sequence CACGTG present at MET gene promoters and centromere DNA element I (CDEI); affects nucleosome positioning at this motif; associates with other transcription factors such as Met4p and Isw1p to mediate transcriptional activation or repression; associates with kinetochore proteins, required for chromosome segregation; protein abundance increases in response to DNA replication stress
GO.Slim: DNA binding;nucleic acid binding transcription factor activity;transcription factor activity, protein binding;transcription factor binding

Gene.name: MaNNosyltransferase regulator
Gene.functionSummary: Protein whose biological role and cellular location are unknown|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.description: Putative protein of unknown function; non-essential gene; transcription repressed by Rm101p; YJR061W has a paralog, MNN4, that arose from the whole genome duplication

Gene.name: N-Terminal Amidase
Gene.description: Amidase; removes the amide group from N-terminal asparagine and glutamine residues to generate proteins with N-terminal aspartate and glutamate residues that are targets of ubiquitin-mediated degradation

Gene.name: Target Of Rapamycin
Gene.functionSummary: Protein kinase subunit of TORC1; involved in signal transduction, regulation of cell growth and autophagy, and the cellular response to DNA metabolism; localizes to cellular membranes, nucleus and cytoplasm|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutant shows increased chronological and replicative lifespan, increased thermotolerance and oxidative stress resistance, higher accumulation of glycogen and increased entry into stationary phase; null mutation causes increased sensitivity to rapamycin; overexpression leads to rapamycin resistance; in systematic studies null mutant is sensitive to caffeine, camptothecin and ethanol, but resistant to acetate, bleomycin, fenpropimorph
Gene.briefDescription: PIK-related protein kinase and rapamycin target
Gene.description: PIK-related protein kinase and rapamycin target; subunit of TORC1, a complex that controls growth in response to nutrients by regulating translation, transcription, ribosome biogenesis, nutrient transport and autophagy; involved in meiosis; TOR1 has a paralog, TOR2, that arose from the whole genome duplication

Gene.name: 6-n-HydroxylAMinopurine sensitive
Gene.functionSummary: Nucleoside-triphosphate diphosphatase involved in nucleotide catabolism; active against a wide variety of nucleotide substrates including ATP, CTP, GTP, ITP, TTP, UTP and XTP; localizes to both the nucleus and the cytoplasm|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutant is sensitive to nucleoside analogs and azoles; overexpression increases resistance to nucleoside analogs and methotrexate
Gene.description: Nucleoside triphosphate pyrophosphohydrolase; active against various substrates including ITP, dITP and XTP; mediates exclusion of non canonical purines, pyrimidines from dNTP pools; functions with YJL055W to mediate resistance to 5-FU; specifically reduces the incorporation of 5-FU into RNA without affecting uptake or incorporation of uracil into RNA; protein abundance increases in response to DNA replication stress; yeast HAM1 can complement knockdown of human homolog ITPA

Gene.name: Ligand of eIF5A
Gene.description: Deoxyhypusine hydroxylase; HEAT-repeat containing metalloenzyme that catalyzes hypusine formation; binds to and is required for the modification of Hyp2p (eIF5A); complements S. pombe mmd1 mutants defective in mitochondrial positioning; protein abundance increases in response to DNA replication stress

Gene.name: OverProducer of Inositol
Gene.phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutant displays Opi- phenotype (overproduction and excretion of inositol in the absence of inositol and choline), abnormal ER morphology, and reduced resistance to desiccation; in large-scale studies null mutant shows reduced competitive fitness, decreased innate thermotolerance, increased glycogen accumulation, reduced filamentous growth, and sensitivity to various chemicals
Gene.description: Methylene-fatty-acyl-phospholipid synthase; catalyzes the last two steps in phosphatidylcholine biosynthesis; also known as phospholipid methyltransferase

Gene.name: Multicopy suppressor Of ts Gsp1
Gene.phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutant displays slow growth, sensitivity to nickel, cadmium, caffeine, hygromycin B, SDS and caspofungin; overexpression results in reduced telomeric silencing
Gene.briefDescription: Conserved nuclear protein that interacts with GTP-Gsp1p
Gene.description: Conserved nuclear protein that interacts with GTP-Gsp1p; stimulates nucleotide release from Gsp1p; involved in nuclear protein import; nucleotide release is inhibited by Yrb1p

Gene.name: Homologous to OCh1
Gene.description: Alpha-1,6-mannosyltransferase; involved in cell wall mannan biosynthesis; subunit of a Golgi-localized complex that also contains Anp1p, Mnn9p, Mnn11p, and Mnn10p; identified as a suppressor of a cell lysis sensitive pkc1-371 allele
GO.Slim: transferase activity;transferase activity, transferring glycosyl groups

Gene.name: Mitochondrial Import Receptor
Gene.description: Mitochondrial phosphate carrier; imports inorganic phosphate into mitochondria; functionally redundant with Pic2p but more abundant than Pic2p under normal conditions; phosphorylated

Gene.name: Biosynthesis of Nicotinic Acid
Gene.functionSummary: Tryptophan 2,3-dioxygenase involved in de novo NAD biosynthesis from tryptophan; localizes to the cytoplasm|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.description: Tryptophan 2,3-dioxygenase or indoleamine 2,3-dioxygenase; required for de novo biosynthesis of NAD from tryptophan via kynurenine; interacts genetically with telomere capping gene CDC13; regulated by Hst1p and Aftp

Gene.functionSummary: Protein whose biological role and cellular location are unknown|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.description: Putative protein of unknown function; mutation results in impaired mitochondrial respiration

Gene.name: Altered Inheritance rate of Mitochondria
Gene.functionSummary: Protein with a role in organization of the mitochondrial inner membrane; integral to the inner membrane|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutant displays a decreased growth rate and decreased competitive fitness on non-fermentable carbons sources, as well as decreased competitive fitness on minimal medium and reduced growth under anaerobic conditions; null mutant displays an increased frequency of spontaneous mitochondrial genome loss and mitochondrial morphology defects including an increased quantity of inner membrane septae on fermentable carbon sources, and enlarged mitochondria with a disrupted organization of the inner membrane on nonfermentable carbons sources; heterozygous null mutant is haploproficient; overexpression results in an increase in invasive growth
Gene.briefDescription: Protein with a role in determining mitochondrial architecture
Gene.description: Protein with a role in determining mitochondrial architecture; inner membrane protein that interacts physically and genetically with the MICOS complex and is required for its integrity

Gene.name: Esa1p-Associated Factor
Gene.briefDescription: Subunit of the NuA4 acetyltransferase complex
Gene.description: Subunit of the NuA4 acetyltransferase complex; this complex acetylates histone H4 and NuA3 acetyltransferase complex that acetylates histone H3

Gene.name: Assembly Complementing Factor
Gene.functionSummary: Protein whose biological role and cellular location are unknown|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; in systematic studies, homozygous null mutant diploid has inositol auxotrophy and reduced innate thermotolerance; haploid null mutant displays elevated accumulation of cadmium, sensitivity to amitrole, cycloheximide, pentachlorophenol and myriocin
Gene.description: Protein of unknown function; computational analysis of large-scale protein-protein interaction data suggests a possible role in actin cytoskeleton organization; potential Cdc28p substrate

Gene.briefDescription: Protein that forms a complex with Thp3p
Gene.description: Protein that forms a complex with Thp3p; may have a role in transcription elongation and/or mRNA splicing; identified as a COP9 signalosome component but phenotype and interactions suggest it may not be involved with the signalosome

Dubious open reading frame; unlikely to encode a functional protein, based on available experimental and comparative sequence data; not conserved in closely related Saccharomyces species; partially overlaps the verified genes STE18 and ECM2

Gene.name: ER Membrane protein Complex
Gene.briefDescription: Member of conserved ER transmembrane complex
Gene.description: Member of conserved ER transmembrane complex; required for efficient folding of proteins in the ER; null mutant displays induction of the unfolded protein response; homologous to worm Y57G7A.10/EMC-2, fly CG17556, human TTC35

Gene.name: Glucose Repression-Resistant
Gene.briefDescription: F-box protein component of an SCF ubiquitin-ligase complex
Gene.description: F-box protein component of an SCF ubiquitin-ligase complex; modular substrate specificity factor which associates with core SCF (Cdc53p, Skp1p and Hrt1p/Rbx1p) to form the SCF(Grr1) complex; SCF(Grr1) acts as a ubiquitin-protein ligase directing ubiquitination of substrates such as: Gic2p, Mks1p, Mth1p, Cln1p, Cln2p and Cln3p; involved in carbon catabolite repression, glucose-dependent divalent cation transport, glucose transport, morphogenesis, and sulfite detoxification

Gene.name: Just Say No
Gene.functionSummary: mRNA binding protein involved in localization of protein complexes and establishing the location of the mitochondrion; localizes to the cytoplasm, cell wall, and cytoplasmic side of the mitochondrial outer membrane|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.briefDescription: Member of the Puf family of RNA-binding proteins
Gene.description: Member of the Puf family of RNA-binding proteins; interacts with mRNAs encoding membrane-associated proteins; involved in localizing the Arp2/3 complex to mitochondria; overexpression causes increased sensitivity to benomyl; JSN1 has a paralog, PUF2, that arose from the whole genome duplication

Gene.name: BUD site selection
Gene.functionSummary: GTP-binding protein involved in septin ring organization and axial bud site selection; localizes to mother-bud necks and bud scars|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.briefDescription: Anillin-like protein involved in bud-site selection
Gene.description: Anillin-like protein involved in bud-site selection; required for the axial budding pattern; required for the formation and disassembly of the double septin ring structure, and generally for septin organization; functions as a platform linking the cytokinesis tag septins to the axial landmark through its multiple domains; in vivo substrate of Cdc28p/Clb2p

Gene.name: Inducer of MEiosis
Gene.phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; in haploids null mutant shows decreased competitive fitness and overexpression increases mitotic recombination; in diploids homozygous null mutation abolishes sporulation, whereas overexpression increases sporulation efficiency
Gene.briefDescription: Master regulator of meiosis that is active only during meiotic events
Gene.description: Master regulator of meiosis that is active only during meiotic events; activates transcription of early meiotic genes through interaction with Ume6p; degraded by the 26S proteasome following phosphorylation by Ime2p; transcription is negatively regulated in cis by the IRT1 long noncoding antisense RNA

Gene.name: Ribosomal Protein of the Large subunit
Gene.functionSummary: Subunit of the cytosolic large ribosomal subunit; involved in translation|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.description: Ribosomal 60S subunit protein L43B; homologous to mammalian ribosomal protein L37A, no bacterial homolog; RPL43B has a paralog, RPL43A, that arose from the whole genome duplication; protein abundance increases in response to DNA replication stress
GO.Slim: structural constituent of ribosome;structural molecule activity

Gene.name: Succinate-Fumarate Carrier
Gene.description: Mitochondrial succinate-fumarate transporter; transports succinate into and fumarate out of the mitochondrion; required for ethanol and acetate utilization
Xylose and arabinose reductase; member of the aldo-keto reductase (AKR) family; GFP-fusion protein is induced in response to the DNA-damaging agent MMS

Gene.name: J-protein (Type III)
Gene.description: Protein of unknown function; contains a CSL Zn finger and a DnaJ-domain; involved in diphthamide biosynthesis; ortholog human Dph4

Gene.functionSummary: Protein whose biological role is unknown; localizes to the cytoplasm and mitochondria in large-scale studies|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.description: Putative protein of unknown function; the authentic, non-tagged protein is detected in highly purified mitochondria in high-throughput studies

Gene.name: Yeast Ubiquitin Hydrolase
Gene.functionSummary: A ubiquitin-specific protease that is thiol-dependent; involved in ubiquitin homeostatis and localizes to the cytoplasm|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.description: Ubiquitin C-terminal hydrolase; cleaves ubiquitin-protein fusions to generate monomeric ubiquitin; hydrolyzes the peptide bond at the C-terminus of ubiquitin; also the major processing enzyme for the ubiquitin-like protein Rub1p

Gene.name: Altered Inheritance of Mitochondria
Gene.functionSummary: Protein whose biological role and cellular location are unknown|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutant has increased competitive fitness on minimal medium; null mutant displays an increased frequency of spontaneous mitochondrial genome loss
Gene.description: Protein of unknown function; non-tagged protein is detected in purified mitochondria in high-throughput studies; similar to murine NOR1; null mutant is viable and displays elevated frequency of mitochondrial genome loss

Gene.name: Vacuolar Protein Sorting
Gene.description: Component of the ESCRT-II complex; ESCRT-II is involved in ubiquitin-dependent sorting of proteins into the endosome

Gene.name: URAcil requiring
Gene.briefDescription: Minor CTP synthase isozyme (see also URA7)
Gene.description: Minor CTP synthase isozyme (see also URA7); catalyzes the ATP-dependent transfer of the amide nitrogen from glutamine to UTP, forming CTP, the final step in de novo biosynthesis of pyrimidines; involved in phospholipid biosynthesis; capable of forming cytoplasmic filaments termed cytoophidium, especially during conditions of glucose depletion; URA8 has a paralog, URA7, that arose from the whole genome duplication

Gene.name: ADenOsine kinase
Gene.phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutant shows increased accumulation of glycogen and resistance to adenosine analog cordycepin; in systematic studies, null mutant shows reduced growth rate and lower competitive fitness, smaller peroxisomes, sensitivity to tunicamycin, caspofungin and myriocin, and increased resistance to hydroxyurea
Gene.description: Adenosine kinase; required for the utilization of S-adenosylmethionine (AdoMet); may be involved in recycling adenosine produced through the methyl cycle

Gene.name: ExtraCellular Mutant
Gene.functionSummary: Predicted integral membrane protein whose biological role is unknown|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.briefDescription: Protein involved in calcium homeostasis and exit from quiescence
Gene.description: Protein involved in calcium homeostasis and exit from quiescence; required for proper trehalose levels during quiescence; may play a role in cell wall biosynthesis, mutants are hypersensitive to antifungal, Papulacandin B; null mutants have increased plasmid loss; interacts with Pdr5p

Gene.name: LIpase Homolog
Gene.description: Putative lipase

Gene.name: Aberrant Microtubules
Gene.functionSummary: Protein involved in organization of microtubule cytoskeleton; unknown localization|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; in systematic studies, null mutant shows decreased rate of growth with galactose as a carbon source and proline as a nitrogen source; also shows sensitivity to cycloheximide, streptomycin, nickel and selenide
Gene.description: Protein of unknown function; required for normal microtubule organization

Gene.name: Carbamyl Phosphate synthetase A
Gene.briefDescription: Large subunit of carbamoyl phosphate synthetase
Gene.description: Large subunit of carbamoyl phosphate synthetase; carbamoyl phosphate synthetase catalyzes a step in the synthesis of citrulline, an arginine precursor

Gene.name: Yeast Myotubularin Related
Gene.description: Phosphatidylinositol 3-phosphate (PI3P) phosphatase; involved in various protein sorting pathways, including CVT targeting and endosome to vacuole transport; has similarity to the conserved myotubularin dual specificity phosphatase family

Gene.name: PeroXisomal Protein
Gene.functionSummary: Protein whose biological role is unknown; localizes to the mitochondrion in a large-scale study|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.briefDescription: Peroxisomal matrix protein with naturally active promoter
Gene.description: Peroxisomal matrix protein with naturally active promoter; well-conserved in fungi; localized to peroxisomes under physiological growth conditions; levels of some amino acids are altered upon both knockout and overexpression, suggesting potential involvement of Pxp2p in amino acid metabolism or related cellular metabolic processes (needs further study); GFP-fusion protein displays inherent dual localization with large proportion localizing to cytosol

Gene.name: Ribosomal Small subunit of Mitochondria
Gene.functionSummary: Component of the small subunit of the mitochondrial ribosome, which mediates translation in the mitochondrion|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.briefDescription: Mitochondrial ribosomal protein of the small subunit
Gene.description: Mitochondrial ribosomal protein of the small subunit; has similarity to E. coli S7 ribosomal protein
GO.Slim: structural constituent of ribosome;structural molecule activity

Gene.functionSummary: Protein whose biological role and cellular location are unknown|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.description: Putative protein of unknown function; YJR115W has a paralog, ECM13, that arose from the whole genome duplication

Gene.name: Topoisomerase I Damage Affected
Gene.functionSummary: Predicted integral membrane protein whose biological role is unknown|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.description: Putative protein of unknown function; null mutant is sensitive to expression of the top1-T722A allele

Gene.name: STErile
Gene.functionSummary: Metalloendopeptidase involved in the CAAX-box dependent processing and maturation of a-factor mating pheromone; localizes to both the inner nuclear membrane, and integral to the endoplasmic reticulum membrane|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutant exhibits reduced mating and pheromone, sensitivity to Ni2+, and proliferation of the nuclear inner membrane; in large-scale studies, null mutant shows increased competitive fitness, decreased mating response and anaerobic growth, and abnormal secretion of Kar2p; overexpression in the Sigma1278b genetic background confers enhanced pseudohyphal growth; null mutant displays altered resistance to a variety of chemicals
Gene.description: Highly conserved zinc metalloprotease; functions in two steps of a-factor maturation, C-terminal CAAX proteolysis and the first step of N-terminal proteolytic processing; cleaves both isoprenylated and non-prenylated oligopeptides; contains multiple transmembrane spans; human homolog ZMPSTE24 implicated in mandibuloacral dysplasia (MAD), and can complement yeast null mutant

Gene.name: Increased Loss of Mitochondrial DNA
Gene.description: Protein of unknown function; may be involved in mitochondrial DNA maintenance; required for slowed DNA synthesis-induced filamentous growth

Gene.name: JmjC domain-containing Histone Demethylase
Gene.description: JmjC domain family histone demethylase; promotes global demethylation of H3K4 and repression of noncoding intergenic transcription during sporulation; removes methyl groups added by Set1p methyltransferase; negatively regulated by H3K14 acetylation; protein levels regulated by Not4p polyubiquitin-mediated degradation; regulates sporulation timing by extending period of active transcription in opposition to programmed global transcriptional quiescence; regulates rDNA silencing

Protein of unknown function; essential for growth under anaerobic conditions; mutation causes decreased expression of ATP2, impaired respiration, defective sterol uptake, and altered levels/localization of ABC transporters Aus1p and Pdr11p

Gene.name: ATP synthase
Gene.functionSummary: Subunit of the catalytic core of the F1 sector of mitochondrial F1F0 ATP synthase; ATP synthase complex is localized to the mitochondrial inner membrane|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene, but heterozygous diploid shows haploinsufficiency; null mutant is temperature sensitive, petite-negative, has a decreased rate of survival in stationary phase, a glycogen accumulation defect, decreased starvation resistance, a respiratory growth defect and decreased resistance to desiccation and oxidative stress; null mutant has a competitive fitness defect in various media and abnormal mitochondrial and vacuolar morphologies
Gene.briefDescription: Beta subunit of the F1 sector of mitochondrial F1F0 ATP synthase
Gene.description: Beta subunit of the F1 sector of mitochondrial F1F0 ATP synthase; which is a large, evolutionarily conserved enzyme complex required for ATP synthesis; F1 translationally regulates ATP6 and ATP8 expression to achieve a balanced output of ATP synthase genes encoded in nucleus and mitochondria; phosphorylated

Gene.functionSummary: Predicted integral membrane protein whose biological role is unknown; localizes to the vacuolar membrane in a large-scale study|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.description: Putative protein of unknown function; expression induced under calcium shortage

Gene.name: Vacuolar Protein Sorting
Gene.functionSummary: Endoplasmic reticulum protein involved in vacuolar protein sorting|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.briefDescription: Protein of unknown function involved in vacuolar protein sorting
Gene.description: Protein of unknown function involved in vacuolar protein sorting; SWAT-GFP and mCherry fusion proteins localize to the endoplasmic reticulum

Gene.name: ReSpiration Factor
Gene.description: Zinc-finger protein; involved in transcriptional control of both nuclear and mitochondrial genes, many of which specify products required for glycerol-based growth, respiration, and other functions; RSF2 has a paralog, TDA9, that arose from the whole genome duplication; relocalizes from nucleus to cytoplasm upon DNA replication stress
GO.Slim: DNA binding;nucleic acid binding transcription factor activity

Gene.description: Dubious open reading frame; unlikely to encode a functional protein, based on available experimental and comparative sequence data; partially overlaps the verified ORF RSF2

Gene.name: Elongation Factor Methyltransferase
Gene.functionSummary: S-adenosylmethionine-dependent lysine methyltransferase; catalyzes the trimethylation of translation elongation factor EF2 (Eft1p/Eft2p); localizes to the cytoplasm|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.description: S-adenosylmethionine-dependent methyltransferase; seven-beta-strand lysine methyltransferase which trimethylates translation elongation factor EF2 (Eft1p and Eft2p) at lysine 509; green fluorescent protein (GFP)-fusion protein localizes to the cytoplasm; ortholog of human gene FAM86A

Gene.name: Sulfur TRansfer
Gene.briefDescription: Cystathionine gamma-synthase, converts cysteine into cystathionine
Gene.description: Cystathionine gamma-synthase, converts cysteine into cystathionine; STR2 has a paralog, YML082W, that arose from the whole genome duplication

Alpha-1,2-mannosidase; involved in ER-associated protein degradation (ERAD); catalyzes the removal of one mannose residue from a glycosylated protein, converting the modification from Man9GlcNAc to Man8GlcNAc; catalyzes the last step in glycoprotein maturation in the ER and is critical for ER protein degradation
GO.Slim: hydrolase activity;hydrolase activity, acting on glycosyl bonds

Gene.name: Xanthine Phosphoribosyl Transferase
Gene.description: Xanthine-guanine phosphoribosyl transferase; required for xanthine utilization and for optimal utilization of guanine
GO.Slim: transferase activity;transferase activity, transferring glycosyl groups

Gene.name: Slow growth on Galactose and Mannose
Gene.functionSummary: Protein whose biological role is unknown; localizes to the Golgi apparatus and colocalizes with COPI-coated vesicles in a large-scale study|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.description: Protein of unknown function; required for wild-type growth rate on galactose and mannose; localizes to COPI coated vesicles and the Golgi apparatus

Gene.name: MiniChromosome Maintenance
Gene.briefDescription: Outer kinetochore protein and component of the Ctf3 subcomplex
Gene.description: Outer kinetochore protein and component of the Ctf3 subcomplex; binds to centromeric DNA in a Ctf19p-dependent manner; involved in chromosome segregation and minichromosome maintenance; orthologous to human centromere constitutive-associated network (CCAN) subunit CENP-K and fission yeast sim4

Gene.name: METhionine requiring
Gene.description: Sulfite reductase beta subunit; involved in amino acid biosynthesis, transcription repressed by methionine

Gene.name: HIstone Regulation
Gene.functionSummary: Transcription corepressor that is a subunit of the HIR complex; negatively regulates transcription of HTA1 during G1/S transition of the mitotic cell cycle; localized to the nucleus|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.description: Subunit of the HIR complex; a nucleosome assembly complex involved in regulation of histone gene transcription; involved in position-dependent gene silencing and nucleosome reassembly; ortholog of human CABIN1 protein
GO.Slim: DNA binding;chromatin binding;transcription factor activity, protein binding

Gene.briefDescription: 8-oxo-dGTP diphosphatase of the Nudix hydrolase family
Gene.description: 8-oxo-dGTP diphosphatase of the Nudix hydrolase family; converts diphosphates of damaged forms of thiamin to monophosphates; GST fusion protein is a Dbf2p-Mob1p phosphorylation target in a proteome chip analysis; synthetic lethal with PH085 deletion; plays a role in restricting Ty1 transposition

Gene.name: Mitochondrial Genome Maintenance
Gene.functionSummary: A single-strand DNA binding protein involved in recombinatorial mitochondrial DNA repair process to maintain mitochondrial genome; localized to the mitochondrial nucleoid|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.briefDescription: Protein with a role in mitochondrial DNA recombinational repair
Gene.description: Protein with a role in mitochondrial DNA recombinational repair; also involved in interstrand cross-link repair; binds to and catalyzes the annealing of single-stranded mtDNA; oligomerizes to form rings and filaments; related to Rad52-type recombination proteins, with limited overall similarity but sharing conserved functionally important residues; component of the mitochondrial nucleoid, required for the repair of oxidative mtDNA damage and mitochondrial genome maintenance

Gene.name: Ribosomal Protein of the Small subunit
Gene.functionSummary: Subunit of the cytosolic small ribosomal subunit; involved in translation|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.briefDescription: Protein component of the small (40S) ribosomal subunit
Gene.description: Protein component of the small (40S) ribosomal subunit; mutation affects 20S pre-rRNA processing; homologous to mammalian ribosomal protein S4, no bacterial homolog; RPS4A has a paralog, RPS4B, that arose from the whole genome duplication
GO.Slim: structural constituent of ribosome;structural molecule activity

Gene.functionSummary: Protein whose biological role and cellular location are unknown|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.description: Protein of unknown function; expressed at both mRNA and protein levels; partially overlaps HMS2

Gene.name: High-copy Mep Suppressor
Gene.briefDescription: Protein with similarity to heat shock transcription factors
Gene.description: Protein with similarity to heat shock transcription factors; overexpression suppresses the pseudohyphal filamentation defect of a diploid mep1 mep2 homozygous null mutant; HMS2 has a paralog, SKN7, that arose from the whole genome duplication

Gene.name: Branched-chain Amino acid Transaminase
Gene.functionSummary: Branched-chain amino acid aminotransferase involved in both the biosynthesis and degradation of branched chain amino acids, such as leucine, isoleucine and valine; localizes to the cytoplasm|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.description: Cytosolic branched-chain amino acid (BCAA) aminotransferase; preferentially involved in BCAA catabolism; homolog of murine ECA39; highly expressed during stationary phase and repressed during logarithmic phase; BAT2 has a paralog, BAT1, that arose from the whole genome duplication

Gene.functionSummary: Protein whose biological role is unknown; localizes to the cytoplasm in a large-scale study|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.description: Putative protein of unknown function; green fluorescent protein (GFP)-fusion protein localizes to the cytoplasm

Gene.name: Delayed ANaerobic
Gene.description: Cell wall mannoprotein; has similarity to Tir1p, Tir2p, Tir3p, and Tir4p; expressed under anaerobic conditions, completely repressed during aerobic growth

Gene.name: Degradation of Allantoin
Gene.functionSummary: An allantoate transmembrane and dipeptide transporter; localizes to plasma membrane|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.description: Allantoate permease; ureidosuccinate permease; also transports dipeptides, though with lower affinity than for allantoate and ureidosuccinate; expression is constitutive but sensitive to nitrogen catabolite repression

Gene.name: PolyGalactUronase
Gene.description: Endo-polygalacturonase; pectolytic enzyme that hydrolyzes the alpha-1,4-glycosidic bonds in the rhamnogalacturonan chains in pectins
GO.Slim: hydrolase activity;hydrolase activity, acting on glycosyl bonds

Gene.functionSummary: Protein whose biological role is unknown; localizes to the cytoplasm in a large-scale study|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.description: Putative protein of unknown function; green fluorescent protein (GFP)-fusion protein localizes to the cytoplasm

Gene.name: METhionine requiring
Gene.phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutant displays methionine auxotrophy, decreased endocytosis and reduced competitive fitness
Gene.description: Adenylylsulfate kinase; required for sulfate assimilation and involved in methionine metabolism; human homolog PAPSS2 complements yeast null mutant

Gene.name: Doa4-Independent Degradation
Gene.phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutant exhibits heat sensitivity, sensitivity to caffeine, Congo Red, and other chemicals, and defects in vacuolar protein targeting; in large-scale studies, null mutant has reduced competitive fitness in several different media, sensitivity to heat shock, desiccation, and osmotic stress, poor utilization of various nitrogen sources, and altered resistance to many chemicals
Gene.briefDescription: Class E Vps protein of the ESCRT-III complex
Gene.description: Class E Vps protein of the ESCRT-III complex; required for sorting of integral membrane proteins into lumenal vesicles of multivesicular bodies, and for delivery of newly synthesized vacuolar enzymes to the vacuole, involved in endocytosis

Gene.name: Mitochondrial Ribosomal Protein
Gene.functionSummary: Component of the small subunit of the mitochondrial ribosome, which mediates translation in the mitochondrion|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.briefDescription: Mitochondrial ribosomal protein of the small subunit
Gene.description: Mitochondrial ribosomal protein of the small subunit; MRP17 exhibits genetic interactions with PET122, encoding a COX3-specific translational activator
GO.Slim: structural constituent of ribosome;structural molecule activity

Gene.name: BYpass of ESS1
Gene.description: Negative regulator of transcription elongation; contains a TFIIS-like domain that associates with chromatin and a PHD domain that interacts with H3K4me3; multicopy suppressor of temperature-sensitive ess1 mutations, binds RNA polymerase II large subunit

Gene.name: Ribosomal Protein of the Large subunit
Gene.functionSummary: RNA-binding subunit of the cytosolic large ribosomal subunit; involved in translation|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.description: Ribosomal 60S subunit protein L14A; N-terminally acetylated; homologous to mammalian ribosomal protein L14, no bacterial homolog; RPL14A has a paralog, RPL14B, that arose from the whole genome duplication
GO.Slim: RNA binding;structural constituent of ribosome;structural molecule activity

Gene.name: CAPping
Gene.briefDescription: Alpha subunit of the capping protein heterodimer (Cap1p and Cap2p)
Gene.description: Alpha subunit of the capping protein heterodimer (Cap1p and Cap2p); capping protein (CP) binds to the barbed ends of actin filaments preventing further polymerization; localized predominantly to cortical actin patches; protein increases in abundance and relocalizes from bud neck to plasma membrane upon DNA replication stress

Gene.name: Longevity-Assurance gene Cognate (LAG1 Cognate)
Gene.phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutant accumulates free sphingoid long-chain bases and shows sensitivity to myriocin
Gene.description: Ceramide synthase component; involved in synthesis of ceramide from C26(acyl)-coenzyme A and dihydrosphingosine or phytosphingosine, functionally equivalent to Lag1p; LAC1 has a paralog, LAG1, that arose from the whole genome duplication

Gene.name: mRNA Turnover 4
Gene.briefDescription: Protein involved in mRNA turnover and ribosome assembly
Gene.description: Protein involved in mRNA turnover and ribosome assembly; required at post-transcriptional step for efficient retrotransposition; localizes to the nucleolus

Gene.name: Ubiquitin Fusion Degradation protein
Gene.description: Ubiquitin-protein ligase (E3); interacts with Rpt4p and Rpt6p, two subunits of the 19S particle of the 26S proteasome; cytoplasmic E3 involved in the degradation of ubiquitin fusion proteins; relative distribution to the nucleus increases upon DNA replication stress

Gene.name: Cruciform Cutting Endonuclease
Gene.description: Mitochondrial cruciform cutting endonuclease; cleaves Holliday junctions formed during recombination of mitochondrial DNA; CCE1 has a paralog, MRS1, that arose from the whole genome duplication

Gene.name: Proline UTilization
Gene.description: Transcriptional activator; binds specific gene recruitment sequences and is required for DNA zip code-mediated targeting of genes to nuclear periphery; regulates proline utilization genes, constitutively binds PUT1 and PUT2 promoters as a dimer, undergoes conformational change to form active state; binds other promoters only under activating conditions; differentially phosphorylated in presence of different nitrogen sources; has a Zn(2)-Cys(6) binuclear cluster domain
GO.Slim: DNA binding;nucleic acid binding transcription factor activity

Gene.name: ATP synthase
Gene.functionSummary: Subunit of the stator stalk of the F0 coupling factor of mitochondrial F1F0 ATP synthase; ATP synthase complex is localized to the mitochondrial inner membrane|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.briefDescription: Subunit d of the stator stalk of mitochondrial F1F0 ATP synthase
Gene.description: Subunit d of the stator stalk of mitochondrial F1F0 ATP synthase; F1F0 ATP synthase is a large, evolutionarily conserved enzyme complex required for ATP synthesis

Gene.name: dna HeliCaSe
Gene.briefDescription: Hexameric DNA polymerase alpha-associated DNA helicase A
Gene.description: Hexameric DNA polymerase alpha-associated DNA helicase A; involved in lagging strand DNA synthesis; contains single-stranded DNA stimulated ATPase and dATPase activities; replication protein A stimulates helicase and ATPase activities

Gene.name: SuPpressor of Ty
Gene.briefDescription: ER membrane protein involved in regulation of OLE1 transcription
Gene.description: ER membrane protein involved in regulation of OLE1 transcription; inactive ER form dimerizes and one subunit is then activated by ubiquitin/proteasome-dependent processing followed by nuclear targeting; SPT23 has a paralog, MGA2, that arose from the whole genome duplication

Gene.functionSummary: Protein whose biological role is unknown; localizes to the cytoplasm in a large-scale study|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.description: Putative protein of unknown function; predicted by computational methods to be involved in mRNA degradation; green fluorescent protein (GFP)-fusion protein localizes to the cytoplasm

Gene.name: Poly(A) Nuclease
Gene.briefDescription: Essential subunit of the Pan2p-Pan3p poly(A)-ribonuclease complex
Gene.description: Essential subunit of the Pan2p-Pan3p poly(A)-ribonuclease complex; poly (A) mRNA binding subunit which recruits mRNA to the complex; the Pan2p-Pan3p complex controls poly(A) tail length and regulates the stoichiometry and activity of postreplication repair complexes

Gene.name: Glutathione PeroXidase
Gene.description: Phospholipid hydroperoxide glutathione peroxidase; induced by glucose starvation that protects cells from phospholipid hydroperoxides and nonphospholipid peroxides during oxidative stress; GPX1 has a paralog, HYR1, that arose from the whole genome duplication

Gene.name: tRNA ThreonylCarbamoyladenosine Dehydratase
Gene.functionSummary: tRNA threonylcarbamoyladenosine dehydratase required for the formation of the modified nucleoside cyclic N(6)-threonylcarbamoyladenosine in tRNAs; localized to the mitochondrial outer membrane|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.description: tRNA threonylcarbamoyladenosine dehydratase; required for the ct6A tRNA base modification, where an adenosine at position 37 is modified to form a cyclized active ester with an oxazolone ring; localized to the mitochondrial outer membrane; TCD2 has a paralog, TCD1, that arose from the whole genome duplication

Gene.name: MAlic Enzyme
Gene.description: Mitochondrial malic enzyme; catalyzes the oxidative decarboxylation of malate to pyruvate, which is a key intermediate in sugar metabolism and a precursor for synthesis of several amino acids

Dubious open reading frame; unlikely to encode a functional protein, based on available experimental and comparative sequence data; not conserved in closely related Saccharomyces species; partially overlaps the verified gene MAE1
Dubious open reading frame; unlikely to encode a functional protein, based on available experimental and comparative sequence data; not conserved in closely related Saccharomyces species

Gene.name: Intrastrand cross (X)-link Recognition
Gene.briefDescription: Transcriptional repressor that regulates hypoxic genes during normoxia
Gene.description: Transcriptional repressor that regulates hypoxic genes during normoxia; involved in the aerobic repression of genes such as COX5b, TIR1, and HEM13; binds DNA intrastrand cross-links formed by cisplatin; HMG (high mobility group box) domain containing protein which binds and bends cisplatin-modified DNA, blocking excision repair; IXR1 has a paralog, ABF2, that arose from the whole genome duplication

Gene.functionSummary: Protein whose biological role and cellular location are unknown|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.description: Putative protein of unknown function; similar to uncharacterized proteins from other fungi

Gene.name: Transmembrane Ubiquitin Ligase
Gene.briefDescription: Subunit of the DSC ubiquitin ligase complex
Gene.description: Subunit of the DSC ubiquitin ligase complex; golgi-localized RING-finger ubiquitin ligase (E3) involved in sorting polar transmembrane domain containing membrane proteins to multivesicular bodies for delivery to the vacuole; proposed involvement in the quality control of misfolded TMD containing proteins; ortholog of fission yeast dsc1

Gene.name: Altered Inheritance rate of Mitochondria
Gene.functionSummary: Protein with a role in mitophagy; localized to mitochondria|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene in S288C, but essential in the SK1 background; S288C null mutant has a small cell size in a saturated culture, a decreased growth rate on fermentable and nonfermentable carbon sources, decreased competitive fitness on various media, and a reduction in the ability to utilize galactose as carbon source and arginine or glutamate as nitrogen sources; null mutant displays an increased frequency of spontaneous mitochondrial genome loss and has defects in both mitophagy and autophagy; null has decreased innate thermotolerance, decreased chronological lifespan, decreased resistance to desiccation, and decreased resistance to both gliotoxin and killer toxin
Gene.description: Protein of unknown function; null mutant is viable and displays elevated frequency of mitochondrial genome loss; null mutation confers sensitivity to tunicamycin and DTT

Gene.name: Restores Glucose Transport
Gene.description: Glucose-responsive transcription factor; regulates expression of several glucose transporter (HXT) genes in response to glucose; binds to promoters and acts both as a transcriptional activator and repressor; recruits Tup1p/Cyc8p to target gene promoters; RGT1 has a paralog, EDS1, that arose from the whole genome duplication
GO.Slim: DNA binding;nucleic acid binding transcription factor activity;transcription factor activity, protein binding

Gene.functionSummary: Predicted integral membrane protein whose biological role is unknown|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.description: Protein of unknown function; copurifies with late Golgi vesicles containing the v-SNARE Tlg2p; PTM1 has a paralog, YHL017W, that arose from the whole genome duplication

Gene.name: NifU-like protein
Gene.briefDescription: Protein involved in iron metabolism in mitochondria
Gene.description: Protein involved in iron metabolism in mitochondria; similar to NifU, which is a protein required for the maturation of the Fe/S clusters of nitrogenase in nitrogen-fixing bacteria

Gene.name: Vacuolar Protein Sorting
Gene.briefDescription: One of four subunits of the ESCRT-III complex
Gene.description: One of four subunits of the ESCRT-III complex; forms an endosomal sorting complex required for transport III (ESCRT-III) subcomplex with Did4p; involved in the sorting of transmembrane proteins into the multivesicular body (MVB) pathway

Gene.name: PseudoHyphal Determinant
Gene.briefDescription: Transcriptional activator that enhances pseudohyphal growth
Gene.description: Transcriptional activator that enhances pseudohyphal growth; physically interacts with the Tup1-Cyc8 complex and recruits Tup1p to its targets; regulates expression of FLO11, an adhesin required for pseudohyphal filament formation; similar to StuA, an A. nidulans developmental regulator; potential Cdc28p substrate; PHD1 has a paralog, SOK2, that arose from the whole genome duplication
GO.Slim: DNA binding;nucleic acid binding transcription factor activity

Gene.name: Mini Mitochondria ORF
Gene.functionSummary: Protein whose biological role is unknown; localizes to the mitochondria|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.description: Protein of unknown function; SWAT-GFP, seamless-GFP and mCherry fusion proteins localize to the mitochondria; mRNA identified as translated by ribosome profiling data; MMO1 is a non-essential gene

Gene.name: Defective Cell Wall
Gene.description: Putative mannosidase; GPI-anchored membrane protein required for cell wall biosynthesis in bud formation;homologous to Dfg5p

Gene.name: Avl Nine Related family 2
Gene.functionSummary: Protein whose biological role is unknown; localizes to lipid particles|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutant has decreased competitive fitness on minimal medium and medium containing a non-fermentable carbon source; overexpression results in increased invasive growth; null mutant displays decreased growth under zinc-limiting conditions; heterozygous diploid null is haploinsufficient
Gene.description: Protein of unknown function; may have a role in lipid metabolism, based on localization to lipid droplets; predicted to be palmitoylated

Gene.name: ELongated Morphology
Gene.functionSummary: Serine/threonine kinase; involved in cytokinesis, septin ring assembly, cell morphogenesis and bud growth; localizes to the bud neck|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.description: Serine/threonine protein kinase; regulates the orientation checkpoint, the morphogenesis checkpoint and the metabolic switch from fermentative to oxidative metabolism by phosphorylating the activation loop of Kin4p, Hsl1p and Snf4p respectively; cooperates with Hsl7p in recruiting Hsl1p to the septin ring, a prerequisite for subsequent recruitment, phosphorylation, and degradation of Swe1p; forms part of the bud neck ring; regulates cytokinesis

Gene.functionSummary: Protein whose biological role and cellular location are unknown|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.description: Protein of unknown function; the YKL050W protein is a target of the SCFCdc4 ubiquitin ligase complex and YKL050W transcription is regulated by Azf1p; YKL050C has a paralog, EIS1, that arose from the whole genome duplication

Gene.name: Suppressor of Four Kinase
Gene.briefDescription: Plasma membrane protein that may act to generate normal levels of PI4P
Gene.description: Plasma membrane protein that may act to generate normal levels of PI4P; may act together with or upstream of Stt4p; at least partially mediates proper localization of Stt4p to the plasma membrane

Gene.name: Mitochondrial Distribution and Morphology
Gene.functionSummary: Protein involved in mitochondrion organization and assembly of mitochondrial respiratory chain complex; localized to mitochondrial intermembrane space|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.description: Mitochondrial intermembrane space protein; mutation affects mitochondrial distribution and morphology; contains twin cysteine-x9-cysteine motifs; protein abundance increases in response to DNA replication stress
Dubious open reading frame; unlikely to encode a functional protein, based on available experimental and comparative sequence data; partially overlaps verified ORF ASK1

Gene.name: RNAPII DEgradation Factor
Gene.phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutation confers abnormal cytokinesis and meiosis; null mutant is sensitive to 4-aminofolic acid, HU, MMS, and X-rays; in large-scale studies, null mutant has reduced competitive fitness in several different media, slow fermentative growth and defective respiratory growth, enlarged cell size, and altered resistance to a variety of chemicals
Gene.description: RNAPII degradation factor; forms a complex with Rad26p in chromatin, enables ubiquitination and proteolysis of RNAPII present in an elongation complex; mutant is deficient in Zip1p loading onto chromosomes during meiosis

Gene.name: 3-Oxoacyl-[Acyl-carrier-protein] Reductase
Gene.phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutant shows repiratory growth defect and sensitivity to acetaldehyde, acetic acid, ethanol, spermine; homozygous null mutation in diploids causes delayed progression through G1 phase of the cell cycle, decreased innate thermotolerance, and decreased glycogen accumulation
Gene.description: Mitochondrial 3-oxoacyl-[acyl-carrier-protein] reductase; may comprise a type II mitochondrial fatty acid synthase along with Mct1p; human homolog CBR4 complements yeast null mutant

Gene.name: Translation Machinery Associated
Gene.description: Protein that associates with ribosomes; homolog of translationally controlled tumor protein; green fluorescent protein (GFP)-fusion protein localizes to the cytoplasm and relocates to the mitochondrial outer surface upon oxidative stress

Gene.name: NUclear Pore
Gene.briefDescription: Subunit of the Nup84p subcomplex of the nuclear pore complex (NPC)
Gene.description: Subunit of the Nup84p subcomplex of the nuclear pore complex (NPC); contributes to nucleocytoplasmic transport and NPC biogenesis and is involved in establishment of a normal nucleocytoplasmic concentration gradient of the GTPase Gsp1p; also plays roles in several processes that may require localization of genes or chromosomes at the nuclear periphery, including double-strand break repair, transcription and chromatin silencing; homologous to human NUP160

Gene.name: BLoc-1 Interactor
Gene.briefDescription: Subunit of the BLOC-1 complex involved in endosomal maturation
Gene.description: Subunit of the BLOC-1 complex involved in endosomal maturation; interacts with Msb3p; green fluorescent protein (GFP)-fusion protein localizes to the endosome

Gene.name: Multicopy suppressor of SNF1 mutation
Gene.functionSummary: Sequence-specific DNA-binding transcription factor involved in the regulation of transcription in response to a wide variety of stresses; shuttles between nucleus and cytoplasm|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutants are sensitive to citric acid, oxidative stress, heat, dessication, cannot utilize proline as a nitrogen source; overexpression slows growth, increases sensitivity to TOR inhibitor rapamycin
Gene.description: Stress-responsive transcriptional activator; activated in stochastic pulses of nuclear localization in response to various stress conditions; binds DNA at stress response elements of responsive genes, inducing gene expression; involved in diauxic shift
GO.Slim: DNA binding;nucleic acid binding transcription factor activity

Gene.functionSummary: Protein whose biological role is unknown; localizes to the Golgi apparatus in a large-scale study|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.description: Putative protein of unknown function; green fluorescent protein (GFP)-fusion protein localizes to the Golgi

Gene.name: MaNganese Resistance
Gene.briefDescription: Vacuolar membrane protein required for magnesium homeostasis
Gene.description: Vacuolar membrane protein required for magnesium homeostasis; putative magnesium transporter; has similarity to Alr1p and Alr2p, which mediate influx of Mg2+ and other divalent cations; localizes to sites of contact between the vacuole and mitochondria (vCLAMPs)

Gene.name: Yeast Endoplasmic reticulum Transmembrane protein
Gene.functionSummary: Protein whose biological role is unknown; localizes to the endoplasmic reticulum and colocalizes with the ribosome, in large-scale studies|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.description: Endoplasmic reticulum transmembrane protein; may interact with ribosomes, based on co-purification experiments; homolog of human BAP31 protein; YET1 has a paralog, YET2, that arose from the whole genome duplication

Dubious open reading frame; unlikely to encode a functional protein, based on available experimental and comparative sequence data; not conserved in closely related Saccharomyces species; partially overlaps the verified gene YNK1

Gene.name: Yeast Nucleoside diphosphate Kinase
Gene.description: Nucleoside diphosphate kinase; catalyzes the transfer of gamma phosphates from nucleoside triphosphates, usually ATP, to nucleoside diphosphates by a mechanism that involves formation of an autophosphorylated enzyme intermediate; protein abundance increases in response to DNA replication stress

Gene.name: NUclear Pore
Gene.briefDescription: FG-nucleoporin component of central core of the nuclear pore complex
Gene.description: FG-nucleoporin component of central core of the nuclear pore complex; contributes directly to nucleocytoplasmic transport and maintenance of the nuclear pore complex (NPC) permeability barrier and is involved in gene tethering at the nuclear periphery; NUP100 has a paralog, NUP116, that arose from the whole genome duplication

Methionine-R-sulfoxide reductase; reduces the R enantiomer of free Met-SO, in contrast to Ycl033Cp which reduces Met-R-SO in a peptide linkage; has a role in protection against oxidative stress; relative distribution to the nucleus increases upon DNA replication stress

Gene.functionSummary: Protein whose biological role is unknown; localizes to the mitochondrion in large-scale studies|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.description: Putative protein of unknown function; expression induced in cells treated with mycotoxins patulin or citrinin; the authentic, non-tagged protein is detected in highly purified mitochondria in high-throughput studies

Gene.functionSummary: Predicted integral membrane protein whose biological role is unknown; localizes to the cytoplasm in a large-scale study|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.description: Putative protein of unknown function; expression induced in cells treated with the mycotoxin patulin, and also the quinone methide triterpene celastrol; green fluorescent protein (GFP)-fusion protein localizes to the cytoplasm

Gene.name: Sin Three Binding protein
Gene.functionSummary: Protein whose biological role and cellular location are unknown|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.briefDescription: Protein that binds Sin3p in a two-hybrid assay
Gene.description: Protein that binds Sin3p in a two-hybrid assay; STB6 has a paralog, STB2, that arose from the whole genome duplication

Gene.name: Lumenal Hsp Seventy
Gene.briefDescription: Molecular chaperone of the endoplasmic reticulum lumen
Gene.description: Molecular chaperone of the endoplasmic reticulum lumen; involved in polypeptide translocation and folding; nucleotide exchange factor for the ER lumenal Hsp70 chaperone Kar2p; regulated by the unfolded protein response pathway

Gene.name: Mutant U1 Die
Gene.briefDescription: Protein involved in early pre-mRNA splicing
Gene.description: Protein involved in early pre-mRNA splicing; component of the pre-mRNA-U1 snRNP complex, the commitment complex; interacts with Msl5p/BBP splicing factor and Sub2p; similar to metazoan splicing factor U2AF65
Putative protein of unknown function; green fluorescent protein (GFP)-fusion protein localizes to the cytoplasm; proposed to be involved in resistance to streptozotocin and camptothecin

Gene.name: Platinum SensitivitY
Gene.description: Dubious open reading frame; unlikely to encode a functional protein, based on available experimental and comparative sequence data; not conserved in closely related Saccharomyces species; 69% of ORF overlaps the uncharacterized ORF YKL075C

Gene.functionSummary: Protein whose biological role is unknown; localizes to the vacuole in a large-scale study|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.description: Putative protein of unknown function; green fluorescent protein (GFP)-fusion protein localizes to the vacuole

Gene.name: Suppressor of MYo2-66
Gene.description: Kinesin-like myosin passenger-protein; interacts with Myo2p; controls actin cable structure and dynamics; proposed to be involved in exocytosis

Gene.name: Vacuolar Membrane Atpase
Gene.briefDescription: Subunit C of the V1 peripheral membrane domain of V-ATPase
Gene.description: Subunit C of the V1 peripheral membrane domain of V-ATPase; part of the electrogenic proton pump found throughout the endomembrane system; required for the V1 domain to assemble onto the vacuolar membrane; the V1 peripheral membrane domain of vacuolar H+-ATPase (V-ATPase) has eight subunits

Gene.name: Translation Elongation Factor
Gene.briefDescription: Gamma subunit of translational elongation factor eEF1B
Gene.description: Gamma subunit of translational elongation factor eEF1B; stimulates the binding of aminoacyl-tRNA (AA-tRNA) to ribosomes by releasing eEF1A (Tef1p/Tef2p) from the ribosomal complex
GO.Slim: RNA binding;guanyl-nucleotide exchange factor activity;translation factor activity, RNA binding

Gene.name: Helper Of Tim
Gene.description: Zinc-binding mitochondrial intermembrane space (IMS) protein; involved in a disulfide relay system for IMS import of cysteine-containing proteins; binds Mia40p and stimulates its Erv1p-dependent oxidation, probably by sequestering zinc

Gene.name: Malate DeHydrogenase
Gene.phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutant has a severe respiratory growth defect; null mutant displays decreased replicative and chronological lifespans while the overexpressor has elevated lifespans; null mutant displays decreased survival rate in stationary phase and decreased desiccation resistance; null mutant has reduced mitochondrial zinc accumulation and increased acetic acid excretion; homozygous diploid null has decreased sporulation efficiency; overexpression results in increased silencing at the rDNA locus
Gene.description: Mitochondrial malate dehydrogenase; catalyzes interconversion of malate and oxaloacetate; involved in the tricarboxylic acid (TCA) cycle; phosphorylated

Gene.name: SulfiRedoXin
Gene.description: Sulfiredoxin; contributes to oxidative stress resistance by reducing cysteine-sulfinic acid groups in the peroxiredoxin Tsa1p, which is formed upon exposure to oxidants; conserved in higher eukaryotes; protein abundance increases in response to DNA replication stress

Gene.name: CYTochrome-c1-heme-lyase
Gene.phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutant has a decreased growth rate, a respiratory growth defect, and a decreased rate of proline utilization; null mutant displays increased biofilm formation, increased starvation-induced mitophagy and increased dietary restriction-induced replicative lifespan extension; homozygous diploid null mutant displays decreased sporulation efficiency, decreased accumulation of storage carbohydrate glycogen, decreased chronological lifespan and decreased desiccation resistance
Gene.description: Cytochrome c1 heme lyase; involved in maturation of cytochrome c1, which is a subunit of the mitochondrial ubiquinol-cytochrome-c reductase; links heme covalently to apocytochrome c1; human homolog HCCS can complement yeast cyt2 null mutant

Gene.name: Coupling of Ubiquitin conjugation to ER degradation
Gene.functionSummary: Ubiquitin binding protein whose localization is unknown|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.description: Protein of unknown function; has two CUE domains that bind ubiquitin, which may facilitate intramolecular monoubiquitination

Putative phosphatidylinositol/phosphatidylcholine transfer protein; possibly involved in lipid metabolism; localizes to the nucleus; contains a CRAL/TRIO domain and binds several lipids in a large-scale study; YKL091C has a paralog, SEC14, that arose from the whole genome duplication

Gene.name: BUD site selection
Gene.description: GTPase activating factor for Rsr1p/Bud1p; plays a role in spindle position checkpoint distinct from its role in bud site selection; required for both axial and bipolar budding patterns; mutants exhibit random budding in all cell types

Gene.name: Mitochondrial Biogenesis Regulation
Gene.briefDescription: Protein involved in mitochondrial functions and stress response
Gene.description: Protein involved in mitochondrial functions and stress response; overexpression suppresses growth defects of hap2, hap3, and hap4 mutants; MBR1 has a paralog, ISF1, that arose from the whole genome duplication
Monoglyceride lipase (MGL); functional ortholog of mammalian MGL, localizes to lipid particles and membranes, also member of the eukaryotic serine hydrolase family

Gene.name: Cell Wall Protein
Gene.functionSummary: A structural constituent of the cell wall involved in both fungal-type cell wall organization and ascospore-type prospore membrane assembly; localized in the cell wall, cellular birth scar, and prospore membrane|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.briefDescription: Cell wall mannoprotein that localizes to birth scars of daughter cells
Gene.description: Cell wall mannoprotein that localizes to birth scars of daughter cells; linked to a beta-1,3- and beta-1,6-glucan heteropolymer through a phosphodiester bond; required for propionic acid resistance

Gene.name: Cell Wall Protein
Gene.functionSummary: Protein that is a structural constituent of the cell wall that is involved in cell wall organization; localized to the cell wall|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.description: Covalently linked cell wall mannoprotein; major constituent of the cell wall; plays a role in stabilizing the cell wall; involved in low pH resistance; precursor is GPI-anchored
Dubious open reading frame; unlikely to encode a functional protein, based on available experimental and comparative sequence data; not conserved in closely related Saccharomyces species

Gene.name: Maintenance of Telomere Capping
Gene.functionSummary: Protein whose biological role and cellular location are unknown|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.description: Protein of unknown function; mtc2 is synthetically sick with cdc13-1

Gene.name: Yeast Presenilin-like Family 1
Gene.functionSummary: Intramembrane peptidase that regulates abundance of plasma membrane transporters via proteolysis, in response to nutrient starvation; localized to the perinuclear endoplasmic reticulum membrane|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.briefDescription: Intramembrane aspartyl protease of the perinuclear ER membrane
Gene.description: Intramembrane aspartyl protease of the perinuclear ER membrane; acts in a branch of ER-associated degradation (ERAD) that degrades functional proteins rather than misfolded proteins; regulates abundance of high-affinity plasma membrane transporters during the starvation response; has a presenilin fold; member of the GxGD family of intramembrane proteases; closest human homolog is signal peptide peptidase (SPP)

Gene.name: Histone Synthetic Lethal
Gene.functionSummary: Ser/thr protein kinase involved in the G2/M transition of the mitotic cell cycle; substrates include Swe1p and Hsl7p; capable of autophosphorylation; localizes to the bud neck septin ring|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.description: Nim1p-related protein kinase; septin-binding kinase that localizes to the bud neck septin ring and regulates the morphogenesis checkpoint; phosphorylates Hsl7p and cooperates with Elm1p to recruit Hsl7p to the mother-bud neck, as a prerequisite for the subsequent recruitment, phosphorylation, and degradation of Swe1p; autophosphorylation enhances interactions with Hsl7p

Gene.briefDescription: Dubious open reading frame unlikely to encode a functional protein
Gene.description: Dubious open reading frame unlikely to encode a functional protein; deletion confers sensitivity to citric acid; predicted protein would include a thiol-disulfide oxidoreductase active site

Gene.name: AminoPeptidase
Gene.functionSummary: A metalloaminopeptidase involved in vaculolar protein catabolysis; localized to the vacuole|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutant displays increased accumulation of cadmium, but decreased accumulation of zinc and calcium ions; null mutant has both a decreased mutation frequency and decreased protein carbonylation in the presence of cadmium; null mutant displays decreased resistance to zinc sulfate; null mutant has an inability to concentrate Atg11p to the pre-autophagosomal structure (PAS); null mutant displays increased survival following a ramped heat stimulus; haploinsufficiency results in chromosome instability (CIN) in the heterozygous diploid null
Gene.description: Vacuolar aminopeptidase yscI; zinc metalloproteinase that belongs to the peptidase family M18; often used as a marker protein in studies of autophagy and cytosol to vacuole targeting (CVT) pathway; protein increases in abundance and relative distribution to cytoplasmic foci increases upon DNA replication stress

Gene.name: Stability of Eisosomes Guaranteed
Gene.functionSummary: Protein whose biological role is unknown; localizes to the cell periphery|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.description: Eisosome component; likely plays only a minor role in eisosome assembly; shown to interact with Seg1p by affinity purification and mass spec; SWAT-GFP and mCherry fusion proteins localize to the cell periphery; similar to A. gossypii SEG gene which is important for stabilizing eisosomes; SEG2 has a paralog, SEG1, that arose from the whole genome duplication

Gene.name: Aspartate AminoTransferase
Gene.functionSummary: L-aspartate:2-oxoglutarate aminotransferase that binds pyridoxal phosphate; involved in amino acid metabolism and cell aging; localizes to mitochondria|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutant has a reduced respiratory growth rate and decreased competitive fitness on non-fermentable carbon sources; null has reduced groth on minimal medium and a reduced ability to use proline as a nitrogen source; null mutant has a reduction in caloric restriction-mediated lifespan extension, while overexpression enhances both chronological and replicative lifespan; overexpression increases silencing at the rDNA locus; null mutant has enhanced biofilm formation; heterozygous null mutant is haploinsufficient
Gene.description: Mitochondrial aspartate aminotransferase; catalyzes the conversion of oxaloacetate to aspartate in aspartate and asparagine biosynthesis

Gene.functionSummary: Protein whose biological role and cellular location are unknown|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.description: Putative short-chain dehydrogenase/reductase; proposed to be a palmitoylated membrane protein

Gene.name: Heme Activator Protein
Gene.functionSummary: Sequence specific DNA-binding RNA polymerase II transcription factor that activates gene expression in response to carbon catabolites; subunit of the CCAAT-binding transcription factor complex|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutants grow slowly, have decreased ethanol tolerance, increased lifespan under caloric restriction, respiration defects, decreased filamentous growth, cannot utilize some nitrogen sources, small cell size and abnormally elongated buds; null is also sensitive to UV, dessication, and anoxia; homozygous diploid null has sporulation defects; overexpression slows vegetative growth
Gene.description: Transcription factor; subunit of the heme-activated, glucose-repressed Hap2p/3p/4p/5p CCAAT-binding complex, a transcriptional activator and global regulator of respiratory gene expression; provides the principal activation function of the complex; involved in diauxic shift
GO.Slim: nucleic acid binding transcription factor activity;transcription factor activity, protein binding;transcription factor binding

Gene.name: Kluveromyces lactis Toxin Insensitive
Gene.briefDescription: Protein that plays a role in modification of tRNA wobble nucleosides
Gene.description: Protein that plays a role in modification of tRNA wobble nucleosides; protein plays role in tRNA wobble nucleoside modification with Elongator complex; involved in sensitivity to G1 arrest induced by zymocin; interacts with chromatin throughout the genome; also interacts with Cdc19p

Gene.name: RADiation sensitive
Gene.phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutant displays sensitivity to agents affecting DNA metabolism such as 5-fluorouracil, MMS, and UV light; null mutant has elevated mutation frequency, decreased replicative lifespan, and abnormal nuclear morphology; in large-scale studies null mutant displays decreased competitive fitness, chronological lifespan, and filamentous growth, and is sensitive to heat, oxidative stress, metals, and various chemicals
Gene.description: 5' to 3' exonuclease, 5' flap endonuclease; required for Okazaki fragment processing and maturation, for long-patch base-excision repair and large loop repair (LLR), ribonucleotide excision repair; member of the S. pombe RAD2/FEN1 family; relocalizes to the cytosol in response to hypoxia

Gene.name: APurinic/apyrimidinic eNdonuclease
Gene.phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutant is sensitive to DNA-damaging factors, including UV, gamma rays, 5-fluorouracil, MMS; also shows increased mutation frequency and loss of mitochondrial genome
Gene.description: Major apurinic/apyrimidinic endonuclease; 3'-repair diesterase; involved in repair of DNA damage by oxidation and alkylating agents; also functions as a 3'-5' exonuclease to repair 7,8-dihydro-8-oxodeoxyguanosine; genetically interacts with NTG1 to maintain mitochondrial genome integrity
Dubious open reading frame; unlikely to encode a functional protein, based on available experimental and comparative sequence data; partially overlaps the verified gene PRR1

Gene.name: Pheromone Response Regulator
Gene.description: Serine/threonine protein kinase; inhibits pheromone induced signaling downstream of MAPK, possibly at the level of the Ste12p transcription factor

Gene.name: increased Sensitivity to Benzoquinone Ansamycins
Gene.phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutant exhibits shorter telomeres and chromosome loss; in large-scale studies, null mutation causes sensitivity to radicicol, decreased filamentous growth, and increased competitive fitness in minimal medium but decreased fitness in synthetic oak exudate medium; overexpression causes chromosome instability; diploid heterozygous nuill mutant is haploinsufficient and sensitive to starvation
Gene.briefDescription: Co-chaperone that binds and regulates Hsp90 family chaperones
Gene.description: Co-chaperone that binds and regulates Hsp90 family chaperones; plays a role in determining prion variants; important for pp60v-src activity in yeast; homologous to the mammalian p23 proteins, and like p23 can regulate telomerase activity; protein abundance increases in response to DNA replication stress
