Gene.description: Protein kinase involved in negative regulation of PolIII transcription; effector kinase of the TOR signaling pathway and phosphorylates Rpc53p to regulate ribosome and tRNA biosynthesis; member of the LAMMER family of protein kinases, which are serine/threonine kinases also capable of phosphorylating tyrosine residues; capable of autophosphorylation
Dubious open reading frame; unlikely to encode a functional protein, based on available experimental and comparative sequence data; partially overlaps the verified gene KNS1

Gene.name: Spindle Pole Antigen
Gene.description: Component of the polarisome; functions in actin cytoskeletal organization during polarized growth; acts as a scaffold for Mkk1p and Mpk1p cell wall integrity signaling components; potential Cdc28p substrate; coding sequence contains length polymorphisms in different strains; SPA2 has a paralog, SPH1, that arose from the whole genome duplication

Gene.name: Stress-Seventy subfamily A
Gene.functionSummary: Subunit of the chaperonin-containing T-complex (CCT particle, TriC) that is predicted to be an ATPase; involved in protein folding and tRNA import into nucleus under starvation conditions|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutant is defective in protein targeting to vacuoles and in maintenance of [URE3] and [PSI+] prions; homozygous diploids are sensitive to actinomycin D and show increased innate thermotolerance; overexpression in Sigma1278b causes increased invasive growth
Gene.description: HSP70 family ATP-binding protein; involved in protein folding, vacuolar import of proteins; required for ubiquitin-dependent degradation of short-lived proteins; associated with chaperonin-containing T-complex; 98% identical to paralog Ssa1p with distinct functional specificity in propagation of yeast [URE3] prions and vacuolar-mediated degradation of gluconeogenesis enzymes; binds tRNA, has role in tRNA nuclear import during starvation
GO.Slim: ATPase activity;RNA binding;hydrolase activity;unfolded protein binding

Gene.name: Heat Shock Protein
Gene.functionSummary: Adenosine-binding protein chaperone involved protein folding, unfolding and refolding, cellular heat acclimation, and the inheritance of oxidatively modified proteins during replicative cell aging; localized to the nucleus and cytoplasm; subunit of the TRC endoplasmic reticulum (ER) membrane insertion complex|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.description: Disaggregase; heat shock protein that cooperates with Ydj1p (Hsp40) and Ssa1p (Hsp70) to refold and reactivate previously denatured, aggregated proteins; responsive to stresses including: heat, ethanol, and sodium arsenite; involved in [PSI+] propagation; protein becomes more abundant and forms cytoplasmic foci in response to DNA replication stress; potentiated Hsp104p variants decrease TDP-43 proteotoxicity by eliminating its cytoplasmic aggregation

Gene.name: Iron Sulfur Assembly
Gene.functionSummary: Mitochondrial iron-sulfur cluster binding protein involved in iron-sulfur cluster assembly and biosynthesis of biotin|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutation blocks respiratory growth, causes lysine and glutamate auxotrophy, raises iron levels in mitochondria, and increases rate of mitochondrial DNA loss
Gene.briefDescription: Protein required for maturation of mitochondrial [4Fe-4S] proteins
Gene.description: Protein required for maturation of mitochondrial [4Fe-4S] proteins; functions in a complex with Isa2p and possibly Iba57p; isa1 deletion causes loss of mitochondrial DNA and respiratory deficiency; depletion reduces growth on nonfermentable carbon sources; functional ortholog of bacterial A-type ISC proteins; human ISCA1 can complement isa1 null mutant

Gene.name: Transporter of POlyamines
Gene.briefDescription: Polyamine transporter of the major facilitator superfamily
Gene.description: Polyamine transporter of the major facilitator superfamily; member of the 12-spanner drug:H(+) antiporter DHA1 family; recognizes spermine, putrescine, and spermidine; catalyzes uptake of polyamines at alkaline pH and excretion at acidic pH; during oxidative stress exports spermine, spermidine from the cell, which controls timing of expression of stress-responsive genes; phosphorylation enhances activity and sorting to the plasma membrane

Gene.name: Regulator of rDNA Transcription
Gene.description: Protein of unknown function; identified in a screen for mutants with increased levels of rDNA transcription; dubious open reading frame unlikely to encode a protein, based on available experimental and comparative sequence data

Protein of unknown function; may interact with ribosomes, based on co-purification experiments; green fluorescent protein (GFP)-fusion protein localizes to the cytoplasm; YLL032C is not an essential gene

Gene.name: Increased Recombination Centers
Gene.description: Protein of unknown function; YLL033W is not an essential gene but mutant is defective in spore formation; null mutant displays increased levels of spontaneous Rad52p foci

Gene.name: Epsin N-Terminal homology
Gene.functionSummary: Putative clathrin binding protein, that is localized to cortical actin patches; it has a predicted role in actin filament organization and actin patch assembly, and endocytosis|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.description: Protein of unknown function; contains an N-terminal epsin-like domain; proposed to be involved in the trafficking of Arn1p in the absence of ferrichrome

Gene.name: Ubiquitin
Gene.description: Ubiquitin; becomes conjugated to proteins, marking them for selective degradation via the ubiquitin-26S proteasome system; essential for the cellular stress response; encoded as a polyubiquitin precursor comprised of 5 head-to-tail repeats; protein abundance increases in response to DNA replication stress

Gene.name: Vacuolar Protein Sorting
Gene.briefDescription: Protein involved in prospore membrane morphogenesis
Gene.description: Protein involved in prospore membrane morphogenesis; heterooligomeric or homooligomeric complex; peripherally associated with membranes; involved in sporulation, vacuolar protein sorting, prospore membrane formation during sporulatoin, and protein-Golgi retention; homologous to human CHAC and COH1 which are involved in chorea acanthocytosis and Cohen syndrome, respectively

Gene.name: Succinate DeHydrogenase
Gene.functionSummary: Succinate dehydrogenase subunit of the mitochondrial respiratory chain complex; involved in cellular respiration, the tricarboxylic acid cycle, and mitochondrial electron transport; localizes to vacuolar and mitochondrial membranes|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutant fails to grow on nonfermentable carbon sources but respiratory defect is rescued by the addition of FAD; null mutant loses viability in stationary phase faster than wild type does, but is resistant to sugar-induced cell death; disease-analogous mutation from a mitochondrial disorder patient reduced Sdh2p activity; in large-scale studies, the null mutant displays increased competitive fitness in minimal medium but decreased competitive fitness in several other media; null mutant is sensitive to desiccation, displays poor growth in anoxic conditions, and has shorter chronological lifespan
Gene.briefDescription: Iron-sulfur protein subunit of succinate dehydrogenase
Gene.description: Iron-sulfur protein subunit of succinate dehydrogenase; the complex couples the oxidation of succinate to the transfer of electrons to ubiquinone as part of the TCA cycle and the mitochondrial respiratory chain; other members are Sdh1p, Sdh3p, and Sdh4p

Gene.name: AuTophaGy related
Gene.functionSummary: Atg12p transferase (transfers Atg12 from Atg12p-Atg7p conjugate to Atg10p); involved in macroautophagy and cytoplasm-to-vacuole targeting (CVT) pathways|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutant shows no autophagy, mitophagy or pexophagy, increased sensitivity to nitrogen starvation and is unable to sporulate
Gene.description: Conserved E2-like conjugating enzyme; mediates formation of the Atg12p-Atg5p conjugate, which is a critical step in autophagy

Gene.name: fdp1 Suppressor
Gene.description: Aquaglyceroporin, plasma membrane channel; involved in efflux of glycerol and xylitol, and in uptake of acetic acid and the trivalent metalloids arsenite and antimonite; role in mediating passive diffusion of glycerol is key factor in maintenance of redox balance; phosphorylated by Hog1p MAPK under acetate stress; deletion improves xylose fermentation; regulated by Rgc1p and Ask10p, which themselves are regulated by Hog1p phosphorylation under osmotic stress

Dubious open reading frame; unlikely to encode a functional protein, based on available experimental and comparative sequence data; transcription of both YLL044W and the overlapping gene RPL8B is reduced in the gcr1 null mutant

Gene.name: Ribosomal Protein of the Large subunit
Gene.functionSummary: Subunit of the cytosolic large ribosomal subunit; involved in maturation of the large subunit rRNA and translation|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.description: Ribosomal 60S subunit protein L8B; required for processing of 27SA3 pre-rRNA to 27SB pre-rRNA during assembly of large ribosomal subunit; depletion leads to a turnover of pre-rRNA; L8 binds to Domain I of 25S and 5.8 S rRNAs; mutation results in decreased amounts of free 60S subunits; homologous to mammalian ribosomal protein L7A, no bacterial homolog; RPL8B has a paralog, RPL8A, that arose from the whole genome duplication
GO.Slim: structural constituent of ribosome;structural molecule activity

Gene.name: RiboNucleoProtein
Gene.briefDescription: Ribonucleoprotein that contains two RNA recognition motifs (RRM)
Gene.description: Ribonucleoprotein that contains two RNA recognition motifs (RRM); RNP1 has a paralog, SBP1, that arose from the whole genome duplication
Dubious open reading frame; unlikely to encode a functional protein, based on available experimental and comparative sequence data; partially overlaps verified gene RNP1

Gene.name: Yeast Bile Transporter
Gene.briefDescription: Transporter of the ATP-binding cassette (ABC) family
Gene.description: Transporter of the ATP-binding cassette (ABC) family; involved in bile acid transport; negative regulator of vacuole fusion; regulates release of lumenal Ca2+ stores; similar to mammalian bile transporters; YBT1 has a paralog, VMR1, that arose from the whole genome duplication

Gene.name: Low Dye Binding
Gene.description: Component of the dynactin complex; dynactin is required for dynein activity; null mutant exhibits defects in nuclear migration and spindle orientation and has reduced affinity for alcian blue dye; has homology to mammalian dynactin subunit p24

Gene.name: Ferric REductase
Gene.briefDescription: Putative ferric reductase with similarity to Fre2p
Gene.description: Putative ferric reductase with similarity to Fre2p; expression induced by low iron levels

Gene.name: AQuaporin from Yeast
Gene.phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutant shows reduced competitive fitness and sensitivity to oxidative stress and copper ions; overexpression causes slow growth
Gene.briefDescription: Water channel that mediates water transport across cell membranes
Gene.description: Water channel that mediates water transport across cell membranes; only expressed in proliferating cells; controlled by osmotic signals; may be involved in freeze tolerance; disrupted by a stop codon in many S. cerevisiae strains

Gene.functionSummary: Predicted integral membrane protein whose biological role is unknown|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.description: Putative protein; in the Sigma 1278B strain background YLL053C is contiguous with AQY2 which encodes an aquaporin

Gene.phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutants exhibit abnormal vacuolar morphology, decreased respiratory metabolism and resistance to Calcofluor White, and increased lifespan and competitive fitness; heterozygous diploid nulls are haploinsufficient and show increased sensitivity to the antidepressant St. Johnå¥ÌÛ_s Wort
Gene.briefDescription: Putative protein of unknown function with similarity to Pip2p
Gene.description: Putative protein of unknown function with similarity to Pip2p; an oleate-specific transcriptional activator of peroxisome proliferation; YLL054C is not an essential gene
GO.Slim: DNA binding;nucleic acid binding transcription factor activity

Gene.name: Yeast Cysteine Transporter
Gene.description: High-affinity cysteine-specific transporter; has similarity to the Dal5p family of transporters; green fluorescent protein (GFP)-fusion protein localizes to the endoplasmic reticulum; YCT1 is not an essential gene

Gene.functionSummary: Protein whose biological role and cellular location are unknown|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.description: Putative protein of unknown function; transcription is activated by paralogous transcription factors Yrm1p and Yrr1p and genes involved in pleiotropic drug resistance (PDR); expression is induced in cells treated with the mycotoxin patulin; SWAT-GFP and mCherry fusion proteins localize to the endoplasmic reticulum and vacuole respectively

Gene.name: dnaJ-Like Protein
Gene.description: Fe(II)-dependent sulfonate/alpha-ketoglutarate dioxygenase; involved in sulfonate catabolism for use as a sulfur source; contains sequence that resembles a J domain (typified by the E. coli DnaJ protein); induced by sulphur starvation

Gene.briefDescription: Putative protein of unknown function with similarity to Str2p
Gene.description: Putative protein of unknown function with similarity to Str2p; Str2p is a cystathionine gamma-synthase important in sulfur metabolism; YLL058W is not an essential gene
Dubious open reading frame; unlikely to encode a functional protein, based on available experimental and comparative sequence data

Gene.name: GlutaThione Transferase
Gene.description: Glutathione S-transferase capable of homodimerization; functional overlap with Gtt2p, Grx1p, and Grx2p; protein abundance increases in response to DNA replication stress

Gene.name: S-MethylMethionine Permease
Gene.description: High-affinity S-methylmethionine permease; required for utilization of S-methylmethionine as a sulfur source; has similarity to S-adenosylmethionine permease Sam3p

Gene.name: S-Methylmethionine-Homocysteine methylTransferase
Gene.description: S-methylmethionine-homocysteine methyltransferase; functions along with Sam4p in the conversion of S-adenosylmethionine (AdoMet) to methionine to control the methionine/AdoMet ratio

Gene.name: AcetYlTransferase
Gene.description: Acetyltransferase; catalyzes trichothecene 3-O-acetylation, suggesting a possible role in trichothecene biosynthesis

Gene.functionSummary: Protein whose biological role is unknown; localizes to the mitochondrion and the vacuolar membrane in large-scale studies|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.description: Putative protein of unknown function; the authentic, non-tagged protein is detected in highly purified mitochondria in high-throughput studies; predicted to be palmitoylated

Gene.name: Complementation of Mcm-10 Suppressor
Gene.functionSummary: Protein whose biological role is unknown; localizes to the cytoplasm, 90S preribosome, and nucleus in different large-scale studies|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.briefDescription: Putative subunit of the 90S preribosome processome complex
Gene.description: Putative subunit of the 90S preribosome processome complex; overexpression rescues supressor mutant of mcm10; null mutant is viable; relocalizes from nucleus to cytoplasm upon DNA replication stress

Gene.name: THI regulon
Gene.functionSummary: A transporter protein localized to the endoplasmic reticulum|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.description: Putative plasma membrane permease; proposed to be involved in carboxylic acid uptake and repressed by thiamine; substrate of Dbf2p/Mob1p kinase; transcription is altered if mitochondrial dysfunction occurs

Gene.name: Suppressor of Sensor Kinase
Gene.briefDescription: Cytoplasmic phosphorelay intermediate osmosensor and regulator
Gene.description: Cytoplasmic phosphorelay intermediate osmosensor and regulator; part of a two-component signal transducer that mediates osmosensing via a phosphorelay mechanism; required for mitophagy; dephosphorylated form is degraded by the ubiquitin-proteasome system; potential Cdc28p substrate
GO.Slim: enzyme binding;enzyme regulator activity;signal transducer activity

Gene.name: LOw Temperature-responsive
Gene.description: FMN-dependent NAD(P)H:quinone reductase; role in apoptosis-like cell death; may be involved in quinone detoxification; expression elevated at low temperature; sequesters the Cin5p transcription factor in the cytoplasm in complex with the proteasome under reducing conditions

Gene.functionSummary: Protein whose biological role and cellular location are unknown|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.description: Putative protein of unknown function; YLR012C is not an essential gene

Gene.briefDescription: Protein containing GATA family zinc finger motifs
Gene.description: Protein containing GATA family zinc finger motifs; involved in spore wall assembly; sequence similarity to GAT4, and the double mutant gat3 gat4 exhibits reduced dityrosine fluorescence relative to the single mutants
GO.Slim: DNA binding;nucleic acid binding transcription factor activity

Gene.name: Pyrimidine Pathway Regulation
Gene.description: Zinc finger transcription factor; contains a Zn(2)-Cys(6) binuclear cluster domain, positively regulates transcription of URA1, URA3, URA4, and URA10, which are involved in de novo pyrimidine biosynthesis, in response to pyrimidine starvation; activity may be modulated by interaction with Tup1p
GO.Slim: DNA binding;ion binding;nucleic acid binding transcription factor activity

Gene.name: BREfeldin A sensitivity
Gene.functionSummary: Component of the histone methyltransferase Set1C/COMPASS complex that is involved in histone H3-K4 methylation|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.description: Subunit of COMPASS (Set1C) complex; COMPASS methylates Lys4 of histone H3 and functions in silencing at telomeres; has a C-terminal Sdc1 Dpy-30 Interaction (SDI) domain that mediates binding to Sdc1p; similar to trithorax-group protein ASH2L

Gene.name: Pre-mRNA Leakage
Gene.description: Subunit of the RES complex; RES complex is required for nuclear retention of unspliced pre-mRNAs; acts in the same pathway as Pml39p and Mlp1p

Gene.name: Multicopy Enhancer of UAS2
Gene.description: Methylthioadenosine phosphorylase (MTAP); catalyzes the initial step in the methionine salvage pathway; affects polyamine biosynthesis through regulation of ornithine decarboxylase (Spe1p) activity; regulates ADH2 gene expression
GO.Slim: RNA binding;mRNA binding;transferase activity;transferase activity, transferring glycosyl groups

Gene.name: POre Membrane
Gene.briefDescription: Subunit of the transmembrane ring of the nuclear pore complex (NPC)
Gene.description: Subunit of the transmembrane ring of the nuclear pore complex (NPC); contributes to nucleocytoplasmic transport, NPC biogenesis and spindle pole body duplication

Gene.name: Plasma membrane Sodium Response
Gene.briefDescription: Plasma membrane phosphatase involved in the general stress response
Gene.description: Plasma membrane phosphatase involved in the general stress response; required with Psr1p and Whi2p for full activation of STRE-mediated gene expression, possibly through dephosphorylation of Msn2p; PSR2 has a paralog, PSR1, that arose from the whole genome duplication

Gene.name: Yeast steryl Ester Hydrolase
Gene.description: Steryl ester hydrolase; catalyzes steryl ester hydrolysis at the plasma membrane; involved in sterol metabolism; YEH2 has a paralog, YEH1, that arose from the whole genome duplication

Gene.name: Increased Recombination Centers
Gene.briefDescription: Component of a heterodimeric Poc4p-Irc25p chaperone
Gene.description: Component of a heterodimeric Poc4p-Irc25p chaperone; involved in assembly of alpha subunits into the 20S proteasome; may regulate formation of proteasome isoforms with alternative subunits under different conditions; upregulates proteasome assembly in response to the unfolded protein response activated by mistargeting of proteins (UPRam)

Gene.name: Implicated in Zinc Homeostasis
Gene.functionSummary: A protein involved in cellular zinc ion homeostasis with an unknown cellular location|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.briefDescription: Membrane protein involved in zinc ion homeostasis
Gene.description: Membrane protein involved in zinc ion homeostasis; member of the four-protein IZH family, expression induced by zinc deficiency; deletion reduces sensitivity to elevated zinc and shortens lag phase, overexpression reduces Zap1p activity

Cytoplasmic ubiquitin-protein ligase (E3); component of the Mub1p-Ubr2p-Rad6p ubiquitin ligase complex required for the ubiquitination and degradation of Rpn4p; mediates formation of the ternary complex

Gene.name: Sucrose NonFermenting
Gene.briefDescription: One of four subunits of the ESCRT-III complex
Gene.description: One of four subunits of the ESCRT-III complex; involved in the sorting of transmembrane proteins into the multivesicular body (MVB) pathway; recruited from the cytoplasm to endosomal membranes; ESCRT-III stands for endosomal sorting complex required for transport III

Gene.name: ADEnine
Gene.functionSummary: Inosine monophosphate (IMP) cyclohydrolase and phosphoribosylaminoimidazolecarboxamide (AICAR) formyltransferase involved in purine nucleotide and 'de novo' IMP biosynthetic processes; also involved in aerobic respiration and ascospore formation; localized to the cytosol|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutant is resistant to cisplatin and shows increased competitive fitness
Gene.description: Enzyme of 'de novo' purine biosynthesis; contains both 5-aminoimidazole-4-carboxamide ribonucleotide transformylase and inosine monophosphate cyclohydrolase activities; ADE16 has a paralog, ADE17, that arose from the whole genome duplication; ade16 ade17 mutants require adenine and histidine

Gene.functionSummary: Protein whose biological role and cellular location are unknown|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.description: Putative protein of unknown function; S288C contains an in-frame stop codon between ORFs YLR030W and YLR031W

Gene.functionSummary: Protein whose biological role and cellular location are unknown|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.description: Putative protein of unknown function; S288C contains an in-frame stop codon between ORFs YLR030W and YLR031W; YLR031W has a paralog, YMR124W, that arose from the whole genome duplication

Gene.name: RADiation sensitive
Gene.phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutant displays sensitivity to DNA-damaging agents, including MMS, HU, UV light, and X-rays; null mutant has increased chromosomal rearrangement and instability; in large-scale studies, null mutant displays decreased competitive fitness and oxidative stress resistance, and altered sensitivity to various chemicals
Gene.description: DNA helicase/Ubiquitin ligase; involved in error-free DNA damage tolerance (DDT), replication fork regression during postreplication repair by template switching, error-prone translesion synthesis; promotes synthesis of free and PCNA-bound polyubiquitin chains by Ubc13p-Mms2p; forms nuclear foci upon DNA replication stress; associates with native telomeres, cooperates with homologous recombination in senescent cells; human homolog HLTF can complement yeast null mutant

Gene.functionSummary: A metal ion transmembrane transporter involved in iron ion transport and cellular iron ion homeostasis; localized to the vacuole membrane|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.briefDescription: Putative divalent metal ion transporter involved in iron homeostasis
Gene.description: Putative divalent metal ion transporter involved in iron homeostasis; transcriptionally regulated by metal ions; member of the Nramp family of metal transport proteins; protein abundance increases in response to DNA replication stress

Gene.name: MutL Homolog
Gene.briefDescription: Protein involved in mismatch repair and meiotic recombination
Gene.description: Protein involved in mismatch repair and meiotic recombination; only certain frameshift intermediates are mismatch repair substrates; forms a complex with Mlh1p

Gene.functionSummary: Predicted integral membrane protein whose biological role is unknown|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.briefDescription: Putative protein predicted to have transmembrane domains
Gene.description: Putative protein predicted to have transmembrane domains; interacts with HSP90 by yeast two-hybrid analysis; YLR036C is not an essential protein

Gene.name: seriPAUperin family
Gene.functionSummary: Predicted cell wall protein whose biological role is unknown|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.description: Cell wall mannoprotein; has similarity to Tir1p, Tir2p, Tir3p, and Tir4p; member of the seripauperin multigene family encoded mainly in subtelomeric regions; expressed under anaerobic conditions, completely repressed during aerobic growth

Gene.name: Cytochrome c OXidase
Gene.briefDescription: Subunit VIb of cytochrome c oxidase
Gene.description: Subunit VIb of cytochrome c oxidase; cytochrome c oxidase is also known as respiratory Complex IV and is the terminal member of the mitochondrial inner membrane electron transport chain; required for assembly of cytochrome c oxidase but not required for activity after assembly; phosphorylated; easily released from the intermembrane space, suggesting a loose association with Complex IV

Gene.name: RIbosome Control
Gene.briefDescription: Protein involved in retrograde transport to the cis-Golgi network
Gene.description: Protein involved in retrograde transport to the cis-Golgi network; forms heterodimer with Rgp1p that acts as a GTP exchange factor for Ypt6p; involved in transcription of rRNA and ribosomal protein genes

Gene.name: A-Factor Barrier
Gene.phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutant shows reduced competitive fitness and some vacuolar fragmentation in systematic studies; overexpression causes slow growth
Gene.description: MATalpha-specific a-factor blocker; contributes to mating efficiency under certain conditions; localizes to the cell wall; predicted to be a GPI-attached protein; upregulated by Mcm1p-Alpha1p transcription factor; partially overlaps the dubious ORF YLR041W
Dubious open reading frame; unlikely to encode a functional protein, based on available experimental and comparative sequence data; partially overlaps the uncharacterized ORF YLR040C

Gene.functionSummary: Protein whose biological role is unknown; localizes to the cell wall|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.briefDescription: Cell wall protein of unknown function
Gene.description: Cell wall protein of unknown function; localizes to the cytoplasm; deletion improves xylose fermentation in industrially engineered strains; YLL042C is not an essential gene

Gene.name: ThioRedoXin
Gene.description: Cytoplasmic thioredoxin isoenzyme; part of thioredoxin system which protects cells against oxidative and reductive stress; forms LMA1 complex with Pbi2p; acts as a cofactor for Tsa1p; required for ER-Golgi transport and vacuole inheritance; with Trx2p, facilitates mitochondrial import of small Tims Tim9p, Tim10p, Tim13p by maintaining them in reduced form; abundance increases iunder DNA replication stress; TRX1 has a paralog, TRX2, that arose from the whole genome duplication

Gene.name: Pyruvate DeCarboxylase
Gene.functionSummary: Pyruvate decarboxylase involved in amino acid catabolism and the fermentation of glucose to ethanol; localizes to both the nucleus and the cytosol|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutant shows slow growth rate; in large-scale studies, null mutant exhibits decreased competitive fitness, heat sensitivity, and altered resistance to various chemicals
Gene.briefDescription: Major of three pyruvate decarboxylase isozymes
Gene.description: Major of three pyruvate decarboxylase isozymes; key enzyme in alcoholic fermentation; decarboxylates pyruvate to acetaldehyde; involved in amino acid catabolism; subject to glucose-, ethanol-, and autoregulation; activated by phosphorylation in response to glucose levels; N-terminally propionylated in vivo

Gene.functionSummary: Predicted integral membrane protein whose biological role is unknown|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.description: Putative membrane protein; member of the fungal lipid-translocating exporter (LTE) family of proteins; transcription is activated by paralogous transcription factors Yrm1p and Yrr1p along with genes involved in multidrug resistance; YLR046C has a paralog, RTA1, that arose from the whole genome duplication

Gene.briefDescription: Protein with sequence similarity to iron/copper reductases
Gene.description: Protein with sequence similarity to iron/copper reductases; involved in iron homeostasis; deletion mutant has iron deficiency/accumulation growth defects; expression increased in the absence of copper-responsive transcription factor Mac1p

Gene.name: Ribosomal Protein of the Small subunit
Gene.functionSummary: Subunit of the cytosolic small ribosomal subunit; involved in rRNA processing and export from the nucleus, assembly of the small ribosomal subunit, and translation|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.briefDescription: Protein component of the small (40S) ribosomal subunit
Gene.description: Protein component of the small (40S) ribosomal subunit; RPS0B has a paralog, RPS0A, that arose from the whole genome duplication; required for maturation of 18S rRNA along with Rps0Ap; deletion of either RPS0 gene reduces growth rate, deletion of both genes is lethal; homologous to human ribosomal protein SA and bacterial S2
GO.Slim: structural constituent of ribosome;structural molecule activity

Gene.functionSummary: Protein whose biological role and cellular location are unknown|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.description: Putative protein of unknown function

Gene.functionSummary: Predicted integral membrane protein whose biological role is unknown; localizes to the endoplasmic reticulum in a large-scale study|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.description: Putative protein of unknown function; green fluorescent protein (GFP)-fusion protein localizes to the endoplasmic reticulum; YLR050C is not an essential gene

Gene.name: Ino Eighty Subunit
Gene.briefDescription: Subunit of the INO80 chromatin remodeling complex
Gene.description: Subunit of the INO80 chromatin remodeling complex

Gene.functionSummary: Protein whose biological role and cellular location are unknown|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.description: Putative protein of unknown function

Gene.name: Outer Spore Wall
Gene.briefDescription: Protein of unknown function reputedly involved in spore wall assembly
Gene.description: Protein of unknown function reputedly involved in spore wall assembly

Gene.name: SuPpressor of Ty
Gene.phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutants have abnormal vacuolar morphology, enhanced respiration and caffeine tolerance, impaired sporulation, are sensitive to DNA-damaging agents, heat, osmotic stress, dessication, and are auxotrophic for myo-inositol; overexpression slows growth
Gene.briefDescription: Subunit of the SAGA transcriptional regulatory complex
Gene.description: Subunit of the SAGA transcriptional regulatory complex; not present in SAGA-like complex SLIK/SALSA; required for SAGA-mediated inhibition at some promoters
GO.Slim: transcription factor activity, protein binding;transcription factor binding

Gene.name: ERGosterol biosynthesis
Gene.phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutant fails to synthesize ergosterol and cannot grow on nonfermentable carbon sources; null mutant exhibits increased resistance to azole antifungal drugs and decreased resistance to various other drugs; null mutant has reduced competitive fitness in a large-scale study
Gene.description: C-5 sterol desaturase; glycoprotein that catalyzes the introduction of a C-5(6) double bond into episterol, a precursor in ergosterol biosynthesis; transcriptionally down-regulated when ergosterol is in excess; mutants are viable, but cannot grow on non-fermentable carbon sources; substrate of HRD ubiquitin ligase; mutation is functionally complemented by human SC5D

Gene.name: MaNnosidase-Like protein
Gene.briefDescription: Putative mannosidase involved in ER-associated protein degradation
Gene.description: Putative mannosidase involved in ER-associated protein degradation; localizes to the endoplasmic reticulum; sequence similarity with seven-hairpin glycosidase (GH47) family members, such as Mns1p and Mnl1p, that hydrolyze 1,2-linked alpha-D-mannose residues; non-essential gene

Gene.name: Serine HydroxyMethyltransferase
Gene.description: Cytosolic serine hydroxymethyltransferase; converts serine to glycine plus 5,10 methylenetetrahydrofolate; major isoform involved in generating precursors for purine, pyrimidine, amino acid, and lipid biosynthesis

Gene.name: Rna EXonuclease
Gene.description: 3'-5' RNA exonuclease; involved in 3'-end processing of U4 and U5 snRNAs, 5S and 5.8S rRNAs, and RNase P and RNase MRP RNA; localized to mitochondria and null suppresses escape of mtDNA to nucleus in yme1 yme2 mutants; RNase D exonuclease

Gene.name: Ribosomal Protein of the Large subunit
Gene.functionSummary: Subunit of the cytosolic large ribosomal subunit; involved in translation|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.description: Ribosomal 60S subunit protein L22A; required for the oxidative stress response in yeast; homologous to mammalian ribosomal protein L22, no bacterial homolog; RPL22A has a paralog, RPL22B, that arose from the whole genome duplication
GO.Slim: structural constituent of ribosome;structural molecule activity

Gene.name: BUD site selection
Gene.description: Dubious open reading frame; unlikely to encode a functional protein, based on available experimental and comparative sequence data; not conserved in closely related Saccharomyces species; 98% of ORF overlaps the verified gene RPL22A; diploid mutant displays a weak budding pattern phenotype in a systematic assay

Gene.name: Base Methyltransferase of Twenty five S rRNA 6
Gene.briefDescription: Methyltransferase required for m3U2843 methylation of the 25S rRNA
Gene.description: Methyltransferase required for m3U2843 methylation of the 25S rRNA; S-adenosylmethionine-dependent; green fluorescent protein (GFP)-fusion protein localizes to the cytoplasm; YLR063W is not an essential gene

Gene.name: Pore and ER protein, 33 kDa
Gene.functionSummary: Protein whose biological role is unknown; localizes to the endoplasmic reticulum and colocalizes with nuclear pore|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.briefDescription: Protein that localizes to the endoplasmic reticulum
Gene.description: Protein that localizes to the endoplasmic reticulum; also associates with the nuclear pore complex; deletion extends chronological lifespan; highly conserved across species, orthologous to human TMEM33 and paralogous to Pom33p; protein abundance increases in response to DNA replication stress

Gene.name: PETite colonies
Gene.briefDescription: Specific translational activator for the COX1 mRNA
Gene.description: Specific translational activator for the COX1 mRNA; binds to the COX1 mRNA; also influences stability of intron-containing COX1 primary transcripts; localizes to the mitochondrial inner membrane; contains 12 pentatricopeptide repeats (PPRs)

Gene.name: Function required for Yeast Viability
Gene.briefDescription: Essential protein required for maturation of 18S rRNA
Gene.description: Essential protein required for maturation of 18S rRNA; required for survival upon exposure to K1 killer toxin

Gene.name: Mitochondrial Elongation Factor
Gene.briefDescription: Mitochondrial elongation factor involved in translational elongation
Gene.description: Mitochondrial elongation factor involved in translational elongation
GO.Slim: RNA binding;translation factor activity, RNA binding

Gene.description: Xylitol dehydrogenase; converts xylitol to D-xylulose; expression induced by xylose, even though this pentose sugar is not well utilized by S. cerevisiae; null mutant has cell wall defect

Gene.name: Lipid transfer protein Anchored at Membrane contact site
Gene.functionSummary: Sterol transfer protein with a role in intracellular sterol transport; localizes to intracellular membrane contact sites between ER and other organelles|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.briefDescription: Sterol transporter that transfers sterols between membranes
Gene.description: Sterol transporter that transfers sterols between membranes; may regulate and coordinate formation of contact sites between organelles; localizes to ER-mitochondrial contact sites in a Tom70p- and Tom71p-dependent manner; mitochondrial localization requires GRAM domain; also localizes to ER-vacuole contact sites, in a Vac8p-dependent manner; has GRAM and StART-like (VASt) domains; one of six StART-like domain-containing proteins in yeast; conserved across eukaryotes

Gene.name: Regulator of Free Ubiquitin chains
Gene.briefDescription: Protein that inhibits Doa4p deubiquitinating activity
Gene.description: Protein that inhibits Doa4p deubiquitinating activity; contributes to ubiquitin homeostasis by regulating the conversion of free ubiquitin chains to ubiquitin monomers by Doa4p; GFP-fusion protein localizes to endosomes

Gene.name: BUD site selection
Gene.briefDescription: C2H2-type zinc finger protein required for ribosome assembly
Gene.description: C2H2-type zinc finger protein required for ribosome assembly; shuttling factor which associates with pre-60S particles in the nucleus, accompanying them to the cytoplasm; cytoplasmic dissociation of Bud20p requires Drg1p; N-terminus harbors a nuclear localization signal (NLS) and a nuclear export signal (NES); cytoplasmic Bud20p is reimported by Kap123-dependent pathway; involved in bud-site selection; diploid mutants display a random budding pattern; similar to human ZNF593

Gene.name: Found in Mitochondrial Proteome
Gene.briefDescription: Protein required for assembly of respiratory complex III
Gene.description: Protein required for assembly of respiratory complex III; mitochondrial inner membrane protein; required for an early step in assembly of respiratory complex III (cytochrome bc1 complex); mRNA is targeted to mitochondria

Gene.name: Substrate/Subunit Inhibitor of Cyclin-dependent protein kinase
Gene.description: Cyclin-dependent kinase inhibitor (CKI); inhibitor of Cdc28-Clb kinase complexes that controls G1/S phase transition, preventing premature S phase and ensuring genomic integrity; phosphorylated by Clb5/6-Cdk1 and Cln1/2-Cdk1 kinase which regulate timing of Sic1p degradation; phosphorylation targets Sic1p for SCF(CDC4)-dependent turnover; functional homolog of mammalian Kip1

Gene.briefDescription: Integral membrane component of ER-derived COPII-coated vesicles
Gene.description: Integral membrane component of ER-derived COPII-coated vesicles; functions in ER to Golgi transport; EMP46 has a paralog, EMP47, that arose from the whole genome duplication

Gene.name: GALactose metabolism
Gene.phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutant is unable to grow on low concentrations of galactose but can grow on high galactose concentrations as long as cells are respiratory-competent; null mutation confers resistance to toxaphene; overexpression causes slow growth
Gene.description: Galactose permease; required for utilization of galactose; also able to transport glucose

Gene.name: Suppressor of Rad53 null Lethality
Gene.description: Protein of unknown function; overexpression suppresses the lethality caused by a rad53 null mutation

Gene.briefDescription: Protein with a role in cellular adhesion and filamentous growth
Gene.description: Protein with a role in cellular adhesion and filamentous growth; also endosome-to-vacuole sorting; similar to Tmn3p; member of Transmembrane Nine family of proteins with 9 transmembrane segments; EMP70 has a paralog, TMN2, that arose from the whole genome duplication

Gene.name: Actin-Related Protein
Gene.phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutant has slightly disorganized actin filaments, and abnormal vacuolar morphology with a large vacuolar lobe surrounded by many smaller lobes; null mutant has an increased frequency of spontaneous interchromosomal heteroallelic recombination and an increased frequency of spontaneous and MMS-induced unequal sister chromatid recombination; null mutant has increased chronological lifespan under both nitrogen starvation and nitrogen-rich conditions; null mutant is desiccation sensitive; heterozygous null mutant is haploproficient
Gene.description: Actin-related protein that binds nucleosomes; a component of the SWR1 complex, which exchanges histone variant H2AZ (Htz1p) for chromatin-bound histone H2A

Gene.name: Cold Sensitive for Fermentation
Gene.briefDescription: Protein required for fermentation at low temperature
Gene.description: Protein required for fermentation at low temperature; plays a role in the maturation of secretory proteins; the authentic, non-tagged protein is detected in highly purified mitochondria in high-throughput studies

Gene.name: ALanine Transaminase
Gene.phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutant accumulates alanine and shows decreased growth rate in exponential phase; null mutant is defective in utilization of alanine as nitrogen source and accumulates reactive oxigen species; in systematic studies null mutants grow poorly under anaerobic growth conditions and are sensitive to amitrole, cycloheximide, neomycin, caspofungin, cordycepin, but resistant to myriocin
Gene.description: Alanine transaminase (glutamic pyruvic transaminase); involved in alanine biosynthesis and catabolism; TOR1-independent role in determining chronological lifespan; expression is induced in the presence of alanine; repression is mediated by Nrg1p; ALT1 has a paralog, ALT2, that arose from the whole genome duplication; Alt2p is catalytically inactive

Gene.briefDescription: Chaperone with a role in facilitating mitochondrial protein import
Gene.description: Chaperone with a role in facilitating mitochondrial protein import; ascomycete-specific member of the DnaJ-like family, closely related to Ydj1p; predicted to be C-terminally prenylated; the authentic, non-tagged protein is detected in highly purified mitochondria in high-throughput studies

Gene.name: GEnetic interactors of Prohibitins
Gene.description: Protein of unknown function; required for mitochondrial genome maintenance; detected in highly purified mitochondria in high-throughput studies; null mutant has decreased levels of cardiolipin and phosphatidylethanolamine

Gene.name: SULfate
Gene.description: High affinity sulfate permease; sulfate uptake is mediated by specific sulfate transporters Sul1p and Sul2p, which control the concentration of endogenous activated sulfate intermediates

Gene.name: New Yeast V-SNARE
Gene.briefDescription: v-SNARE component of the vacuolar SNARE complex
Gene.description: v-SNARE component of the vacuolar SNARE complex; involved in vesicle fusion; inhibits ATP-dependent Ca(2+) transport activity of Pmc1p in the vacuolar membrane

Gene.name: GIg1-2 Suppressor
Gene.description: Protein of unknown function

Gene.name: Iswi One Complex
Gene.functionSummary: Subunit of the Isw1b complex involved in chromatin remodeling|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.description: Subunit of the Isw1b complex; exhibits nucleosome-stimulated ATPase activity and acts within coding regions to coordinate transcription elongation with termination and processing; contains a PHD finger motif; other complex members are Isw1p and Ioc4p

Gene.name: KINase
Gene.briefDescription: Serine/threonine protein kinase involved in regulation of exocytosis
Gene.description: Serine/threonine protein kinase involved in regulation of exocytosis; localizes to the cytoplasmic face of the plasma membrane; KIN2 has a paralog, KIN1, that arose from the whole genome duplication

Gene.name: High level expression Reduces Ty3 transposition
Gene.description: Putative SCF-ubiquitin ligase F-box protein; based on both genetic and physical interactions and sequence similarity; identified in association with Cdc53p, Skp1p and Ubi4 in large and small-scale studies

Gene.name: Catabolism of Hydroxy Amino acids
Gene.description: DNA binding transcriptional activator; mediates serine/threonine activation of the catabolic L-serine (L-threonine) deaminase (CHA1); Zinc-finger protein with Zn[2]-Cys[6] fungal-type binuclear cluster domain
GO.Slim: DNA binding;nucleic acid binding transcription factor activity

Gene.name: Increased Copper Tolerance
Gene.functionSummary: Lysophosphatidic acid acyltransferase involved in the biosynthesis of phosphatidic acid|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutant is sensitive to azole drugs; overexpression increases resistance to azoles and benomyl
Gene.description: Lysophosphatidic acid acyltransferase; responsible for enhanced phospholipid synthesis during organic solvent stress; null displays increased sensitivity to Calcofluor white; highly expressed during organic solvent stress; ICT1 has a paralog, ECM18, that arose from the whole genome duplication; human ABHD5 can complement ict1 null mutant

Gene.name: Anaphase Promoting Complex
Gene.functionSummary: Ubiquitin transferase that is a component of the anaphase-promoting complex involved in degradation of mitotic cyclins and transition from metaphase to anaphase during mitotic cell cycle|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutation causes delayed passage through metaphase-anaphase transition and accumulation of G2/M cells; null mutant is resistant to bleomycin, caffeine, fenpropimorph, but sensitive to camptothecin and rapamycin
Gene.description: Subunit of the Anaphase-Promoting Complex/Cyclosome (APC/C); APC/C is a ubiquitin-protein ligase required for degradation of anaphase inhibitors, including mitotic cyclins, during the metaphase/anaphase transition

Gene.name: Long Chronological Lifespan 2
Gene.description: Putative protein of unknown function; mutant is deficient in cell wall mannosylphosphate and has long chronological lifespan; genetic interactions suggest a role in ER-associated protein degradation (ERAD); SWAT-GFP fusion protein localizes to the endoplasmic reticulum and vacuole, while mCherry fusion localizes to just the vacuole

Gene.name: Rna EXonuclease
Gene.description: RNA exonuclease; required for maturation of the RNA component of RNase MRP; functions redundantly with Rnh70p and Rex2p in processing of U5 snRNA and RNase P RNA; member of RNase D family of exonucleases

Gene.functionSummary: Protein whose biological role is unknown; localizes to the nucleus in a large-scale study|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.description: Protein of unknown function; green fluorescent protein (GFP)-fusion protein localizes to the nucleus; YLR108C is not an esssential gene; protein abundance increases in response to DNA replication stress; YLR108C has a paralog, YDR132C, that arose from the whole genome duplication

Gene.name: Alkyl HydroPeroxide reductase
Gene.phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutant has increased competitive fitness in defined media; null mutant displays decreased resistance to oxidative stress; heterozygous null mutant is haploproficient
Gene.description: Thiol-specific peroxiredoxin; reduces hydroperoxides to protect against oxidative damage; function in vivo requires covalent conjugation to Urm1p

Gene.name: Covalently linked Cell Wall protein
Gene.functionSummary: Structural constituent of cell wall; involved in agglutination during conjugation and fungal cell wall organization; localizes to the bud tip and mating projection tip|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.description: Cell wall mannoprotein; plays a role in maintenance of newly synthesized areas of cell wall; localizes to periphery of small buds, septum region of larger buds, and shmoo tip; CCW12 has a paralog, YDR134C, that arose from the whole genome duplication
Dubious open reading frame; unlikely to encode a functional protein, based on available experimental and comparative sequence data
Dubious open reading frame; unlikely to encode a functional protein, based on available experimental and comparative sequence data

Gene.name: High Osmolarity Glycerol response
Gene.functionSummary: Mitogen-activated protein kinase involved in osmoregulation|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.briefDescription: Mitogen-activated protein kinase involved in osmoregulation
Gene.description: Mitogen-activated protein kinase involved in osmoregulation; controls global reallocation of RNAPII in osmotic shock; activates CDC28 by stimulating antisense RNA transcription; mediates recruitment/activation of RNAPII at Hot1p-dependent promoters; with Mrc1p defines novel S-phase checkpoint that prevent conflicts between DNA replication and transcription; nuclear form represses pseudohyphal growth; autophosphorylates; protein abundance increases under DNA replication stress
GO.Slim: chromatin binding;kinase activity;signal transducer activity;transferase activity

Gene.name: Apl2 Vps1 Lethal
Gene.briefDescription: Conserved protein involved in exocytic transport from the Golgi
Gene.description: Conserved protein involved in exocytic transport from the Golgi; mutation is synthetically lethal with apl2 vps1 double mutation; member of a protein superfamily with orthologs in diverse organisms; relocalizes from bud neck to cytoplasm upon DNA replication stress

Gene.briefDescription: Acyl-protein thioesterase responsible for depalmitoylation of Gpa1p
Gene.description: Acyl-protein thioesterase responsible for depalmitoylation of Gpa1p; green fluorescent protein (GFP)-fusion protein localizes to both the cytoplasm and nucleus and is induced in response to the DNA-damaging agent MMS

Gene.name: Suppressor of Rna mutations, Number 2
Gene.description: Component of the ESCRT-I complex; ESCRT-I is involved in ubiquitin-dependent sorting of proteins into the endosome; suppressor of rna1-1 mutation; may be involved in RNA export from nucleus

Gene.name: YaPSin
Gene.functionSummary: Aspartic protease; involved in nutrient limitation-induced cleavage of the signaling mucin Msb2p, resulting in filamentous growth MAPK pathway activation; involved with Kex2p in processing of the alpha factor precursor; role in the cell wall integrity response; GPI-anchored component of the plasma membrane|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.description: Aspartic protease; hyperglycosylated member of the yapsin family of proteases, attached to the plasma membrane via a glycosylphosphatidylinositol (GPI) anchor; involved in nutrient limitation-induced cleavage of the extracellular inhibitory domain of signaling mucin Msb2p, resulting in activation of the filamentous growth MAPK pathway; involved with other yapsins in the cell wall integrity response; role in KEX2-independent processing of the alpha factor precursor

Gene.name: YaPSin
Gene.description: Aspartic protease; member of the yapsin family of proteases involved in cell wall growth and maintenance; attached to the plasma membrane via a glycosylphosphatidylinositol (GPI) anchor
Dubious open reading frame; unlikely to encode a functional protein, based on available experimental and comparative sequence data; partially overlaps the dubious ORF YLR123C

Dubious open reading frame; unlikely to encode a functional protein, based on available experimental and comparative sequence data; partially overlaps the dubious ORF YLR122C; contains characteristic aminoacyl-tRNA motif
Dubious open reading frame; unlikely to encode a functional protein, based on available experimental and comparative sequence data

Gene.functionSummary: Protein whose biological role and cellular location are unknown|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.description: Putative protein of unknown function; mutant has decreased Ty3 transposition; YLR125W is not an essential gene

Putative glutamine amidotransferase; has Aft1p-binding motif in the promoter; may be involved in copper and iron homeostasis; YLR126C is not an essential protein; relocalizes from nucleus to cytoplasmic foci upon DNA replication stress

Gene.name: Defective in Cullin Neddylation
Gene.description: Scaffold-type E3 ligase; required for cullin neddylation and ubiquitin ligase activation; contains a ubiquitin-binding domain (UBA) for ubiquitin and Nedd8 (Rub1p) interaction and a PONY domain involved in cullin binding and neddylation
GO.Slim: enzyme binding;protein binding, bridging;ubiquitin-like protein binding

Gene.name: Zinc-Regulated Transporter
Gene.functionSummary: Low-affinity zinc transmembrane transporter of the plasma membrane involved in zinc ion transport|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutants have low intracellular zinc levels, have abnormal vacuolar morphology, are resistant to heat, carcinogen toxaphene, serine C-palmitoyltransferase inhibitor myriocin, tin dichloride, and show increased competitive fitness as haploids in rich medium but decreased competive fitness as haploids in minimal medium and as diploids under batch fermentation conditions; null mutants are sensitive to tellurite, cadmium; heterozygous diploid nulls are haploinsufficient
Gene.briefDescription: Low-affinity zinc transporter of the plasma membrane
Gene.description: Low-affinity zinc transporter of the plasma membrane; transcription is induced under low-zinc conditions by the Zap1p transcription factor

Gene.name: Activator of CUP1 Expression
Gene.functionSummary: Sequence-specific DNA binding RNA polymerase II transcription factor involved in G1/S transition in the mitotic cell cycle, activates cytokinetic cell separation; localizes in the nucleus and cytosol|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutant shows bipolar budding pattern, increased cell size, cell separation defects and abnormal colony shape
Gene.briefDescription: Transcription factor required for septum destruction after cytokinesis
Gene.description: Transcription factor required for septum destruction after cytokinesis; phosphorylation by Cbk1p blocks nuclear exit during M/G1 transition, causing localization to daughter cell nuclei, and also increases Ace2p activity; phosphorylation by Cdc28p and Pho85p prevents nuclear import during cell cycle phases other than cytokinesis; part of RAM network that regulates cellular polarity and morphogenesis; ACE2 has a paralog, SWI5, that arose from the whole genome duplication
GO.Slim: DNA binding;nucleic acid binding transcription factor activity

Gene.name: Choline KInase
Gene.description: Choline kinase; catalyzes the first step in phosphatidylcholine synthesis via the CDP-choline (Kennedy pathway); exhibits some ethanolamine kinase activity contributing to phosphatidylethanolamine synthesis via the CDP-ethanolamine pathway; CKI1 has a paralog, EKI1, that arose from the whole genome duplication

Gene.name: Pyruvate DeCarboxylase
Gene.description: Minor isoform of pyruvate decarboxylase; key enzyme in alcoholic fermentation, decarboxylates pyruvate to acetaldehyde, regulation is glucose- and ethanol-dependent, repressed by thiamine, involved in amino acid catabolism

Gene.name: Synthetic Lethal of unknown (X) function
Gene.description: Endonuclease involved in processing DNA; acts during recombination, repair; promotes template switching during break-induced replication (BIR), causing non-reciprocal translocations (NRTs); cleaves branched structures in complex with Slx1p; involved in interstrand cross-link repair, Rad1p/Rad10p-dependent removal of 3'-nonhomologous tails during DSBR via single-strand annealing; relative distribution to nuclear foci increases upon DNA replication stress; FANCP-related factor

Gene.name: similar to the mammalian TPA Induced Sequence gene family
Gene.briefDescription: mRNA-binding protein expressed during iron starvation
Gene.description: mRNA-binding protein expressed during iron starvation; binds to a sequence element in the 3'-untranslated regions of specific mRNAs to mediate their degradation; involved in iron homeostasis; protein increases in abundance and relative distribution to the nucleus increases upon DNA replication stress; TIS11 has a paralog, CTH1, that arose from the whole genome duplication

Gene.name: Ribosomal lysine (K) Methyltransferase 5
Gene.functionSummary: Ribosomal S-adenosylmethionine-dependent lysine methyltransferase; catalyzes the monomethylation of large ribsomal subunit protein L1 (Rpl1a/Rpl1b)|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.description: Protein lysine methyltransferase; monomethylates Lys-46 of the ribosomal large subunit Rpl1a/Rpl1b; member of the seven beta-strand methyltransferase superfamily; orthologs only found among fungal species

Gene.name: Na+/H+ Antiporter
Gene.description: Na+/H+ antiporter; involved in sodium and potassium efflux through the plasma membrane; required for alkali cation tolerance at acidic pH

Gene.name: Synthetic Lethal with SSM4
Gene.description: Mitochondrial membrane protein; coordinates expression of mitochondrially-encoded genes; may facilitate delivery of mRNA to membrane-bound translation machinery

Gene.name: Proline UTilization
Gene.description: Proline oxidase; nuclear-encoded mitochondrial protein involved in utilization of proline as sole nitrogen source; PUT1 transcription is induced by Put3p in the presence of proline and the absence of a preferred nitrogen source

Gene.name: DiPHthamide biosynthesis
Gene.functionSummary: diphthine-ammonia ligase involved in the synthesis of peptidyl-diphthamide from peptidyl-histidine|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.description: Diphthamide synthetase; catalyzes the last amidation step of diphthamide biosynthesis using ammonium and ATP; evolutionarily conserved in eukaryotes; dph6 mutants exhibit diphthine accumulation and resistance to sordarin, which is indicative of defects in diphthamide formation on EF2; green fluorescent protein (GFP)-tagged protein localizes to the cytoplasm; DPH6/YLR143W is not an essential gene

Gene.name: Assembly Complementing Factor
Gene.phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; in systematic studies, null mutant shows slow growth, inability to utilize nonfermentable carbon sources, increased mitophagy and sensitivity to ethanol and methanol
Gene.description: Intracellular beta-1,3-endoglucanase; expression is induced during sporulation; may have a role in cortical actin cytoskeleton assembly; protein abundance increases in response to DNA replication stress
GO.Slim: hydrolase activity;hydrolase activity, acting on glycosyl bonds

Gene.name: SPErmidine auxotroph
Gene.functionSummary: Spermine synthase involved in spermine and pantothenate biosynthesis; localized to the cytoplasm in large scale studies|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.description: Spermine synthase; required for the biosynthesis of spermine and also involved in biosynthesis of pantothenic acid

Gene.name: carboxyPEPtidase Y-deficient
Gene.functionSummary: Subunit of both the HOPS tethering complex involved in vesicle fusion and the CORVET tethering complex involved in endosomal biogenesis and vacuolar transport|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.briefDescription: Component of CORVET membrane tethering complex
Gene.description: Component of CORVET membrane tethering complex; vacuolar peripheral membrane protein that promotes vesicular docking/fusion reactions in conjunction with SNARE proteins, required for vacuolar biogenesis

Gene.functionSummary: Protein whose biological role and cellular location are unknown|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.description: Protein of unknown function; overexpression causes a cell cycle delay or arrest; null mutation results in a decrease in plasma membrane electron transport; YLR149C is not an essential gene; protein abundance increases in response to DNA replication stress

Gene.name: Suppressor of ToM1
Gene.briefDescription: Protein required for optimal translation under nutrient stress
Gene.description: Protein required for optimal translation under nutrient stress; perturbs association of Yef3p with ribosomes; involved in TOR signaling; binds G4 quadruplex and purine motif triplex nucleic acid; helps maintain telomere structure; protein abundance increases in response to DNA replication stress; serves as a ribosome preservation factor both during quiescence and recovery

Gene.name: Peroxisomal Coenzyme A Diphosphatase
Gene.functionSummary: Pyrophosphatase with possible roles in Coenzyme A metabolism and DNA repair; localized to peroxisomes|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.description: 8-oxo-dGTP diphosphatase; prevents spontaneous mutagenesis via sanitization of oxidized purine nucleoside triphosphates; can also act as peroxisomal pyrophosphatase with specificity for coenzyme A and CoA derivatives, may function to remove potentially toxic oxidized CoA disulfide from peroxisomes to maintain the capacity for beta-oxidation of fatty acids; nudix hydrolase family member; similar E. coli MutT and human, rat and mouse MTH1

Gene.functionSummary: Predicted integral membrane protein whose biological role is unknown|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.description: Putative protein of unknown function; YLR152C is not an essential gene

Gene.name: RNase H
Gene.description: Ribonuclease H2 subunit; required for RNase H2 activity; role in ribonucleotide excision repair; related to human AGS3 that causes Aicardi-Goutieres syndrome

Gene.name: SDH4 Homolog
Gene.functionSummary: Putative alternate subunit of succinate dehydrogenase, based on genetic interactions with SDH4; localized to the mitochondrial inner membrane|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.briefDescription: Putative alternate subunit of succinate dehydrogenase (SDH)
Gene.description: Putative alternate subunit of succinate dehydrogenase (SDH); mitochondrial inner membrane protein; genetic interaction with SDH4 suggests that Shh4p can function as a functional SDH subunit; a fraction copurifies with SDH subunit Sdh3p; expression induced by nitrogen limitation in a GLN3, GAT1-dependent manner; Shh4p has greater similarity to human SDHD (subunit D of SDH, implicated in paraganglioma) than does its paralog Sdh4p

Gene.name: PseudoUridine Synthase
Gene.description: Pseudouridine synthase; catalyzes only the formation of pseudouridine (Psi)-2819 in mitochondrial 21S rRNA; not essential for viability

Gene.name: UnProceSsed
Gene.description: Mitochondrial intermembrane space protein; involved in phospholipid metabolism; has role in regulation of phospholipid metabolism by inhibiting conversion of phosphatidylethanolamine to phosphatidylcholine; null mutant has defects in mitochondrial morphology; similar to Ups1p, Ups3p and to human PRELI; UPS2 has a paralog, UPS3, that arose from the whole genome duplication
Dubious open reading frame; unlikely to encode a functional protein, based on available experimental and comparative sequence data

Gene.name: clathrin Associated Protein complex Small subunit
Gene.phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutant is defective in vacuolar protein transport and shows severe vacuolar fragmentation, decreased endocytosis and reduced competitive fitness; in diploids homozygous null mutation increases sensitivity to multiple drugs, including cordycepin, actinomycin D, hygromycin B, nigericin, triazoles
Gene.briefDescription: Small subunit of the clathrin-associated adaptor complex AP-1
Gene.description: Small subunit of the clathrin-associated adaptor complex AP-1; AP-1 is involved in protein sorting at the trans-Golgi network; homolog of the sigma subunit of the mammalian clathrin AP-1 complex
Dubious open reading frame; unlikely to encode a functional protein, based on available experimental and comparative sequence data

Gene.name: DiPHthamide
Gene.functionSummary: Diphthine synthase involved in the synthesis of peptidyl-diphthamide from peptidyl-histidine|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.briefDescription: Methyltransferase required for synthesis of diphthamide
Gene.description: Methyltransferase required for synthesis of diphthamide; diphthamide is a modified histidine residue of translation elongation factor 2 (Eft1p or Eft2p); not essential for viability; GFP-Dph5p fusion protein localizes to the cytoplasm

Gene.functionSummary: Protein whose biological role is unknown; localizes to the vacuolar membrane in a large-scale study|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.description: Putative protein of unknown function

Gene.name: Isocitrate Dehydrogenase, NADP-specific
Gene.description: Cytosolic NADP-specific isocitrate dehydrogenase; catalyzes oxidation of isocitrate to alpha-ketoglutarate; levels are elevated during growth on non-fermentable carbon sources and reduced during growth on glucose; IDP2 has a paralog, IDP3, that arose from the whole genome duplication

Gene.name: Regulatory Factor X
Gene.briefDescription: Major transcriptional repressor of DNA-damage-regulated genes
Gene.description: Major transcriptional repressor of DNA-damage-regulated genes; recruits repressors Tup1p and Cyc8p to their promoters; involved in DNA damage and replication checkpoint pathway; similar to a family of mammalian DNA binding RFX1-4 proteins

Gene.functionSummary: Protein whose biological role is unknown; localizes to the cytoplasm in a large-scale study|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.description: Putative protein of unknown function; phosphorylated by Dbf2p-Mob1p in vitro; some strains contain microsatellite polymophisms at this locus; not an essential gene; YLR177W has a paralog, PSP1, that arose from the whole genome duplication

Gene.name: cdc Twenty-Five Suppressor
Gene.briefDescription: Inhibitor of carboxypeptidase Y (Prc1p), and Ras GAP (Ira2p)
Gene.description: Inhibitor of carboxypeptidase Y (Prc1p), and Ras GAP (Ira2p); phosphatidylethanolamine-binding protein (PEBP) family member and ortholog of hPEBP1/RKIP, a natural metastasis suppressor; targets to vacuolar membranes during stationary phase; acetylated by NatB N-terminal acetyltransferase; protein abundance increases in response to DNA replication stress

Gene.functionSummary: Protein whose biological role is unknown; localizes to the cytoplasm and nucleus in different large-scale studies|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.briefDescription: Protein of unknown function with similarity to Tfs1p
Gene.description: Protein of unknown function with similarity to Tfs1p; transcription is activated by paralogous proteins Yrm1p and Yrr1p along with proteins involved in multidrug resistance; GFP-tagged protein localizes to the cytoplasm and nucleus

Gene.name: S-AdenosylMethionine requiring
Gene.description: S-adenosylmethionine synthetase; catalyzes transfer of the adenosyl group of ATP to the sulfur atom of methionine; SAM1 has a paralog, SAM2, that arose from the whole genome duplication

Gene.name: VpsTwenty Associated
Gene.description: Multivesicular body (MVB) protein; involved in endosomal protein sorting; regulates Vps4p activity by promoting its oligomerization; has an N-terminal Vps60- and Did2- binding domain, a linker region, and a C-terminal Vps4p binding domain

Gene.name: Target Of Sbf
Gene.briefDescription: Putative transcription factor, contains Forkhead Associated domain
Gene.description: Putative transcription factor, contains Forkhead Associated domain; binds chromatin; involved in expression homeostasis, buffering of mRNA synthesis rate against gene dosage changes during S phase; target of SBF transcription factor; expression is periodic and peaks in G1; involved in DNA replication checkpoint response; interacts with Rpd3 and Set3 histone deacetylase complexes; APCC(Cdh1) substrate; relative distribution to nucleus increases upon DNA replication stress
Dubious open reading frame; unlikely to encode a functional protein, based on available experimental and comparative sequence data

Gene.name: Ribosomal Protein of the Large subunit
Gene.functionSummary: Subunit of the cytosolic large ribosomal subunit; required for production of mature 60S subunits via 27SB pre-rRNA processing in C2 site of ITS2|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.description: Ribosomal 60S subunit protein L37A; required for processing of 27SB pre-rRNA and formation of stable 66S assembly intermediates; homologous to mammalian ribosomal protein L37, no bacterial homolog; RPL37A has a paralog, RPL37B, that arose from the whole genome duplication
GO.Slim: structural constituent of ribosome;structural molecule activity

Gene.name: Suppressor of lethality of Kex2 Gas1 double null mutant
Gene.functionSummary: Protein whose biological role is unknown; localizes to the cytoplasm, bud tip and bud neck in large scale studies|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.description: Protein of unknown function; green fluorescent protein (GFP)-fusion protein localizes to the cell periphery, cytoplasm, bud, and bud neck; potential Cdc28p substrate; similar to Skg4p; relocalizes from bud neck to cytoplasm upon DNA replication stress; SKG3 has a paralog, CAF120, that arose from the whole genome duplication

Gene.name: MultiDrug resistance-Like
Gene.briefDescription: Mitochondrial inner membrane half-type ABC transporter
Gene.description: Mitochondrial inner membrane half-type ABC transporter; mediates export of peptides generated upon proteolysis of mitochondrial proteins; plays a role in the regulation of cellular resistance to oxidative stress

Gene.name: AuTophaGy related
Gene.functionSummary: Sterol 3-beta-glucosyltransferase involved in ascospore-type prospore membrane assembly; localizes to the cytoplasm in a large scale study|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.description: UDP-glucose:sterol glucosyltransferase; conserved enzyme involved in synthesis of sterol glucoside membrane lipids; in contrast to ATG26 from P. pastoris, S. cerevisiae ATG26 is not involved in autophagy
GO.Slim: transferase activity;transferase activity, transferring glycosyl groups

Gene.name: Mitochondrial Myo2p Receptor-related
Gene.briefDescription: Phosphorylated protein of the mitochondrial outer membrane
Gene.description: Phosphorylated protein of the mitochondrial outer membrane; localizes only to mitochondria of the bud; interacts with Myo2p to mediate mitochondrial distribution to buds; mRNA is targeted to the bud via the transport system involving She2p

Gene.name: PEroXin
Gene.functionSummary: Subunit of the peroxisomal importomer complex involved in the docking of proteins in the peroxisomal matrix|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutant shows mislocalization of peroxisomal proteins into the cytoplasm and is unable to utilize oleic acid as a carbon source, also shows sensitivity to oleic and palmitoleic acids, and decreased replicative lifespan; in large-scale studies null mutation lowers competitive fitness
Gene.description: Peroxisomal importomer complex component; integral peroxisomal membrane protein required for docking and translocation of peroxisomal matrix proteins; interacts with the PTS1 signal recognition factor Pex5p and the PTS2 signal recognition factor Pex7p; forms a complex with Pex14p and Pex17p; human homolog PEX13 complements yeast null mutant

Gene.name: High-Copy suppressor of Rpg1
Gene.functionSummary: Subunit of translation initiation factor eIF3 involved in cytoplasmic translation initiation and small subunit rRNA processing|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutant shows delays in rRNA processing and reduction in Ty1 transposition, increased resistance to azoles and arsenite but sensitivity to caffeine, MMS, weak acids, tunicamycin; also shows decreased biofilm formation and reduced competitive fitness
Gene.briefDescription: eIF3j component of translation initiation factor 3 (eIF3)
Gene.description: eIF3j component of translation initiation factor 3 (eIF3); dual function protein involved in translation initiation as a substoichiometric component (eIF3j) of eIF3; required for 20S pre-rRNA processing; required at post-transcriptional step for efficient retrotransposition; absence decreases Ty1 Gag:GFP protein levels; binds eIF3 subunits Rpg1p, Prt1p and 18S rRNA; eIF3 also involved in programmed stop codon read through; human homolog EIF3J can complement yeast hcr1 mutant
GO.Slim: RNA binding;translation factor activity, RNA binding

Gene.name: UnProceSsed
Gene.description: Phosphatidic acid transfer protein; plays a role in phospholipid metabolism by transporting phosphatidic acid from the outer to the inner mitochondrial membrane; localizes to the mitochondrial intermembrane space; null mutant has altered cardiolipin and phosphatidic acid levels; ortholog of human PRELI

Gene.name: Novel Cell Wall protein
Gene.briefDescription: Structural constituent of the cell wall
Gene.description: Structural constituent of the cell wall; attached to the plasma membrane by a GPI-anchor; expression is upregulated in response to cell wall stress; null mutant is sensitive to the antifungal agent polyhexamethylene biguanide, resistant to zymolyase treatment and has increased chitin deposition

Gene.name: Proteasome Biogenesis-Associated
Gene.description: Protein involved in 20S proteasome assembly; forms a heterodimer with Add66p that binds to proteasome precursors; interaction with Pba1p-Add66p may affect function of the mature proteasome and its role in maintaining respiratory metabolism; similar to human PAC1 constituent of the PAC1-PAC2 complex involved in proteasome assembly

Gene.name: Yeast ortholog of mouse KE2
Gene.briefDescription: Subunit of the heterohexameric Gim/prefoldin protein complex
Gene.description: Subunit of the heterohexameric Gim/prefoldin protein complex; involved in the folding of alpha-tubulin, beta-tubulin, and actin; prefoldin complex also localizes to chromatin of actively transcribed genes in the nucleus and facilitates transcriptional elongation

Gene.name: COenzyme Q
Gene.phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutant fails to respire and exhibits sensitivity to linoleic acid; in large-scale studies, the null mutant shows reduced competitive fitness and chronological lifespan, sensitivity to desiccation, starvation, and oxidative stress, and altered resistance to various chemicals; overexpression causes reduced filamentous growth
Gene.briefDescription: Protein required for ubiquinone biosynthesis and respiratory growth
Gene.description: Protein required for ubiquinone biosynthesis and respiratory growth; localizes to matrix face of mitochondrial inner membrane in a large complex with ubiquinone biosynthetic enzymes; ubiquinone is also known as coenzyme Q; human homolog COQ9 can complement yeast coq9 null mutant

Dubious open reading frame; unlikely to encode a functional protein, based on available experimental and comparative sequence data; partially overlaps the verified ORF YLR201C; ORF contains a putative intron

Gene.name: Mitochondrial Splicing Suppressor
Gene.briefDescription: Specific translational activator for the mitochondrial COX1 mRNA
Gene.description: Specific translational activator for the mitochondrial COX1 mRNA; loosely associated with the matrix face of the mitochondrial inner membrane; localizes to vacuole membrane in response to H2O2; influences both COX1 mRNA translation and Cox1p assembly into cytochrome c oxidase; binds to heme B, which may be a mechanism for sensing oxygen levels in order to regulate cytochrome c oxidase biogenesis

Gene.name: Quasi-Renownless Information
Gene.description: Mitochondrial inner membrane protein; required for accumulation of spliced COX1 mRNA; may have an additional role in translation of COX1 mRNA

Gene.name: HeMe oXygenase
Gene.description: ER localized heme oxygenase; involved in heme degradation during iron starvation and in the oxidative stress response; expression is regulated by AFT1 and oxidative stress; relocates to the perinuclear region in the presence of oxidants

Gene.name: Epsin N-Terminal homology
Gene.functionSummary: Clathrin binding protein, that localizes to the mating projection tip; involved in actin filament organization and actin patch assembly, and endocytosis|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.briefDescription: Epsin-like protein required for endocytosis and actin patch assembly
Gene.description: Epsin-like protein required for endocytosis and actin patch assembly; functionally redundant with Ent1p; contains clathrin-binding motif at C-terminus; ENT2 has a paralog, ENT1, that arose from the whole genome duplication

Gene.name: HMG-coA Reductase Degradation
Gene.briefDescription: ER membrane protein that plays a central role in ERAD
Gene.description: ER membrane protein that plays a central role in ERAD; forms HRD complex with Hrd1p and ER-associated protein degradation (ERAD) determinants that engages in lumen to cytosol communication and coordination of ERAD events

Gene.name: purine nucleoside phosphorylase
Gene.phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutant excretes guanosine and inosine, and shows decreased autophagy under nitrogen starvation; in systematic studies null mutant displays increased sensitivity to oxidative stress and miconazole, and decreased glycogen accumulation
Gene.description: Purine nucleoside phosphorylase; specifically metabolizes inosine and guanosine nucleosides; involved in the nicotinamide riboside salvage pathway
GO.Slim: hydrolase activity;hydrolase activity, acting on glycosyl bonds;transferase activity;transferase activity, transferring glycosyl groups

Gene.name: CycLin B
Gene.functionSummary: Cyclin-dependent kinase regulatory subunit involved in the regulation of the G2/M phase transition of the mitotic cell cycle; regulates mitotic spindle assembly and spindle pole body separation; localizes to both the nucleus and cytoplasm|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.briefDescription: B-type cyclin involved in cell cycle progression
Gene.description: B-type cyclin involved in cell cycle progression; activates Cdc28p to promote the G2/M transition; may be involved in DNA replication and spindle assembly; accumulates during S phase and G2, then targeted for ubiquitin-mediated degradation; CLB4 has a paralog, CLB3, that arose from the whole genome duplication

Gene.name: AuTophaGy related
Gene.functionSummary: Subunit of the phosphatidylinositol 3-kinase complex I involved in macroautophagy; localizes to the pre-autophagosomal structure (PAS)|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.briefDescription: Homodimeric subunit of autophagy-specific PtdIns-3-kinase complex I
Gene.description: Homodimeric subunit of autophagy-specific PtdIns-3-kinase complex I; required for the integrity of the active PtdIns-3-kinase complex I by maintaining an association between Vps15p-Vps34p and Atg14p-Vps30p subcomplexes; localizes to the pre-autophagosomal structure (PAS) in an Atg14p-dependent manner; ATG38 is non-essential but is required for macroautophagy

Gene.name: CRH-Related
Gene.briefDescription: Putative glycoside hydrolase of the spore wall envelope
Gene.description: Putative glycoside hydrolase of the spore wall envelope; required for normal spore wall assembly, possibly for cross-linking between the glucan and chitosan layers; expressed during sporulation

Gene.name: Ferric REductase
