Gene.name: Lipid Droplets in Sporulation
Gene.briefDescription: Protein Involved in spore wall assembly
Gene.description: Protein Involved in spore wall assembly; localizes to lipid droplets found on or outside of the prospore membrane; shares similarity with Lds1p and Rrt8p, and a strain mutant for all 3 genes exhibits reduced dityrosine fluorescence relative to the single mutants; green fluorescent protein (GFP)-fusion protein localizes to the cytoplasm in a punctate pattern

Gene.name: Regulator of rDNA Transcription
Gene.briefDescription: Protein involved in spore wall assembly
Gene.description: Protein involved in spore wall assembly; shares similarity with Lds1p and Lds2p and a strain mutant for all 3 genes exhibits reduced dityrosine fluorescence relative to the single mutants; identified in a screen for mutants with increased levels of rDNA transcription; green fluorescent protein (GFP)-fusion protein localizes to lipid particles; protein abundance increases in response to DNA replication stress

Dubious open reading frame; unlikely to encode a functional protein, based on available experimental and comparative sequence data; overlaps verified gene GAL11; deletion confers sensitivity to 4-(N-(S-glutathionylacetyl)amino) phenylarsenoxide (GSAO)

Gene.name: GALactose metabolism
Gene.briefDescription: Subunit of the RNA polymerase II mediator complex
Gene.description: Subunit of the RNA polymerase II mediator complex; associates with core polymerase subunits to form the RNA polymerase II holoenzyme; affects transcription by acting as target of activators and repressors; forms part of the tail domain of mediator
GO.Slim: transcription factor activity, protein binding;transcription factor binding

Gene.name: SPErmidine auxotroph
Gene.functionSummary: Adenosylmethionine decarboxylase involved in pantothenate, spermine and spermidine biosynthesis; localized to the nucleus and cytoplasm in large scale studies|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.description: S-adenosylmethionine decarboxylase; required for the biosynthesis of spermidine and spermine; cells lacking Spe2p require spermine or spermidine for growth in the presence of oxygen but not when grown anaerobically

Gene.name: Altered Inheritance rate of Mitochondria
Gene.functionSummary: Protein whose biological role is unknown; localizes to the mitochondrion in a large scale study|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutant displays displays increased competitive fitness in minimal medium; null mutant has a reduced frequency of spontaneous mitochondrial genome loss; null mutant has a decreased chronological lifespan in mixed co-culture; heterozygous diploid null has decreased starvation resistance after low nutrient stress and is haploinsufficient
Gene.description: Protein of unknown function; null mutant displays elevated frequency of mitochondrial genome loss

Gene.name: Pob3/Spt16 Histone associated
Gene.briefDescription: E3 ubiquitin ligase targeting centromere-binding protein Cse4p
Gene.description: E3 ubiquitin ligase targeting centromere-binding protein Cse4p; mediates polyubiquitination and degradation of histone H3 variant Cse4p, preventing its mislocalization to euchromatin independent of Slx5p; ubiquitination of Cse4p may be antagonized by Scm3p

Gene.name: THIamine metabolism
Gene.functionSummary: A hydroxymethylpyrimidine kinase involved in the synthesis and catabolism of thiamine; localized to the cytosol|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.briefDescription: Trifunctional enzyme of thiamine biosynthesis, degradation and salvage
Gene.description: Trifunctional enzyme of thiamine biosynthesis, degradation and salvage; has hydroxymethylpyrimidine (HMP) kinase, HMP-phosphate (HMP-P) kinase and thiaminase activities; member of a gene family with THI21 and THI22; HMP and HMP-P kinase activity redundant with Thi21p

Gene.name: Glycerate PhosphoMutase
Gene.functionSummary: Protein whose biological role is unknown; localizes to the cytoplasm in a large-scale study|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.description: Homolog of Gpm1p phosphoglycerate mutase; converts 3-phosphoglycerate to 2-phosphoglycerate in glycolysis; may be non-functional; GPM3 has a paralog, GPM2, that arose from the whole genome duplication

Dipeptidyl-peptidase III; cleaves dipeptides from the amino terminus of target proteins; highly active on synthetic substrate Arg-Arg-2-naphthylamide; mammalian ortholog may be a biomarker for some cancers

Gene.name: ARGinine requiring
Gene.functionSummary: Argininosuccinate synthase involved in arginine biosynthesis; localized to the cytosol|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutant is auxotrophic for arginine and displays decreased accumulation of arginine and increased ornithine accumulation; null mutant has decreased competitive fitness in synthetic medium and is unable to use allantoin as nitrogen source; null mutant displays increased survival following a ramped heat stimulus; null mutant has decreased resistance to copper sulfate; heterozygous diploid null is haploinsufficient
Gene.description: Arginosuccinate synthetase; catalyzes the formation of L-argininosuccinate from citrulline and L-aspartate in the arginine biosynthesis pathway; potential Cdc28p substrate

Gene.name: Glycerol-3-Phosphate Dehydrogenase
Gene.description: NAD-dependent glycerol 3-phosphate dehydrogenase; expression is controlled by an oxygen-independent signaling pathway required to regulate metabolism under anoxic conditions; located in cytosol and mitochondria; constitutively active but is inactivated via phosphorylation by energy-stress responsive kinase SNF1; GPD2 has a paralog, GPD1, that arose from the whole genome duplication

Gene.briefDescription: Protein required for normal mitochondrial morphology
Gene.description: Protein required for normal mitochondrial morphology; has similarity to hemolysins

Gene.name: PhosphoRibosylpyrophosphate Synthetase
Gene.functionSummary: Subunit of a PRPP synthetase complex, which synthesizes 5-phosphoribose 1-diphosphate and is important for cell wall integrity|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.description: 5-phospho-ribosyl-1(alpha)-pyrophosphate synthetase; synthesizes PRPP, which is required for nucleotide, histidine, and tryptophan biosynthesis; one of five related enzymes, which are active as heteromultimeric complexes; forms cytoplasmic foci upon DNA replication stress

Gene.name: clathrin Adaptor Protein complex Medium chain
Gene.functionSummary: Subunit of the AP-2 adaptor complex that functions in vesicle mediated transport|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutant displays abnormal, random budding pattern and decreased sensitivity to mating pheromone; null mutants are also sensitive to cell wall perturbing drugs, such as Congo Red or caffeine, and to fluconazole, cycloheximide, tunicamycin
Gene.description: Cargo-binding mu subunit of AP-2; AP-2 is a heterotetrameric endocytic cargo-binding adaptor that facilitates uptake of membrane proteins during clathrin-mediated endocytosis; Apm4p is required for AP-2 function and localization, and binds cell wall stress receptor Mid2p; AP-2 is required for cell polarity responses to pheromone, nutritional status and cell wall damage in S. cerevisiae, and for hyphal growth in C. albicans; AP-2 complex is conserved in mammals

Gene.name: Constitutive RNR Transcription regulators
Gene.briefDescription: Protein involved in transcriptional regulation of RNR2 and RNR3
Gene.description: Protein involved in transcriptional regulation of RNR2 and RNR3; expression of the gene is induced by DNA damage and null mutations confer increased resistance to hydroxyurea; N-terminal region has a leucine repeat and a WD40 repeat

Gene.name: METhionine requiring
Gene.phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutant displays methionine auxotrophy and sensitivity to ionic stress; null mutation in homozygous diploid decreases sporulation and increases sensitivity to hygromycin B and Calcofluor White but increases resistance to caffeine, benomyl and oxidative stress
Gene.description: Bisphosphate-3'-nucleotidase; involved in salt tolerance and methionine biogenesis; dephosphorylates 3'-phosphoadenosine-5'-phosphate and 3'-phosphoadenosine-5'-phosphosulfate, intermediates of the sulfate assimilation pathway; human homolog BPNT1 complements yeast null mutant

Gene.name: INositol polyphosphate 5-Phosphatase
Gene.description: Phosphatidylinositol 4,5-bisphosphate 5-phosphatase; role in secretion; localizes to the endoplasmic reticulum via the C-terminal tail; lacks the Sac1 domain and proline-rich region found in the other 3 INP proteins

Gene.name: ReTroGrade regulation
Gene.briefDescription: Transcription factor (bHLH) involved in interorganelle communication
Gene.description: Transcription factor (bHLH) involved in interorganelle communication; contributes to communication between mitochondria, peroxisomes, and nucleus; target of Hog1p; activated in stochastic pulses of nuclear localization
GO.Slim: nucleic acid binding transcription factor activity

Gene.name: Homolog of SIR Two (SIR2)
Gene.description: NAD(+)-dependent histone deacetylase; essential subunit of the Sum1p/Rfm1p/Hst1p complex required for ORC-dependent silencing and mitotic repression; non-essential subunit of the Set3C deacetylase complex; involved in telomere maintenance; HST1 has a paralog, SIR2, that arose from the whole genome duplication

Gene.name: Nap1p and Bud neck Associated
Gene.functionSummary: Protein whose biological role is unknown; localizes to the bud neck and cytoplasm and colocalizes with ribosomes in multiple large-scale studies|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.description: Protein of unknown function; localizes to the bud neck and cytoplasm; interacts with Nap1p; may interact with ribosomes, based on co-purification experiments; potential Cdc28p substrate

Gene.name: Succinate DeHydrogenase
Gene.briefDescription: Protein required for flavinylation of Sdh1p
Gene.description: Protein required for flavinylation of Sdh1p; binds to Sdh1p and promotes FAD cofactor attachment, which is necessary for succinate dehydrogenase (SDH) complex assembly and activity; mutations in human ortholog PGL2 are associated with neuroendocrine tumors (paraganglioma)

Gene.name: Tho2/Hpr1 Phenotype
Gene.description: Nuclear pore-associated protein; component of TREX-2 complex (Sac3p-Thp1p-Sus1p-Cdc31p) involved in transcription elongation and mRNA export from the nucleus; involved in post-transcriptional tethering of active genes to the nuclear periphery and to non-nascent mRNP; contains a PAM domain implicated in protein-protein binding
Putative ABC transporter

Gene.name: Mitochondrial Distribution and Morphology
Gene.functionSummary: A subunit of the NatB complex that contributes to peptide alpha-N-acetyltransferase activity; involved in cytoskeleton organization, mitochondrion inheritance and N-terminal peptidyl-methionine acetylation|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.briefDescription: Non-catalytic subunit of the NatB N-terminal acetyltransferase
Gene.description: Non-catalytic subunit of the NatB N-terminal acetyltransferase; NatB catalyzes N-acetylation of proteins with specific N-terminal sequences; involved in mitochondrial inheritance and actin assembly
Dubious open reading frame; unlikely to encode a functional protein, based on available experimental and comparative sequence data

Gene.name: Rna EXonuclease
Gene.description: Putative RNA exonuclease; possibly involved in pre-rRNA processing and ribosome assembly

Gene.name: Inhibitory Regulator of the RAS-cAMP pathway
Gene.phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutant shows decreased innate and acquired thermotolerance, reduced glycogen accumulation and increased chitin deposition; null mutation also cause sensitivity to chemicals, including cell-wall affecting drugs (caffeine, Calcofluor White), oxidative stress factors (hydrogen peroxide) and DNA damaging agents (MMS); null mutant diploid shows decreased respiratory growth and is unable to sporulate
Gene.description: GTPase-activating protein; negatively regulates RAS by converting it from the GTP- to the GDP-bound inactive form, required for reducing cAMP levels under nutrient limiting conditions; IRA2 has a paralog, IRA1, that arose from the whole genome duplication; defects in human homolog NF1 are associated with neurofibromatosis

Gene.name: AuTophaGy related
Gene.functionSummary: Protein involved in the cytoplasm-to-vacuole targeting (CVT) pathway, ER-associated ubiquitin-dependent protein catabolic process, protein complex localization, protein processing and vesicle organization; localizes to the pre-autophagosomal structure (PAS)|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutant shows normal autophagy and pexophagy; overexpression leads to decreased filamentous growth
Gene.briefDescription: Receptor protein for the cytoplasm-to-vacuole targeting (Cvt) pathway
Gene.description: Receptor protein for the cytoplasm-to-vacuole targeting (Cvt) pathway; delivers cargo proteins aminopeptidase I (Ape1p) and alpha-mannosidase (Ams1p) to the phagophore assembly site for packaging into Cvt vesicles; interaction with Atg19p during the Cvt pathway requires phosphorylation by Hrr25p

Gene.name: AuTophaGy related
Gene.functionSummary: Component of the cytoplasm-to-vacuole targeting, CVT complex; involved in transport of alpha-mannosidase (Ams1p) to the vacuole during autophagy|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.briefDescription: Receptor protein involved in selective autophagy during starvation
Gene.description: Receptor protein involved in selective autophagy during starvation; specifically involved in the transport of cargo protein alpha-mannosidase (Ams1p); Atg19p paralog

Gene.name: PHosphate Metabolism
Gene.functionSummary: Predicted integral membrane protein whose biological role is unknown; localizes to the vacuole in a large-scale study|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.description: Protein of unknown function; expression is regulated by phosphate levels; green fluorescent protein (GFP)-fusion protein localizes to the cell periphery and vacuole; protein abundance increases in response to DNA replication stress
Dubious open reading frame; unlikely to encode a functional protein, based on available experimental and comparative sequence data; partially overlaps the dubious gene YOL085W-A

Gene.name: Alcohol DeHydrogenase
Gene.functionSummary: Alcohol dehydrogenase required for the reduction of acetaldehyde to ethanol during fermentation; also has methylglyoxal reductase activity, and is involved in NADH oxidation and the production of alcohol from amino acid breakdown via the Ehrlich pathway|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutant cells are large and show decreased fermentative growth rate, sensitivity to oxidative stress, antifungal drugs, and other chemicals
Gene.description: Alcohol dehydrogenase; fermentative isozyme active as homo- or heterotetramers; required for the reduction of acetaldehyde to ethanol, the last step in the glycolytic pathway; ADH1 has a paralog, ADH5, that arose from the whole genome duplication

Gene.name: DUB-associated Factor 1
Gene.functionSummary: Cytoplasmic ubiquitin-binding protein|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.description: Ubiquitin-binding protein of unknown function; contains one WD40 repeat in a beta-propeller fold; green fluorescent protein (GFP)-fusion protein localizes to the cytoplasm; homolog of human WDR48/UAF1, which is involved in regulating the Fanconi anemia pathway; deletion mutant is sensitive to various chemicals including phenanthroline, sanguinarine, and nordihydroguaiaretic acid

Gene.name: Multicopy suppressor of PDI1 deletion
Gene.briefDescription: Member of the protein disulfide isomerase (PDI) family
Gene.description: Member of the protein disulfide isomerase (PDI) family; exhibits chaperone activity; overexpression suppresses the lethality of a pdi1 deletion but does not complement all Pdi1p functions; undergoes oxidation by Ero1p

Gene.name: HALotolerance
Gene.briefDescription: Putative transcription factor containing a zinc finger
Gene.description: Putative transcription factor containing a zinc finger; overexpression increases salt tolerance through increased expression of the ENA1 (Na+/Li+ extrusion pump) gene while gene disruption decreases both salt tolerance and ENA1 expression; HAL9 has a paralog, TBS1, that arose from the whole genome duplication

Gene.name: MutS Homolog
Gene.phenotypeSummary: Non-essential genes; null mutant shows defects in DNA repair, mitotic and meiotic recombination, and elevated mutation frequency; overexpression increases resistance to rapamycin
Gene.briefDescription: Protein that binds to DNA mismatches
Gene.description: Protein that binds to DNA mismatches; forms heterodimers with Msh3p and Msh6p that bind to DNA mismatches to initiate the mismatch repair process; contains a Walker ATP-binding motif required for repair activity and involved in interstrand cross-link repair; Msh2p-Msh6p binds to and hydrolyzes ATP

Gene.name: SPOrulation
Gene.functionSummary: Spindle pole body protein involved in ascospore wall assembly|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.briefDescription: Component of the meiotic outer plaque of the spindle pole body
Gene.description: Component of the meiotic outer plaque of the spindle pole body; involved in modifying the meiotic outer plaque that is required prior to prospore membrane formation; SPO21 has a paralog, YSW1, that arose from the whole genome duplication

Gene.name: Yeast PQ-loop protein
Gene.functionSummary: A basic amino acid transmembrane transporter protein involved in basic amino acid transmembrane export from the vacuole that is an integral component of fungal-type vacuolar membrane|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.briefDescription: Putative vacuolar membrane transporter for cationic amino acids
Gene.description: Putative vacuolar membrane transporter for cationic amino acids; likely contributes to amino acid homeostasis by exporting cationic amino acids from the vacuole; member of the PQ-loop family, with seven transmembrane domains; similar to mammalian PQLC2 vacuolar transporter; YPQ1 has a paralog, RTC2, that arose from the whole genome duplication

Gene.name: Transfer RNA Methyltransferase
Gene.description: tRNA methyltransferase; methylates the N-1 position of guanine at position 9 in tRNAs; protein abundance increases in response to DNA replication stress; member of the SPOUT (SpoU-TrmD) methyltransferase family; human ortholog TRMT10A plays a role in the pathogenesis of microcephaly and early onset diabetes; an 18-mer originates from the TRM10 locus; genetic analysis shows the 18-mer is the translation regulator

Gene.name: Helicase in MItochondria
Gene.briefDescription: Mitochondrial inner membrane localized ATP-dependent DNA helicase
Gene.description: Mitochondrial inner membrane localized ATP-dependent DNA helicase; required for the maintenance of the mitochondrial genome; not required for mitochondrial transcription; has homology to E. coli helicase uvrD

Gene.name: COenzyme Q
Gene.description: O-methyltransferase; catalyzes two different O-methylation steps in ubiquinone (Coenzyme Q) biosynthesis; component of a mitochondrial ubiquinone-synthesizing complex; phosphoprotein

Gene.name: Suppressor of Degenerative Death
Gene.functionSummary: Protein whose biological role is unknown; localizes to the cytoplasm in a large-scale study|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.description: Putative metalloprotease; overproduction suppresses lethality due to expression of the dominant PET9 allele AAC2-A128P

Dubious open reading frame; unlikely to encode a functional protein, based on available experimental and comparative sequence data; partially overlaps verified gene PKH2/YOL100W; may interact with ribosomes

Gene.name: Pkb-activating Kinase Homolog
Gene.phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutant shows increased innate thermotolerance, chronological and replicative lifespan, and competitive fitness; homozygous null mutation in diploid decreases sporulation
Gene.description: Serine/threonine protein kinase; involved in sphingolipid-mediated signaling pathway that controls endocytosis; activates Ypk1p and Ykr2p, components of signaling cascade required for maintenance of cell wall integrity; redundant with Pkh1p; PKH2 has a paralog, PKH1, that arose from the whole genome duplication

Gene.name: Implicated in Zinc Homeostasis
Gene.briefDescription: Membrane protein involved in zinc ion homeostasis
Gene.description: Membrane protein involved in zinc ion homeostasis; member of the four-protein IZH family; expression induced by fatty acids and altered zinc levels; deletion reduces sensitivity to excess zinc; possible role in sterol metabolism; protein increases in abundance and relocalizes from nucleus to ER upon DNA replication stress; IZH4 has a paralog, IZH1, that arose from the whole genome duplication

Gene.name: myo-Inositol TRansporter
Gene.description: Myo-inositol transporter; member of the sugar transporter superfamily; expressed constitutively; ITR2 has a paralog, ITR1, that arose from the whole genome duplication

Gene.name: NonDisJunction
Gene.briefDescription: Protein that regulates meiotic SPB cohesion and telomere clustering
Gene.description: Protein that regulates meiotic SPB cohesion and telomere clustering; localizes to both spindle pole bodies (SPBs) and telomeres; required for bouquet formation, effective homolog pairing, ordered cross-over distribution, sister chromatid cohesion at meiotic telomeres, chromosomal segregation and telomere-led rapid prophase movement

Gene.name: cell Wall integrity and Stress response Component
Gene.briefDescription: Sensor-transducer of the stress-activated PKC1-MPK1 signaling pathway
Gene.description: Sensor-transducer of the stress-activated PKC1-MPK1 signaling pathway; involved in maintenance of cell wall integrity; involved in response to heat shock and other stressors; regulates 1,3-beta-glucan synthesis; WSC3 has a paralog, WSC2, that arose from the whole genome duplication
Dubious open reading frame; unlikely to encode a functional protein, based on available experimental and comparative sequence data

Gene.functionSummary: Protein whose biological role is unknown; localizes to golgi apparatus in a large scale study|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.description: Putative protein of unknown function; green fluorescent protein (GFP)-fusion protein localizes to the cytoplasm and colocalizes in a punctate pattern with the early golgi/COPI vesicles; YOL107W is not an essential protein

Gene.name: INOsitol requiring
Gene.functionSummary: Component of sequence specific DNA-binding heteromeric transcription factor Ino2/Ino4p that activates transcription of genes involved in phospholipid metabolism|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutant shows inositol auxotrophy and reduced synthesis of phosphatidylcholine
Gene.briefDescription: Transcription factor involved in phospholipid synthesis
Gene.description: Transcription factor involved in phospholipid synthesis; required for derepression of inositol-choline-regulated genes involved in phospholipid synthesis; forms a complex, with Ino2p, that binds the inositol-choline-responsive element through a basic helix-loop-helix domain
GO.Slim: DNA binding;nucleic acid binding transcription factor activity

Gene.name: ZEOcin resistance
Gene.phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutants have long telomeres, are sensitive to thymol, palmitoleic acid, resistant to manganese, auxotrophic for myo-inositol; null mutants show increased competitive fitness in minimal medium but decreased competitive fitness and survival in other conditions; overexpression confers slow growth; heterozygous diploid nulls are haploinsufficient, have increased chromosome stability
Gene.briefDescription: Peripheral membrane protein of the plasma membrane
Gene.description: Peripheral membrane protein of the plasma membrane; interacts with Mid2p; regulates the cell integrity pathway mediated by Pkc1p and Slt2p; the authentic protein is detected in a phosphorylated state in highly purified mitochondria

Gene.name: Suppressor of Hyperactive Ras
Gene.description: Palmitoyltransferase subunit; this complex adds a palmitoyl lipid moiety to heterolipidated substrates such as Ras1p and Ras2p through a thioester linkage; palmitoylation is required for Ras2p membrane localization; Palmitoyltransferase is composed of Shr5p and Erf2

Gene.name: Mating-Deficient Yeast
Gene.briefDescription: Protein involved in inserting tail-anchored proteins into ER membranes
Gene.description: Protein involved in inserting tail-anchored proteins into ER membranes; forms a complex with Get4p; required for efficient mating; involved in shmoo formation and nuclear migration in the pre-zygote; associates with ribosomes

Gene.name: Multicopy Suppression of a Budding defect
Gene.phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutant has lower innate thermotolerance; overexpression causes slow growth, defects in actin cytoskeleton and abnormalities in G2 phase of the cell cycle
Gene.briefDescription: GTPase-activating protein of the Ras superfamily
Gene.description: GTPase-activating protein of the Ras superfamily; acts primarily on Sec4p, localizes to the bud site and bud tip; msb3 msb4 double mutation causes defects in secretion and actin organization; similar to the TBC-domain Tre2 oncogene; MSB4 has a paralog, MSB3, that arose from the whole genome duplication; human homolog USP6NL can complement yeast msb3 msb4 double null mutant

Gene.name: STE20/PAK homologous Kinase related to Morphogenesis
Gene.functionSummary: Predicted serine/threonine kinase similar to Ste20p and Cla4p; involved in negative regulation of sterol import by negative regulation of transcription from RNA PolII promoter, also involved in cell separation after cytokinesis; localizes to the nucleus and plasma membrane|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.briefDescription: Member of the PAK family of serine/threonine protein kinases
Gene.description: Member of the PAK family of serine/threonine protein kinases; similar to Ste20p; involved in down-regulation of sterol uptake; proposed to be a downstream effector of Cdc42p during polarized growth; SKM1 has a paralog, CLA4, that arose from the whole genome duplication

Gene.name: peptidyl tRNA hydrolase 4
Gene.functionSummary: Aminoacyl-tRNA hydrolase involved in mitochondrial translation; localizes to mitochondrial large ribosomal subunit|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.briefDescription: Protein similar to the human peptidyl-tRNA hydrolase gene ICT1
Gene.description: Protein similar to the human peptidyl-tRNA hydrolase gene ICT1; associates with mitochondrial large subunit; may function in translation termination; YOL114C is not an essential gene

Gene.name: Poly(A) Polymerase
Gene.description: Non-canonical poly(A) polymerase; involved in nuclear RNA degradation as a component of TRAMP; catalyzes polyadenylation of hypomodified tRNAs, and snoRNA and rRNA precursors; required for mRNA surveillance and maintenance of genome integrity, serving as a link between RNA and DNA metabolism; overlapping but non-redundant functions with Trf5p; relocalizes to cytosol in response to hypoxia
GO.Slim: ATPase activity;RNA binding;helicase activity;hydrolase activity;lyase activity;mRNA binding;nucleotidyltransferase activity;transferase activity

Gene.name: Multicopy suppressor of SNF1 mutation
Gene.description: Transcriptional activator; involved in regulation of invertase and glucoamylase expression, invasive growth and pseudohyphal differentiation, iron uptake, chromium accumulation, and response to osmotic stress; localizes to the nucleus; relative distribution to the nucleus increases upon DNA replication stress

Gene.briefDescription: Subunit of the COP9 signalosome (CSN) complex
Gene.description: Subunit of the COP9 signalosome (CSN) complex; this complex cleaves the ubiquitin-like protein Nedd8 from SCF ubiquitin ligases; plays a role in the mating pheromone response
Dubious open reading frame; unlikely to encode a functional protein, based on available experimental and comparative sequence data

Gene.name: MonoCarboxylate transporter Homologue
Gene.briefDescription: Protein with similarity to mammalian monocarboxylate permeases
Gene.description: Protein with similarity to mammalian monocarboxylate permeases; monocarboxylate permeases are involved in transport of monocarboxylic acids across the plasma membrane but mutant is not deficient in monocarboxylate transport

Gene.name: Ribosomal Protein of the Small subunit
Gene.functionSummary: Subunit of the cytosolic small ribosomal subunit; involved in nuclear export of rRNA and assembly of the small ribosomal subunit|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.briefDescription: Protein component of the small (40S) ribosomal subunit
Gene.description: Protein component of the small (40S) ribosomal subunit; required for assembly and maturation of pre-40 S particles; homologous to mammalian ribosomal protein S19, no bacterial homolog; mutations in human RPS19 are associated with Diamond Blackfan anemia; RPS19A has a paralog, RPS19B, that arose from the whole genome duplication
GO.Slim: structural constituent of ribosome;structural molecule activity

Gene.name: Suppressor of Mitochondria import Function
Gene.description: Divalent metal ion transporter; broad specificity for di-valent and tri-valent metals; post-translationally regulated by levels of metal ions; member of the Nramp family of metal transport proteins

Gene.name: TRna Methyltransferase
Gene.briefDescription: Catalytic subunit of adoMet-dependent tRNA methyltransferase complex
Gene.description: Catalytic subunit of adoMet-dependent tRNA methyltransferase complex; required for the methylation of the guanosine nucleotide at position 10 (m2G10) in tRNAs; contains a THUMP domain and a methyltransferase domain; another complex member is Trm112p

Gene.name: Malate DeHydrogenase
Gene.description: Cytoplasmic malate dehydrogenase; one of three isozymes that catalyze interconversion of malate and oxaloacetate; involved in the glyoxylate cycle and gluconeogenesis during growth on two-carbon compounds; interacts with Pck1p and Fbp1

Gene.name: Yeast homolog of Glycogen synthase Kinase
Gene.briefDescription: Protein kinase related to mammalian GSK-3 glycogen synthase kinases
Gene.description: Protein kinase related to mammalian GSK-3 glycogen synthase kinases; GSK-3 homologs (Mck1p, Rim11p, Mrk1p, Ygk3p) are involved in control of Msn2p-dependent transcription of stress responsive genes and in protein degradation; YGK3 has a paralog, MCK1, that arose from the whole genome duplication

Gene.name: Vacuolar Protein Sorting
Gene.briefDescription: Vacuolar membrane protein of unknown function
Gene.description: Vacuolar membrane protein of unknown function; involved in vacuolar protein sorting; also detected in the mitochondria

Gene.functionSummary: Protein whose biological role and cellular location are unknown|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.description: Putative protein of unknown function; YOL131W has a paralog, STB1, that arose from the whole genome duplication

Gene.name: Glycophospholipid-Anchored Surface protein
Gene.description: 1,3-beta-glucanosyltransferase; involved with Gas2p in spore wall assembly; has similarity to Gas1p; localizes to the cell wall

Gene.name: 6-PhosphoFructo-2-Kinase
Gene.description: 6-phosphofructo-2-kinase; catalyzes synthesis of fructose-2,6-bisphosphate; inhibited by phosphoenolpyruvate and sn-glycerol 3-phosphate, expression induced by glucose and sucrose, transcriptional regulation involves protein kinase A

Gene.name: Bypass of Stop Codon
Gene.functionSummary: Protein whose biological role; localizes to clathrin coated vesicles in high-throughput studies|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.briefDescription: Protein of unknown function with 8 putative transmembrane segments
Gene.description: Protein of unknown function with 8 putative transmembrane segments; ORF exhibits genomic organization compatible with a translational readthrough-dependent mode of expression

Gene.name: Restriction of Telomere Capping
Gene.functionSummary: Component of the Seh1-associated complex that associates with the vacuolar membrane; involved in positive regulation of TOR signaling; also found to colocalize with the ribosome in a large scale study|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.briefDescription: Subunit of SEACAT, a subcomplex of the SEA complex
Gene.description: Subunit of SEACAT, a subcomplex of the SEA complex; Rtc1p, along with Mtc5p and Sea4p, redundantly inhibit the TORC1 inhibitory role of the Iml1p/SEACIT (Iml1p-Npr2p-Npr3p) subcomplex, a GAP for GTPase Gtr1p (EGOC subunit) in response to amino acid limitation, thereby resulting in activation of TORC1 signaling; SEA is a coatomer-related complex that associates dynamically with the vacuole; has N-terminal WD-40 repeats and a C-terminal RING motif; null suppresses cdc13-1

Gene.name: Protein Phosphatase Methyltransferase
Gene.description: AdoMet-dependent tRNA methyltransferase; also involved in methoxycarbonylation; required for the synthesis of wybutosine (yW), a modified guanosine found at the 3'-position adjacent to the anticodon of phe-tRNA; similarity to Ppm1p

Gene.name: PEroXin
Gene.briefDescription: Peroxisomal protein required for medium-chain fatty acid oxidation
Gene.description: Peroxisomal protein required for medium-chain fatty acid oxidation; also required for peroxisome proliferation, possibly by inducing membrane curvature; localization regulated by phosphorylation; transcription regulated by Adr1p and Pip2p-Oaf1p

Gene.name: SuPpressor of Ty
Gene.briefDescription: Subunit of the SAGA transcriptional regulatory complex
Gene.description: Subunit of the SAGA transcriptional regulatory complex; involved in maintaining the integrity of the complex; mutant displays reduced transcription elongation in the G-less-based run-on (GLRO) assay
Dubious open reading frame; unlikely to encode a functional protein, based on available experimental and comparative sequence data

Gene.name: Genes de Respuesta a Estres (stress responsive genes)
Gene.description: 3-methylbutanal reductase and NADPH-dependent methylglyoxal reductase; stress induced (osmotic, ionic, oxidative, heat shock and heavy metals); regulated by the HOG pathway; restores resistance to glycolaldehyde by coupling reduction of glycolaldehyde to ethylene glycol and oxidation of NADPH to NADP+; protein abundance increases in response to DNA replication stress; methylglyoxal reductase (NADPH-dependent) is also known as D-lactaldehyde dehydrogenase

Gene.name: Ferric REductase
Gene.briefDescription: Putative ferric reductase with similarity to Fre2p
Gene.description: Putative ferric reductase with similarity to Fre2p; expression induced by low copper levels

Gene.briefDescription: Blocked reading frame, contains two in-frame stops in translation
Gene.description: Blocked reading frame, contains two in-frame stops in translation; this ORF is conserved, without the stops, in Saccharomyces paradoxus, S. mikatae, and S. bayanus; RNA sequencing data indicate the presence of a transcription unit at this reading frame

Gene.name: Haze Protective Factor
Gene.description: Haze-protective mannoprotein; reduces the particle size of aggregated proteins in white wines
GO.Slim: hydrolase activity;hydrolase activity, acting on glycosyl bonds

Gene.name: ENteroBactin
Gene.description: Endosomal ferric enterobactin transporter; expressed under conditions of iron deprivation; member of the major facilitator superfamily; expression is regulated by Rcs1p and affected by chloroquine treatment

Gene.name: Condition Specific Secretion
Gene.functionSummary: Protein whose biological role is unknown; localizes to both the cell periphery and extracellular region|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.briefDescription: Protein of unknown function, secreted when constitutively expressed
Gene.description: Protein of unknown function, secreted when constitutively expressed; SWAT-GFP, seamless-GFP and mCherry fusion proteins localize to the cell periphery, SWAT-GFP fusion also localizes to the extracellular region, and mCherry fusion also localizes to the vacuole; deletion mutants are viable and have elevated levels of Ty1 retrotransposition and Ty1 cDNA
Dubious open reading frame; unlikely to encode a functional protein, based on available experimental and comparative sequence data
Putative protein of unknown function; member of the Dal5p subfamily of the major facilitator family
Putative protein of unknown function; member of the Dal5p subfamily of the major facilitator family

Gene.name: Ribosomal RNA Processing
Gene.phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutant accumulates incompletely processed mRNA, rRNA, snRNA, snoRNA species, and shows decreased exponential growth rate, increased sensitivity to elevated temperature and 5-fluorouracil; in systematic studies null mutants shows reduced competitive fitness and altered sensitivity to chemicals
Gene.description: Nuclear exosome exonuclease component; has 3'-5' exonuclease activity that is regulated by Lrp1p; involved in RNA processing, maturation, surveillance, degradation, tethering, and export; role in sn/snoRNAs precursor degradation; forms a stable heterodimer with Lrp1p; has similarity to E. coli RNase D and to human PM-Sc1 100 (EXOSC10); mutant displays reduced transcription elongation in the G-less-based

Gene.name: Asparagine-Linked Glycosylation
Gene.phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutant has more than twice the wild-type levels of chitin, shows heat-sensitive respiratory growth, has elevated frequency of mitotic chromosome loss, and is sensitive to HU and nocodazole; in large-scale studies, the null mutant requires myo-inositol, displays rounded cell shape and decreased competitive fitness, and has altered sensitivity to a variety of chemicals
Gene.description: Alpha 1,3 glucosyltransferase; involved in transfer of oligosaccharides from dolichyl pyrophosphate to asparagine residues of proteins during N-linked protein glycosylation; C998T transition in human ortholog ALG6 causes carbohydrate-deficient glycoprotein syndrome type-Ic; wild-type human ortholog ALG6 can partially complement yeast alg6 mutant
GO.Slim: transferase activity;transferase activity, transferring glycosyl groups

Gene.name: Yeast Subtilisin-like Protease III
Gene.briefDescription: Putative precursor of the subtilisin-like protease III
Gene.description: Putative precursor of the subtilisin-like protease III; SWAT-GFP and mCherry fusion proteins localize to the endoplasmic reticulum; YSP3 has a paralog, PRB1, that arose from the whole genome duplication

Gene.name: DNA Ligase
Gene.briefDescription: DNA ligase required for nonhomologous end-joining (NHEJ)
Gene.description: DNA ligase required for nonhomologous end-joining (NHEJ); forms stable heterodimer with required cofactor Lif1p, interacts with Nej1p; involved in meiosis, not essential for vegetative growth; mutations in human ortholog lead to ligase IV syndrome and Dubowitz syndrome

Gene.name: Twenty S rRNA accumulation
Gene.description: Protein required for 20S pre-rRNA processing; involved in processing of the 20S pre-rRNA at site D to generate mature 18S rRNA; green fluorescent protein (GFP)-fusion protein localizes to both the cytoplasm and the nucleus; relative distribution to the nucleus increases upon DNA replication stress

Gene.name: Small Glutamine-rich Tetratricopeptide repeat-containing protein
Gene.description: Glutamine-rich cytoplasmic cochaperone; serves as a scaffold bringing together Get4, Get5p, and other TRC complex members that are required to mediate posttranslational insertion of tail-anchored proteins into the ER membrane; interacts with the prion domain of Sup35p; amyloid sensor; plays a role in targeting chaperones to prion aggregates; similar to human cochaperone SGT; forms cytoplasmic foci upon DNA replication stress

Gene.name: Synthetic Lethal with Gap
Gene.briefDescription: Sensor-transducer of the stress-activated PKC1-MPK1 kinase pathway
Gene.description: Sensor-transducer of the stress-activated PKC1-MPK1 kinase pathway; involved in maintenance of cell wall integrity; required for mitophagy; involved in organization of the actin cytoskeleton; secretory pathway Wsc1p is required for the arrest of secretion response

Gene.functionSummary: Protein whose biological role and cellular location are unknown|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.description: Putative protein of unknown function; includes a potential transmembrane domain; deletion results in slightly lengthened telomeres; SWAT-GFP and mCherry fusion proteins localize to the endoplasmic reticulum and vacuole respectively

Gene.name: TIp1-Related
Gene.functionSummary: Protein whose biological role is unknown; localizes to the cell wall|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.description: Cell wall mannoprotein; expressed under anaerobic conditions and required for anaerobic growth; transcription is also induced by cold shock; member of the Srp1p/Tip1p family of serine-alanine-rich proteins

Gene.name: TIp1-Related
Gene.description: Putative cell wall mannoprotein; member of the Srp1p/Tip1p family of serine-alanine-rich proteins; transcription is induced by cold shock and anaerobiosis; TIR2 has a paralog, TIR3, that arose from the whole genome duplication

Gene.name: ABC protein involved in Uptake of Sterols
Gene.briefDescription: Plasma membrane sterol transporter of the ATP-binding cassette family
Gene.description: Plasma membrane sterol transporter of the ATP-binding cassette family; required, along with Pdr11p, for uptake of exogenous sterols and their incorporation into the plasma membrane; activity is stimulated by phosphatidylserine; sterol uptake is required for anaerobic growth because sterol biosynthesis requires oxygen; AUS1 has a paralog, PDR11, that arose from the whole genome duplication

Gene.functionSummary: Protein whose biological role and cellular location are unknown|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.description: Putative protein of unknown function

Gene.name: Increased Recombination Centers
Gene.description: Dubious open reading frame; unlikely to encode a functional protein, based on available experimental and comparative sequence data; partially overlaps the uncharacterized gene YOR012C; null mutant displays increased levels of spontaneous Rad52 foci

Gene.name: Rox Three Suppressor
Gene.phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutant is sensitive to elevated temperatures and accumulates glycogen and glutathione; in systematic studies null mutants show slow growth, lower competitive fitness, decreased chronological lifespan and increased sensitivity to hyperosmotic stress, bleomycin, cycloheximide, MMS, hygromycin B, ethanol, fluconazole, but increased resistance to tunicamycin, mycophenolic acid, acetic acid
Gene.briefDescription: B-type regulatory subunit of protein phosphatase 2A (PP2A)
Gene.description: B-type regulatory subunit of protein phosphatase 2A (PP2A); Rts1p and Cdc55p are alternative regulatory subunits for PP2A catalytic subunits, Pph21p and Pph22p; PP2A-Rts1p protects cohesin when recruited by Sgo1p to the pericentromere; highly enriched at centromeres in the absence of Cdc55p; required for maintenance of septin ring organization during cytokinesis, for ring disassembly in G1 and for dephosphorylation of septin, Shs1p; homolog of the mammalian B' subunit of PP2A
Dubious open reading frame; unlikely to encode a functional protein, based on available experimental and comparative sequence data

Gene.name: Emp24p/Erv25p Related Protein
Gene.phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutant displays decreased endocytosis
Gene.briefDescription: Member of the p24 family involved in ER to Golgi transport
Gene.description: Member of the p24 family involved in ER to Golgi transport; similar to Emp24p and Erv25p; ERP4 has a paralog, ERP2, that arose from the whole genome duplication

Gene.name: PETite colonies
Gene.briefDescription: Protein with a role in 5'-end processing of mitochondrial RNAs
Gene.description: Protein with a role in 5'-end processing of mitochondrial RNAs; located in the mitochondrial membrane

Gene.name: Resistance to O-Dinitrobenzene
Gene.description: Alpha-arrestin involved in ubiquitin-dependent endocytosis; activating dephosphorylation relays glucose signaling to transporter endocytosis; calcineurin dephosphorylation is required for Rsp5p-dependent internalization of agonist-occupied Ste2p, as part of signal desensitization; recruits Rsp5p to Ste2p via its 2 PPXY motifs; protein abundance increases in response to DNA replication stress; ROD1 has a paralog, ROG3, that arose from the whole genome duplication

Gene.name: Spout Family Methyltransferase 1
Gene.functionSummary: Omega-N monomethyltransferase that methylates arginine residues of proteins; biological role and cellular location are unknown|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.description: SPOUT methyltransferase; catalyzes omega-monomethylation of Rps3p on Arg-146; not an essential gene; predicted to be involved in rRNA processing and ribosome biogenesis and in biopolymer catabolism

Gene.name: DDHD Domain-containing Lipase
Gene.description: DDHD domain-containing phospholipase; hydrolyzes cardiolipin, phosphatidylethanolamine, and phosphatidylglycerol; implicated in remodeling of mitochondrial phospholipids; antagonistically regulated by Aft1p and Aft2p transcription factors; in humans, mutations in DDHD1 and DDHD2 genes cause specific types of hereditary spastic paraplegia, while DDL1-defective yeast have similar phenotypes such as mitochondrial dysfunction and defects in lipid metabolism

Gene.name: Ada Histone acetyltransferase complex Component
Gene.phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; homozygous diploid null mutant has an elevated level of homologous recombination and increased formation of spontaneous Rad52p loci; null mutant has increased chronological lifespan, and displays a reduction in apoptosis after a ramped heat stimulus; null mutant has a decreased rate of proline utilization; null mutant displays decreased localization of Boi2 to the bud neck, indicative of a requirement for NoCut function in cells with an anaphase defect; heterozygous null mutant is haploinsufficient; overexpression results in a decreased rate of vegetative growth
Gene.briefDescription: Subunit of the Ada histone acetyltransferase complex
Gene.description: Subunit of the Ada histone acetyltransferase complex; required for structural integrity of the complex
Dubious open reading frame; unlikely to encode a functional protein, based on available experimental and comparative sequence data

Gene.name: Homolog of SIR Two (SIR2)
Gene.briefDescription: Member of the Sir2 family of NAD(+)-dependent protein deacetylases
Gene.description: Member of the Sir2 family of NAD(+)-dependent protein deacetylases; involved along with Hst4p in telomeric silencing, cell cycle progression, radiation resistance, genomic stability and short-chain fatty acid metabolism

Gene.name: STress Inducible
Gene.description: Hsp90 cochaperone; regulates spatial organization of amyloid-like proteins in the cytosol, thereby buffering the proteotoxicity caused by amyloid-like proteins; interacts with the Ssa group of the cytosolic Hsp70 chaperones and activates Ssa1p ATPase activity; interacts with Hsp90 chaperones and inhibits their ATPase activity; homolog of mammalian Hop

Gene.name: Chromosome INstability
Gene.briefDescription: Basic leucine zipper (bZIP) transcription factor of the yAP-1 family
Gene.description: Basic leucine zipper (bZIP) transcription factor of the yAP-1 family; physically interacts with the Tup1-Cyc8 complex and recruits Tup1p to its targets; mediates pleiotropic drug resistance and salt tolerance; nuclearly localized under oxidative stress and sequestered in the cytoplasm by Lot6p under reducing conditions; CIN5 has a paralog, YAP6, that arose from the whole genome duplication
Dubious open reading frame; unlikely to encode a functional protein, based on available experimental and comparative sequence data

Gene.name: Defective for Filamentous Growth
Gene.description: Probable multiple transmembrane protein; involved in diploid invasive and pseudohyphal growth upon nitrogen starvation; is glycosylated and phosphorylated; interacts with Rim21p and Rim9p in the plasma membrane to form a pH-sensing complex in the Rim101 pathway and is required to maintain Rim21p levels; required for accumulation of processed Rim101p

Gene.name: Copper-Resistant Suppressor
Gene.description: Copper-binding metallothionein; required for wild-type copper resistance

Gene.name: High-copy Mep Suppressor
Gene.briefDescription: bHLH protein with similarity to myc-family transcription factors
Gene.description: bHLH protein with similarity to myc-family transcription factors; overexpression confers hyperfilamentous growth and suppresses the pseudohyphal filamentation defect of a diploid mep1 mep2 homozygous null mutant
GO.Slim: nucleic acid binding transcription factor activity

Gene.name: EXOnuclease
Gene.phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutant is sensitive to MMS and phleomycin; sumoylation of Rad52p and Rfa1p in response to DNA damage is reduced in the null mutant and increased in an activated mutant; in large-scale studies the null mutant displays decreased cell size and altered resistance to various chemicals
Gene.description: 5'-3' exonuclease and flap-endonuclease; involved in recombination, double-strand break repair, MMS2 error-free branch of the post replication (PRR) pathway and DNA mismatch repair; role in telomere maintenance; member of the Rad2p nuclease family, with conserved N and I nuclease domains; relative distribution to the nucleus increases upon DNA replication stress; EXO1 has a paralog, DIN7, that arose from the whole genome duplication

Gene.name: AnKyrin Repeat-containing protein
Gene.phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; overexpression leads to increased resistance to phytosphingosine; null mutant shows increased competitive fitness, increased sensitivity to cycloheximide and mycophenolic acid, and increased resistance to fenpropimorph; in a large-scale survey overexpression causes slow growth
Gene.description: Ankyrin repeat-containing protein; member of a family of putative palmitoyltransferases containing an Asp-His-His-Cys-cysteine rich (DHHC-CRD) domain; possibly involved in constitutive endocytosis of Ste3p; AKR2 has a paralog, AKR1, that arose from the whole genome duplication

Gene.name: Swi5p-dependent HO Expression
Gene.description: Protein containing a UCS (UNC-45/CRO1/SHE4) domain; binds to myosin motor domains to regulate myosin function; involved in endocytosis, polarization of the actin cytoskeleton, and asymmetric mRNA localization

Gene.name: carboxyPEPtidase Y-deficient
Gene.phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene in strain S288C, essential in strain Sigma1278b; null mutant accumulates cytoplasmic vesicles and stacked endosomal intermediate structures, and fails to undergo autophagy; null and point mutants secrete carboxypeptidase Y instead of properly targeting it to the vacuole; in large-scale studies, null mutant displays reduced competitive fitness under a variety of conditions, defective respiration and sporulation, and altered resistance to many chemicals
Gene.description: Target membrane receptor (t-SNARE); for vesicular intermediates traveling between the Golgi apparatus and the vacuole; controls entry of biosynthetic, endocytic, and retrograde traffic into the prevacuolar compartment; syntaxin

Gene.name: CYtochrome C
Gene.description: Mitochondrial peripheral inner membrane protein; contains a FAD cofactor in a domain exposed in the intermembrane space; exhibits redox activity in vitro; likely participates in ligation of heme to acytochromes c and c1 (Cyc1p and Cyt1p)

Gene.name: HIstone Regulation
Gene.functionSummary: Transcriptional corepressor that is part of the HIR complex; negatively regulates transcription of HTA1 and HTB1; localized to the nucleus and cytosol|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.briefDescription: Subunit of HIR nucleosome assembly complex
Gene.description: Subunit of HIR nucleosome assembly complex; involved in regulation of histone gene transcription; recruits Swi-Snf complexes to histone gene promoters; promotes heterochromatic gene silencing with Asf1p; relocalizes to the cytosol in response to hypoxia
GO.Slim: DNA binding;chromatin binding;transcription factor activity, protein binding

Gene.name: Casein Kinase Beta' subunit
Gene.briefDescription: Beta' regulatory subunit of casein kinase 2 (CK2)
Gene.description: Beta' regulatory subunit of casein kinase 2 (CK2); a Ser/Thr protein kinase with roles in cell growth and proliferation; CK2, comprised of CKA1, CKA2, CKB1 and CKB2, has many substrates including transcription factors and all RNA polymerase

Gene.name: GLyOxalase
Gene.description: Mitochondrial glyoxalase II; catalyzes the hydrolysis of S-D-lactoylglutathione into glutathione and D-lactate; GLO4 has a paralog, GLO2, that arose from the whole genome duplication

Dubious open reading frame; unlikely to encode a functional protein, based on available experimental and comparative sequence data; not conserved in closely related Saccharomyces species; 85% of ORF overlaps the uncharacterized gene CUE5; deletion in cyr1 mutant results in loss of stress resistance

Gene.name: Coupling of Ubiquitin conjugation to ER degradation
Gene.functionSummary: Ubiquitin binding protein involved in ubiquitin-dependent protein catabolic processes; acts as an Atg8p-ubiquitin adaptor during nitrogen starvation response|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutant accumulates ubiquitin conjugates and shows increased resistance to sirolimus (rapamycin), decreased resistance to bleomycin, camptothecin and tunicamycin
Gene.description: Ubiquitin-binding protein; functions as ubiquitin-Atg8p adaptor in ubiquitin-dependent autophagy; contains CUE domain that binds ubiquitin, which may facilitate intramolecular monoubiquitination; GFP-fusion protein localizes to cytoplasm in punctate pattern; CUE5 has a paralog, DON1, that arose from the whole genome duplication; human TOLLIP is a functional CUE-domain homolog, can complement yeast null mutant, rescuing hypersensitivity of cue5 null mutant cells to Htt-96Q

Gene.name: WHIskey
Gene.briefDescription: Protein required for full activation of the general stress response
Gene.description: Protein required for full activation of the general stress response; required with binding partner Psr1p, possibly through Msn2p dephosphorylation; regulates growth during the diauxic shift; negative regulator of G1 cyclin expression; SWAT-GFP, seamless-GFP and mCherry fusion proteins localize to the cell periphery

Gene.name: Increased Recombination Centers
Gene.functionSummary: Protein whose biological role is unknown; localizes to the endoplasmic reticulum in a large-scale study|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.description: Protein of unknown function; green fluorescent protein (GFP)-fusion localizes to the ER; null mutant displays increased levels of spontaneous Rad52p foci; IRC23 has a paralog, BSC2, that arose from the whole genome duplication

Gene.name: Translocase of the Outer Mitochondrial membrane
Gene.briefDescription: Component of the TOM (translocase of outer membrane) complex
Gene.description: Component of the TOM (translocase of outer membrane) complex; responsible for recognition and initial import steps for all mitochondrially directed proteins; promotes assembly and stability of the TOM complex

Gene.name: Suppressor of Tbp Deletion
Gene.briefDescription: Protein involved in control of glucose-regulated gene expression
Gene.description: Protein involved in control of glucose-regulated gene expression; interacts with kinase Snf1p, glucose sensors Snf3p and Rgt2p, TATA-binding Spt15p; regulator of transcription factor Rgt1p; interactions with Pma1p appear to propagate [GAR+]; STD1 has a paralog, MTH1, that arose from the whole genome duplication

Gene.name: Resistance to Sphingoid long-chain Base
Gene.briefDescription: Suppressor of sphingoid LCB sensitivity of an LCB-lyase mutation
Gene.description: Suppressor of sphingoid LCB sensitivity of an LCB-lyase mutation; putative integral membrane transporter or flippase that may transport long chain bases (LCBs) from the cytoplasmic side toward the extracytoplasmic side of the membrane
Dubious open reading frame; unlikely to encode a functional protein, based on available experimental and comparative sequence data; null mutant is viable

Gene.name: Enhancer of Translation Termination 1
Gene.briefDescription: Nuclear protein that inhibits replication of Brome mosaic virus
Gene.description: Nuclear protein that inhibits replication of Brome mosaic virus; S. cerevisiae is a model system for studying replication of positive-strand RNA viruses in their natural hosts; deletion increases stop codon readthrough

Gene.name: Trivalent Metalloid sensitive, Cuz1-related protein
Gene.briefDescription: AN1-type zinc finger protein of unknown function
Gene.description: AN1-type zinc finger protein of unknown function; may protect cells from trivalent metalloid induced proteotoxicity; contains a PACE promoter element, a transcriptional profile similar to CUZ1 and RPN2, and decreased expression in an RPN4 mutant; induced by nitrogen limitation and weak acid; ortholog of human AIRAP, which stimulates proteasome activity in response to arsenic; protein abundance increases in response to DNA replication stress
Dubious open reading frame; unlikely to encode a functional protein, based on available experimental and comparative sequence data; partially overlaps the verified gene VHS3/YOR054C

Gene.name: Viable in a Hal3 Sit4 background
Gene.briefDescription: Negative regulatory subunit of protein phosphatase 1 Ppz1p
Gene.description: Negative regulatory subunit of protein phosphatase 1 Ppz1p; involved in coenzyme A biosynthesis; subunit of the phosphopantothenoylcysteine decarboxylase (PPCDC; Cab3p, Sis2p, Vhs3p) complex and the CoA-Synthesizing Protein Complex (CoA-SPC: Cab2p, Cab3p, Cab4p, Cab5p, Sis2p and Vhs3p)
Dubious open reading frame; unlikely to encode a functional protein, based on available experimental and comparative sequence data

Gene.name: Anaphase Spindle Elongation
Gene.phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutation causes abnormal spindle morphology and defects in cytokinesis; overexpression leads to delayed cell cycle passage through the metaphase-anaphase transition; in systematic studies null mutants display shortened chronological lifespan, decreased competitive fitness in rich medium, and increased sensitivity to mutliple chemicals, including amitrole, bleomycin, caffeine, camptothecin, fluconazole
Gene.briefDescription: Mitotic spindle midzone-localized microtubule bundling protein
Gene.description: Mitotic spindle midzone-localized microtubule bundling protein; microtubule-associated protein (MAP) family member; required for spindle elongation and stabilization; undergoes cell cycle-regulated degradation by anaphase promoting complex; potential Cdc28p substrate; relative distribution to microtubules decreases upon DNA replication stress

Gene.name: LD phospholipase
Gene.description: Phospholipase; contains lipase specific GXSXG motif; maintains lipid droplet (LD) morphology; induced by transcription factor Rpn4p; protein abundance increases in response to DNA replication stress

Gene.name: Casein Kinase Alpha' subunit
Gene.briefDescription: Alpha' catalytic subunit of casein kinase 2 (CK2)
Gene.description: Alpha' catalytic subunit of casein kinase 2 (CK2); CK2 is a Ser/Thr protein kinase with roles in cell growth and proliferation; CK2, comprised of CKA1, CKA2, CKB1 and CKB2, has many substrates including transcription factors and all RNA polymerases; protein abundance increases in response to DNA replication stress; regulates Fkh1p-mediated donor preference during mating-type switching

Gene.functionSummary: Protein whose biological role is unknown; localizes to the nucleus and cytoplasm in a large-scale study|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.description: Protein of unknown function; similar to Reg1p; expression regulated by glucose and Rgt1p; GFP-fusion protein is induced in response to the DNA-damaging agent MMS; YOR062C has a paralog, YKR075C, that arose from the whole genome duplication

Gene.name: Yeast iNG1 homolog
Gene.functionSummary: Methylated histone-binding subunit of the NuA3 histone acetyltransferase complex involved in chromatin modification and positive regulation of RNA polymerase II transcription|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; overexpression causes slow growth and abnormal silencing; null mutant has decreased fitness, abnormal vacuolar morphology, and is sensitive to 6-azauracil, protein synthesis inbibitor cycloheximide, and herbicide amitrole
Gene.briefDescription: Subunit of the NuA3 histone acetyltransferase complex
Gene.description: Subunit of the NuA3 histone acetyltransferase complex; this complex acetylates histone H3; contains PHD finger domain that interacts with methylated histone H3; shares significant sequence identity with the human candidate tumor suppressor p33-ING1 in C-terminal region

Gene.name: CYTochrome c1
Gene.description: Cytochrome c1; component of the mitochondrial respiratory chain; expression is regulated by the heme-activated, glucose-repressed Hap2p/3p/4p/5p CCAAT-binding complex

Gene.name: Mbf and Sbf Associated
Gene.briefDescription: Activator of G1-specific transcription factors MBF and SBF
Gene.description: Activator of G1-specific transcription factors MBF and SBF; involved in regulation of the timing of G1-specific gene transcription and cell cycle initiation; localization is cell-cycle dependent and regulated by Cdc28p phosphorylation; MSA1 has a paralog, MSA2, that arose from the whole genome duplication

Gene.name: Asparagine-Linked Glycosylation
Gene.phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutant is sensitive to reducing agents such as mercaptoethanol and DTT and displays under-glycosylation of secreted proteins; in large-scale studies, the null mutant requires myo-inositol, displays rounded cell shape and decreased competitive fitness, and has altered sensitivity to a variety of chemicals
Gene.description: Glucosyl transferase; involved in N-linked glycosylation; adds glucose to the dolichol-linked oligosaccharide precursor prior to transfer to protein during lipid-linked oligosaccharide biosynthesis; similar to Alg6p; human homolog ALG8 can complement yeast null mutant
GO.Slim: transferase activity;transferase activity, transferring glycosyl groups

Gene.name: VAcuolar Morphogenesis
Gene.description: Protein involved in vacuole morphogenesis; acts at an early step of homotypic vacuole fusion that is required for vacuole tethering

Gene.name: Vacuolar Protein Sorting
Gene.functionSummary: Endosomal phosphatidylinositol-3-phosphate binding retromer complex subunit involved in retrograde transport of membrane-bounded vesicles from endosomes back to the trans-Golgi network where they are recycled for further rounds of transport|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.description: Nexin-1 homolog; required for localizing membrane proteins from a prevacuolar/late endosomal compartment back to late Golgi; structural component of retromer membrane coat complex; forms a retromer subcomplex with Vps17p; required for recruiting the retromer complex to the endosome membranes; VPS5 has a paralog, YKR078W, that arose from the whole genome duplication

Gene.name: Gtpase-activating protein for YPt1p
Gene.briefDescription: Cis-golgi GTPase-activating protein (GAP) for yeast Rabs
Gene.description: Cis-golgi GTPase-activating protein (GAP) for yeast Rabs; the Rab family members are Ypt1p (in vivo) and for Ypt1p, Sec4p, Ypt7p, and Ypt51p (in vitro); involved in vesicle docking and fusion

Gene.name: Nicotinamide Riboside Transporter
Gene.description: High-affinity nicotinamide riboside transporter; also transports thiamine with low affinity; major transporter for 5-aminoimidazole-4-carboxamide-1-beta-D-ribofuranoside (acadesine) uptake; shares sequence similarity with Thi7p and Thi72p; proposed to be involved in 5-fluorocytosine sensitivity

Dubious open reading frame; unlikely to encode a functional protein, based on available experimental and comparative sequence data; partially overlaps the dubious gene YOR072W-A; diploid deletion strains are methotrexate, paraquat and wortmannin sensitive

Gene.name: SuperKIller
Gene.briefDescription: GTP-binding protein that couples the Ski complex and exosome
Gene.description: GTP-binding protein that couples the Ski complex and exosome; putative pseudo-translational GTPase involved in 3'-to-5' mRNA decay pathway; interacts with both the cytoplasmic exosome and the Ski complex; eRF3-like domain targets nonstop mRNA for degradation; null mutants have a superkiller phenotype; SKI7 has a paralog, HBS1, that arose from the whole genome duplication

Gene.name: BUD site selection
Gene.briefDescription: Component of small ribosomal subunit (SSU) processosome
Gene.description: Component of small ribosomal subunit (SSU) processosome; this complex contains U3 snoRNA; required at post-transcriptional step for efficient retrotransposition; absence results in decreased Ty1 Gag:GFP protein levels; originally isolated as bud-site selection mutant that displays a random budding pattern

Gene.name: AnTioXidant
Gene.functionSummary: Manganese ion transmembrane transporter involved in manganese ion homeostasis; localizes to the Golgi membrane|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.briefDescription: Golgi membrane protein involved in manganese homeostasis
Gene.description: Golgi membrane protein involved in manganese homeostasis; overproduction suppresses the sod1 (copper, zinc superoxide dismutase) null mutation

Gene.name: Digs Into Agar
Gene.description: Origin-binding F-box protein; forms SCF ubiquitin ligase complex with Skp1p and Cdc53p; functions in ubiquitylation of silent chromatin structural protein Sir4p; required to target Cdc6p for destruction during G1 phase; required for deactivation of Rad53 checkpoint kinase, completion of DNA replication during recovery from DNA damage, assembly of RSC complex, RSC-mediated transcription regulation, and nucleosome positioning; involved in invasive and pseudohyphal growth

Gene.name: TriacylGlycerol Lipase
Gene.briefDescription: Bifunctional triacylglycerol lipase and LPA acyltransferase
Gene.description: Bifunctional triacylglycerol lipase and LPA acyltransferase; lipid particle-localized triacylglycerol (TAG) lipase involved in triacylglycerol mobilization; catalyzes acylation of lysophosphatidic acid (LPA); potential Cdc28p substrate; TGL5 has a paralog, TGL4, that arose from the whole genome duplication
Dubious open reading frame; unlikely to encode a functional protein, based on available experimental and comparative sequence data; partially overlaps the verified gene YOR083W

Gene.name: WHIskey
Gene.functionSummary: Transcription cofactor that represses transcription during the G1/S mitotic transition; component of the SBF transcription complex; localizes to both the cytoplasm and nucleus|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.description: Repressor of G1 transcription; binds to SCB binding factor (SBF) at SCB target promoters in early G1; dilution of Whi5p concentration during cell growth determines cell size; phosphorylation of Whi5p by the CDK, Cln3p/Cdc28p relieves repression and promoter binding by Whi5, and contributes to both the determination of critical cell size at START and cell fate; periodically expressed in G1

Gene.name: Lipase of PeroXisomes
Gene.description: Peroxisomal matrix-localized lipase; required for normal peroxisome morphology; contains a peroxisomal targeting signal type 1 (PTS1) and a lipase motif; peroxisomal import requires the PTS1 receptor, Pex5p and self-interaction; transcriptionally activated by Yrm1p along with genes involved in multidrug resistance; oleic acid inducible

Gene.name: OligoSaccharylTransferase
Gene.briefDescription: Gamma subunit of the oligosaccharyltransferase complex of the ER lumen
Gene.description: Gamma subunit of the oligosaccharyltransferase complex of the ER lumen; complex catalyzes asparagine-linked glycosylation of newly synthesized proteins; Ost3p is important for N-glycosylation of a subset of proteins
GO.Slim: transferase activity;transferase activity, transferring glycosyl groups

Gene.name: Three Calcium and lipid Binding domains (TriCalBins)
Gene.briefDescription: Lipid-binding ER protein involved in ER-plasma membrane tethering
Gene.description: Lipid-binding ER protein involved in ER-plasma membrane tethering; one of 6 proteins (Ist2p, Scs2p, Scs22p, Tcb1p, Tcb2p, Tcb3p) that connect ER to plasma membrane and regulate PI4P levels by controlling access of Sac1p phosphatase to its substrate PI4P in PM; contains 3 calcium and lipid binding domains; non-tagged protein also localizes to mitochondria; C-termini of Tcb1p, Tcb2p and Tcb3p interact; TCB1 has a paralog, TCB2, that arose from the whole genome duplication

Gene.name: Yeast Vacuolar Conductance
Gene.functionSummary: Voltage-gated ion channel of the vacuolar membrane; active for calcium, potassium, and sodium; involved in cellular cation homeostasis|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutants have moderate defect in vacuolar fragmentation, increased competitive fitness in glycerol; heterozygous diploid nulls are haploinsufficient
Gene.description: Vacuolar cation channel; mediates release of Ca(2+) from the vacuole in response to hyperosmotic shock

Merged open reading frame; does not encode a discrete protein; YOR088W was originally annotated as an independent ORF, but as a result of a sequence change, it was merged with an adjacent ORF into a single reading frame, designated YOR087W

Gene.name: Vacuolar Protein Sorting
Gene.description: Endosomal Rab family GTPase; required for endocytic transport and sorting of vacuolar hydrolases; required for endosomal localization of the CORVET complex; required with YPT52 for MVB biogenesis and sorting; involved in autophagy and ionic stress tolerance; geranylgeranylation required for membrane association; protein abundance increases in response to DNA replication stress; mammalian Rab5 homolog; VPS21 has a paralog, YPT53, that arose from the whole genome duplication

Gene.name: Phosphatase Two C
Gene.description: Mitochondrial type 2C protein phosphatase (PP2C); involved in regulation of pyruvate dehydrogenase activity by dephosphorylating the serine 133 of the Pda1p subunit; localizes to the intermembrane space and is imported via the presequence pathway and processed by the inner membrane protease (Imp1p-Imp2p); acts in concert with kinases Pkp1p and Pkp2p and phosphatase Ptc6p

Gene.name: Translation Machinery Associated
Gene.briefDescription: Protein of unknown function that associates with translating ribosomes
Gene.description: Protein of unknown function that associates with translating ribosomes; interacts with GTPase Rbg1p

Gene.name: ExtraCellular Mutant
Gene.description: Non-essential protein of unknown function; involved in signal transduction and the genotoxic response; induced rapidly in response to treatment with 8-methoxypsoralen and UVA irradiation; relocalizes from ER to cytoplasm upon DNA replication stress; ECM3 has a paralog, YNL095C, that arose from the whole genome duplication

Gene.name: Changed Mutation Rate
Gene.description: Putative protein of unknown function; deletion causes sensitivity to unfolded protein response-inducing agents

Gene.name: ADP-Ribosylation Factor
Gene.phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutant has abnormalities in polarization of actin cortical patches and abnormal budding pattern; null mutation in in Sigma1278b reduces invasive growth
Gene.description: Glucose-repressible ADP-ribosylation factor; GTPase of Ras superfamily involved in regulating cell polarity and invasive growth; localizes to dynamic spots at plasma membrane and modulates PtdIns(4,5)P2 levels to facilitate endocytosis; required for localization of endocytic protein Lsb5p to correct cortical site in cells; also has mRNA binding activity; homolog of mammalian Arf6
GO.Slim: GTPase activity;RNA binding;enzyme regulator activity;hydrolase activity;mRNA binding

Gene.name: Ribosomal Protein of the Small subunit
Gene.functionSummary: Subunit of the cytosolic small ribosomal subunit; involved in ribosome biogenesis, and translation|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.briefDescription: Protein component of the small (40S) ribosomal subunit
Gene.description: Protein component of the small (40S) ribosomal subunit; interacts with Kti11p; deletion causes hypersensitivity to zymocin; homologous to mammalian ribosomal protein S7, no bacterial homolog; RPS7A has a paralog, RPS7B, that arose from the whole genome duplication
GO.Slim: structural constituent of ribosome;structural molecule activity

Gene.description: Mitochondrial inner membrane carnitine transporter; required for carnitine-dependent transport of acetyl-CoA from peroxisomes to mitochondria during fatty acid beta-oxidation; human homolog SLC25A20 complements yeast null mutant

Gene.name: homologous to RAS proto-oncogene
Gene.phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutant has decreased chronological and increased replicative lifespan; null mutant has a decreased rate of growth on various nitrogen sources, decreased starvation resistance, and increased competitive fitness in minimal medium; overexpression increases invasive growth, and a dominant interfering allele results in a growth defect in the absence of cAMP
Gene.briefDescription: GTPase involved in G-protein signaling in adenylate cyclase activation

Gene.functionSummary: Protein whose biological role and cellular location are unknown|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.description: Protein of unknown function; expressed at both mRNA and protein levels

Gene.functionSummary: Protein whose biological role and cellular location are unknown|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311

Gene.functionSummary: Protein whose biological role and cellular location are unknown|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.description: Putative protein of unknown function; null mutant is viable

Gene.description: Arf3p polarization-specific docking factor; required for the polarized distribution of the ADP-ribosylation factor, Arf3p; participates in polarity development and maintenance of a normal haploid budding pattern; interacts with Cnm7p

Gene.description: Subunit of the membrane-associated retromer complex; essential for endosome-to-Golgi retrograde protein transport; peripheral membrane protein that assembles onto the membrane with Vps5p to promote vesicle formation; required for recruiting the retromer complex to the endosome membranes

Gene.description: Dynamin-like GTPase that mediates homotypic ER fusion; has a role in ER morphology; interacts physically and genetically with Yop1p and Rtn1p; functional ortholog of the human atlastin ATL1, defects in which cause a form of the human disease hereditary spastic paraplegia; homolog of Arabidopsis RHD3

Gene.description: Zinc finger transcription factor involved in multidrug resistance; Zn(2)-Cys(6) zinc finger transcription factor; activates genes involved in multidrug resistance; paralog of Yrr1p, acting on an overlapping set of target genes

Gene.description: Mitochondrial GTPase, present in complex with Ugo1p and Fzo1p; required for mitochondrial morphology, fusion, and genome maintenance; promotes membrane bending; exists as long and short form with different distributions; ratio of long to short forms is regulated by Psd1p; homolog of human OPA1 involved in autosomal dominant optic atrophy

Gene.name: Something About Silencing
Gene.briefDescription: Subunit of the SAS complex (Sas2p, Sas4p, Sas5p)
Gene.description: Subunit of the SAS complex (Sas2p, Sas4p, Sas5p); acetylates free histones and nucleosomes and regulates transcriptional silencing; stimulates Sas2p HAT activity

Gene.phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutant displays decreased competitive fitness in minimal medium and heterozygous diploid null has decreased starvation resistance after low nutrient stress; null mutant has a reduced frequency of spontaneous mitochondrial genome loss

Gene.name: Regulator of CalciNeurin
Gene.functionSummary: Protein whose biological role is unknown; localizes to the cytoplasm in a large-scale study|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311

Gene.name: Malonyl-CoA:ACP Transferase
Gene.description: Predicted malonyl-CoA:ACP transferase; putative component of a type-II mitochondrial fatty acid synthase that produces intermediates for phospholipid remodeling

Gene.name: OxoDicarboxylate Carrier
Gene.description: Mitochondrial inner membrane transporter; 2-oxodicarboxylate transporter, exports 2-oxoadipate and 2-oxoglutarate from the mitochondrial matrix to the cytosol for use in lysine and glutamate biosynthesis and in lysine catabolism; ODC2 has a paralog, ODC1, that arose from the whole genome duplication

Gene.description: Subunit of the DSC ubiquitin ligase complex; protein of unknown function that localizes to the ER and vacuole lumen; overexpression affects endocytic protein trafficking; ortholog of fission yeast dsc3

Gene.name: IscU homolog
Gene.phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutant shows decreased respiratory growth, reduced biofilm formation, shortened chronological lifespan and lower competitive fitness

Gene.description: Mitochondrial protein required for iron-sulfur protein synthesis; performs scaffolding function during Fe/S cluster assembly; involved in Fe-S cluster assembly for both mitochondrial and cytosolic proteins; protein abundance increases under DNA replication stress; ISU2 has a paralog, ISU1, that arose from the whole genome duplication; isu1 isu2 double mutant is inviable; human homolog ISCU implicated in mitochondrial myopathy, can complement isu1 isu2 double mutant

Gene.name: Mdm10 Complementing Protein

Gene.description: Mitochondrial protein of unknown function involved in lipid homeostasis; integral membrane protein that localizes to the mitochondrial outer membrane; involved in mitochondrial morphology; interacts genetically with MDM10, and other members of the ERMES complex; contains five predicted transmembrane domains

Gene.name: WD repeat containing Transcriptional Modulator
Gene.functionSummary: Sequence-specifc DNA-binding transcription factor that represses chromatin silencing and meiotic transcription; involved in the response to DNA damage|uniprot_proteome=UP000002311
Gene.description: Transcriptional modulator; involved in regulation of meiosis, silencing, and expression of RNR genes; involved in response to replication stress; contains WD repeats; relocalizes to the cytosol in response to hypoxia; WTM2 has a paralog, UME1, that arose from the whole genome duplication
